I . GOODS FOR WHICH A MOVEMENT CERTIFICATE A.G.1 MAY BE ENDORSED  
1 . A MOVEMENT CERTIFICATE A.G.1 MAY BE ENDORSED ONLY FOR GOODS WHICH
column73: IN THE EXPORTING MEMBER COUNTRY (*)
column74: FALL WITHIN ONE OF THE FOLLOWING CATEGORIES :  \n ( A ) GOODS PRODUCED IN THAT EXPORTING MEMBER COUNTRY
column75: INCLUDING THOSE OBTAINED OR PRODUCED WHOLLY OR PARTLY FROM PRODUCTS ON WHICH THE APPLICABLE CUSTOMS DUTIES OR CHARGES HAVING EQUIVALENT EFFECT HAVE BEEN LEVIED IN THAT MEMBER COUNTRY AND WHICH HAVE NOT BENEFITED FROM A TOTAL OR PARTIAL DRAWBACK OF SUCH DUTIES OR CHANGES ;  \n ( B ) GOODS IN FREE CIRCULATION IN THAT EXPORTING MEMBER COUNTRY
column76: WITHIN THE MEANING OF ARTICLE 7 ( 2 ) OF THE AGREEMENT ( GOODS COMING FROM A THIRD COUNTRY
column77: IN RESPECT OF WHICH IMPORT FORMALITIES HAVE BEEN COMPLIED WITH AND ANY CUSTOMS DUTIES OR CHARGES HAVING EQUIVALENT EFFECT HAVE BEEN LEVIED IN THAT MEMBER COUNTRY
column78: AND WHICH HAVE NOT BENEFITED FROM A TOTAL OR PARTIAL DRAWBACK OF SUCH DUTIES OR CHARGES ) ;  \n ( C ) GOODS OBTAINED OR PRODUCED WITHIN THAT EXPORTING MEMBER COUNTRY
column79: AND IN THE MANUFACTURE OF WHICH HAVE BEEN USED PRODUCTS ON WHICH THE APPLICABLE CUSTOMS DUTIES OR CHARGES HAVING EQUIVALENT EFFECT HAVE NOT BEEN LEVIED IN THAT MEMBER COUNTRY OR PRODUCTS WHICH HAVE BENEFITED FROM A TOTAL OR PARTIAL DRAWBACK OF SUCH DUTIES OR CHARGES
column80: SUBJECT TO THE COLLECTION
column81: WHERE APPROPRIATE
column82: OF THE COMPENSATORY LEVY PRESCRIBED FOR THOSE GOODS IN ARTICLE 8 OF THE AGREEMENT ;  \nNOTE : THE STATEMENT \" COMPENSATORY LEVY - GREECE \" MUST APPEAR ON ALL MOVEMENT CERTIFICATES A.G.1 FOR GOODS OBTAINED OR PRODUCED IN THE MEMBER STATES OF THE EEC FROM PRODUCTS COMING FROM A THIRD COUNTRY ON WHICH THE APPLICABLE CUSTOMS DUTIES AND CHARGES HAVING EQUIVALENT EFFECT HAVE NOT BEEN LEVIED IN ANY MEMBER STATE .  \n ( D ) GOODS ORIGINALLY IMPORTED FROM A MEMBER COUNTRY WHICH ON EXPORTATION FALL WITHIN ONE OF THE CATEGORIES  ( A )
column83: ( B ) OR ( C ) ABOVE .  \nNOTE : IN THE CASE OF GOODS ORIGINALLY IMPORTED INTO THE EXPORTING MEMBER COUNTRY UNDER THE COVER OF A MOVEMENT CERTIFICATE BEARING THE STATEMENT \" COMPENSATORY LEVY - GREECE \"
column84:
THE MOVEMENT CERTIFICATE OR CERTIFICATES A.G.1 ISSUED IN LIEU OF THE LATTER MUST ALSO BEAR THE STATEMENT " COMPENSATORY LEVY - GREECE " .  
2 . MOVEMENT CERTIFICATES A.G.1 MAY NOT BE ENDORSED FOR GOODS EXPORTED FROM A MEMBER COUNTRY TO ANOTHER MEMBER COUNTRY WHEN THESE GOODS :  
 ( A ) COME WITHIN THE PROVINCE OF THE EUROPEAN COAL AND STEEL COMMUNITY ;  
 ( B ) WERE ORIGINALLY IMPORTED FROM A COUNTRY NOT PARTY TO THE ASSOCIATION TO THE EXPORTING MEMBER COUNTRY UNDER A PREFERENTIAL SYSTEM BECAUSE OF THEIR COUNTRY OF ORIGIN OR PLACE OF CONSIGNMENT .  
II . SCOPE OF THE MOVEMENT CERTIFICATE A.G.1  
THE MOVEMENT CERTIFICATE A.G.1 MAY BE USED ONLY IF THE GOODS TO WHICH IT RELATES ARE TRANSPORTED DIRECT FROM THE EXPORTING MEMBER COUNTRY TO THE IMPORTING MEMBER COUNTRY .  
THE FOLLOWING SHALL BE CONSIDERED AS TRANSPORTED DIRECT FROM THE EXPORTING MEMBER COUNTRY TO THE IMPORTING MEMBER COUNTRY :  
 ( A ) GOODS TRANSPORTED WITHOUT PASSING THROUGH THE TERRITORY OF A COUNTRY NOT PARTY TO THE ASSOCIATION ;  
 ( B ) GOODS TRANSPORTED THROUGH THE TERRITORY OF ONE OR MORE COUNTRIES WHICH ARE NOT PARTIES TO THE ASSOCIATION PROVIDED THAT CARRIAGE THROUGH SUCH COUNTRIES IS COVERED BY A SINGLE TRANSPORT DOCUMENT MADE OUT IN A MEMBER COUNTRY .  
NOTE : BEFORE REQUESTING ENDORSEMENT OF MOVEMENT CERTIFICATE A.G.1 BY THE CUSTOMS AUTHORITIES OF THE EXPORTING MEMBER COUNTRY
column85: THE EXPORTER MUST SATISFY HIMSELF THAT THE GOODS WILL IN FACT BE TRANSPORTED DIRECT TO THE IMPORTING MEMBER COUNTRY . GOODS NOT TRANSPORTED DIRECT ARE ELIGIBLE FOR PREFERENTIAL TREATMENT ONLY IF A MOVEMENT CERTIFICATE A.G.1 IS PRODUCED .  \nIII . RULES FOR COMPLETING THE MOVEMENT CERTIFICATE A.G.1  \n1 . THE MOVEMENT CERTIFICATE A.G.1 MUST BE COMPLETED IN THE LANGUAGE OF THE EXPORTING MEMBER COUNTRY OR IN ONE OF THE LANGUAGES OF THAT COUNTRY . WHERE THE EXPORTING MEMBER COUNTRY IS GREECE
column86: IT MAY ALSO BE COMPLETED IN ONE OF THE OFFICIAL LANGUAGES OF THE EUROPEAN ECONOMIC COMMUNITY .  \n2 . THE MOVEMENT CERTIFICATE A.G.1 MUST BE TYPED OR HANDWRITTEN ; IF THE LATTER
column87:
IT MUST BE COMPLETED IN INK IN BLOCK LETTERS . IT MUST NOT CONTAIN ANY ERASURE OR SUPERIMPOSED CORRECTION . ANY ALTERATION MUST BE MADE BY DELETING THE INCORRECT PARTICULARS AND ADDING ANY CORRECTIONS . ANY SUCH ALTERATION MUST BE INITIALED BY THE PERSON WHO COMPLETED THE CERTIFICATE AND ENDORSED BY THE CUSTOMS AUTHORITIES .  
3 . EACH ITEM LISTED ON THE MOVEMENT CERTIFICATE A.G.1 MUST BE PRECEDED BY A SERIAL NUMBER . A HORIZONTAL LINE MUST BE DRAWN IMMEDIATELY AFTER THE LAST ENTRY . UNUSED SPACE MUST BE STRUCK THROUGH SO AS TO MAKE ANY LATER ADDITION IMPOSSIBLE .  
4 . GOODS MUST BE DESCRIBED IN ACCORDANCE WITH COMMERCIAL USAGE AND IN SUFFICIENT DETAIL TO ENABLE THEM TO BE IDENTIFIED .  
5 . THE EXPORTER OR THE CARRIER MAY COMPLETE THE PART OF THE CERTIFICATE RESERVED FOR THE DECLARATION BY THE EXPORTER BY A REFERENCE TO THE TRANSPORT DOCUMENT . IT IS ALSO RECOMMENDED THAT THE EXPORTER OR THE CARRIER SHOW ON THE TRANSPORT DOCUMENT COVERING THE DISPATCH OF THE GOODS THE SERIAL NUMBER OF THE MOVEMENT CERTIFICATE A.G.1 .  
IV . EFFECT OF THE MOVEMENT CERTIFICATE A.G.1  
WHEN CORRECTLY USED
column88: THE MOVEMENT CERTIFICATE A.G.1 ENABLES THE GOODS DESCRIBED THEREIN TO BENEFIT IN THE IMPORTING MEMBER COUNTRY FROM THE PROGRESSIVE ELIMINATION OF CUSTOMS DUTIES
column89: QUANTITATIVE RESTRICTIONS AND ALL OTHER MEASURES HAVING EQUIVALENT EFFECT . HOWEVER
column90: WHEN THE MOVEMENT CERTIFICATE BEARS THE STATEMENT  \" COMPENSATORY LEVY - GREECE \"
column91: GOODS DESCRIBED THEREIN SHALL NOT BE ELIGIBLE FOR THIS PREFERENTIAL TREATMENT IN THE MEMBER STATES OF THE EEC .  \nTHE CUSTOMS AUTHORITIES OF THE IMPORTING MEMBER COUNTRY MAY
column92: IF THEY CONSIDER IT NECESSARY
column93: REQUIRE ANY OTHER DOCUMENTARY EVIDENCE AND IN PARTICULAR TRANSPORT DOCUMENTS UNDER COVER OF WHICH THE GOODS WERE DISPATCHED .  \nV . TIME LIMIT FOR SUBMISSION OF THE MOVEMENT CERTIFICATE A.G.1  \nTHE MOVEMENT CERTIFICATE A.G.1 MUST BE PRODUCED AT THE CUSTOMS OFFICE OF THE IMPORTING MEMBER COUNTRY WHERE THE GOODS ARE PRESENTED WITHIN A PERIOD OF ONE MONTH FROM THE DATE OF ENDORSEMENT . THIS PERIOD MAY
column94: HOWEVER
column95:
BE EXTENDED TO TWO MONTHS IN CASES WHERE THE GOODS ARE TRANSPORTED WHOLLY OR PARTLY BY SEA .  
(*) THE MEMBER COUNTRIES ARE :  
 ( A ) THE MEMBER STATES OF THE EEC ;  
 ( B ) THE KINGDOM OF GREECE .

column101: AS PROVIDED FOR UNDER NOTE I ( 1 ) ( C ) AND ( D ) ON THE LAST PAGE OF THIS CERTIFICATE .  \n( 3 ) SEE NOTES ON THE LAST PAGE OF THIS CERTIFICATE .  \n( 4 ) IN THIS SPACE THE CUSTOMS AUTHORITIES OF THE PLACE OF EXPORTATION SHOULD GIVE THE RESULTS OF THEIR EXAMINATION WITH ANY DETAILS WHICH MAY FACILITATE IDENTIFICATION OF THE GOODS . THEY MUST ALSO INDICATE ANY SPECIAL IDENTIFICATION MEASURES SUCH AS SEALING
column102: STAMPING
column103: ETC .
column104: WHICH THEY HAVE TAKEN . WHERE SUPPORTING ITEMS OF THE TYPE REFERRED TO IN THE SECOND PARAGRAPH OF NOTE III ( 5 ) OVERLEAF  ( PHOTOGRAPHS
column105: PLANS
column106: SAMPLES OF WOVEN FABRIC
column107: ETC . ) ARE ATTACHED
column108:
THE CUSTOMS OFFICE MUST STAMP THEM IN SUCH A WAY THAT A PART OF THE OFFICIAL STAMP IS IMPRINTED ON THE ACTUAL CERTIFICATE A.G.3 .  
SPACES NOT USED MUST BE STRUCK THROUGH IN ORDER TO PREVENT LATER ADDITIONS .  
( 5 ) DELETE AS NECESSARY .  
I . GOODS FOR WHICH A MOVEMENT CERTIFICATE A.G.3 MAY BE ENDORSED  
1 . A MOVEMENT CERTIFICATE A.G.3 MAY BE ENDORSED ONLY FOR GOODS WHICH
column109: IN THE EXPORTING MEMBER COUNTRY (*)
column110: FALL WITHIN ONE OF THE FOLLOWING CATEGORIES :  \n ( A ) GOODS PRODUCED IN THAT EXPORTING MEMBER COUNTRY
column111: INCLUDING THOSE OBTAINED OR PRODUCED WHOLLY OR PARTLY FROM PRODUCTS ON WHICH THE APPLICABLE CUSTOMS DUTIES OR CHARGES HAVING EQUIVALENT EFFECT HAVE BEEN LEVIED IN THAT MEMBER COUNTRY AND WHICH HAVE NOT BENEFITED FROM A TOTAL OR PARTIAL DRAWBACK OF SUCH DUTIES OR CHARGES ;  \n ( B ) GOODS IN FREE CIRCULATION IN THAT EXPORTING MEMBER COUNTRY
column112: WITHIN THE MEANING OF ARTICLE 7 ( 2 ) OF THE AGREEMENT ( GOODS COMING FROM A THIRD COUNTRY
column113: IN RESPECT OF WHICH IMPORT FORMALITIES HAVE BEEN COMPLIED WITH AND ANY CUSTOMS DUTIES OR CHARGES HAVING EQUIVALENT EFFECT HAVE BEEN LEVIED IN THAT MEMBER COUNTRY
column114: AND WHICH HAVE NOT BENEFITED FROM A TOTAL OR PARTIAL DRAWBACK OF SUCH DUTIES OR CHARGES ) ;  \n ( C ) GOODS OBTAINED OR PRODUCED WITHIN THAT EXPORTING MEMBER COUNTRY
column115: AND IN THE MANUFACTURE OF WHICH HAVE BEEN USED PRODUCTS ON WHICH THE APPLICABLE CUSTOMS DUTIES OR CHARGES HAVING EQUIVALENT EFFECT HAVE NOT BEEN LEVIED IN THAT MEMBER COUNTRY OR PRODUCTS WHICH HAVE BENEFITED FROM A TOTAL OR PARTIAL DRAWBACK OF SUCH DUTIES OR CHARGES
column116: SUBJECT TO THE COLLECTION
column117: WHERE APPROPRIATE
column118: OF THE COMPENSATORY LEVY PRESCRIBED FOR THOSE GOODS IN ARTICLE 8 OF THE AGREEMENT ;  \nNOTE : THE STATEMENT \" COMPENSATORY LEVY - GREECE \" MUST APPEAR ON ALL MOVEMENT CERTIFICATES A.G.3 FOR GOODS OBTAINED OR PRODUCED IN THE MEMBER STATES OF THE EEC FROM PRODUCTS COMING FROM A THIRD COUNTRY ON WHICH THE APPLICABLE CUSTOMS DUTIES AND CHARGES HAVING EQUIVALENT EFFECT HAVE NOT BEEN LEVIED IN ANY MEMBER STATE .  \n ( D ) GOODS ORIGINALLY IMPORTED FROM A MEMBER COUNTRY WHICH ON EXPORTATION FALL WITHIN ONE OF THE CATEGORIES  ( A )
column119: ( B ) OR ( C ) ABOVE .  \nNOTE : IN THE CASE OF GOODS ORIGINALLY IMPORTED INTO THE EXPORTING MEMBER COUNTRY UNDER THE COVER OF A MOVEMENT CERTIFICATE BEARING THE STATEMENT \" COMPENSATORY LEVY - GREECE \"
column120:
THE MOVEMENT CERTIFICATE OR CERTIFICATES A.G.3 ISSUED IN LIEU OF THE LATTER MUST ALSO BEAR THE STATEMENT " COMPENSATORY LEVY - GREECE " .  
2 . MOVEMENT CERTIFICATES A.G.3 MAY NOT BE ISSUED FOR GOODS EXPORTED FROM A MEMBER COUNTRY TO ANOTHER MEMBER COUNTRY WHEN THESE GOODS :  
 ( A ) COME WITHIN THE PROVINCE OF THE EUROPEAN COAL AND STEEL COMMUNITY ;  
 ( B ) WERE ORIGINALLY IMPORTED FROM A COUNTRY NOT PARTY TO THE ASSOCIATION TO THE EXPORTING MEMBER COUNTRY UNDER A PREFERENTIAL CUSTOMS SYSTEM BECAUSE OF THEIR COUNTRY OF ORIGIN OR PLACE OF CONSIGNMENT .  
II . SCOPE OF THE MOVEMENT CERTIFICATE A.G.3  
A MOVEMENT CERTIFICATE A.G.3 MAY BE USED IN ALL CASES WHERE A MOVEMENT CERTIFICATE A.G.1 CANNOT BE USED OWING TO THE FACT THAT THE GOODS ARE NOT TRANSPORTED DIRECT FROM THE EXPORTING MEMBER COUNTRY TO THE IMPORTING MEMBER COUNTRY .  
THE FOLLOWING SHALL BE CONSIDERED AS TRANSPORTED DIRECT FROM THE EXPORTING MEMBER COUNTRY TO THE IMPORTING MEMBER COUNTRY :  
 ( A ) GOODS TRANSPORTED WITHOUT PASSING THROUGH THE TERRITORY OF A COUNTRY NOT PARTY TO THE ASSOCIATION ;  
 ( B ) GOODS TRANSPORTED THROUGH THE TERRITORY OF ONE OR MORE COUNTRIES NOT PARTY TO THE ASSOCIATION PROVIDED THAT CARRIAGE THROUGH SUCH COUNTRIES IS COVERED BY A SINGLE TRANSPORT DOCUMENT MADE OUT IN A MEMBER COUNTRY .  
IN PARTICULAR
column121: THE MOVEMENT CERTIFICATE A.G.3 MAY BE USED FOR GOODS EXPORTED FROM A MEMBER COUNTRY TO A COUNTRY NOT PARTY TO THE ASSOCIATION
column122: FROM WHICH THEY ARE LIABLE TO BE RE-EXPORTED SUBSEQUENTLY TO A MEMBER COUNTRY .  \nIII . RULES FOR COMPLETING THE MOVEMENT CERTIFICATE A.G.3  \n1 . THE MOVEMENT CERTIFICATE A.G.3 MUST BE COMPLETED IN THE LANGUAGE OF THE EXPORTING MEMBER COUNTRY OR IN ONE OF THE LANGUAGES OF THAT COUNTRY . WHERE THE EXPORTING MEMBER COUNTRY IS GREECE
column123: IT MAY ALSO BE COMPLETED IN ONE OF THE OFFICIAL LANGUAGES OF THE EUROPEAN ECONOMIC COMMUNITY .  \n2 . THE MOVEMENT CERTIFICATE A.G.3 MUST BE TYPED OR HANDWRITTEN ; IF THE LATTER IT MUST BE COMPLETED IN INK IN BLOCK LETTERS . IT MUST NOT CONTAIN ANY ERASURE OR SUPERIMPOSED CORRECTION . ANY ALTERATION MUST BE MADE BY DELETING THE INCORRECT PARTICULARS AND ADDING ANY NECESSARY CORRECTIONS . ANY SUCH ALTERATION MUST BE INITIALED BY THE PERSON WHO COMPLETED THE CERTIFICATE AND ENDORSED BY THE CUSTOMS AUTHORITIES .  \n3 . THE \" DECLARATION BY THE EXPORTER \" ON THE SECOND PAGE OF THE MOVEMENT CERTIFICATE A.G.3 MUST BE COMPLETED IN FULL . IN PARTICULAR
column124: THE PLACE OF LOADING
column125:
THE DATE OF DISPATCH AND THE COUNTRY OF DESTINATION AT THE TIME OF EXPORT MUST BE STATED .  
4 . EACH ITEM LISTED ON THE MOVEMENT CERTIFICATE A.G.3 MUST BE PRECEDED BY A SERIAL NUMBER . A HORIZONTAL LINE MUST BE DRAWN IMMEDIATELY AFTER THE LAST ENTRY . UNUSED SPACE MUST BE STRUCK THROUGH SO AS TO MAKE ANY LATER ADDITION IMPOSSIBLE .  
5 . GOODS MUST BE DESCRIBED IN ACCORDANCE WITH COMMERCIAL USAGE AND IN GREAT DETAIL SO AS TO ENSURE THAT THEY CAN BE IDENTIFIED EASILY . THE DESCRIPTION OF THE GOODS MUST INCLUDE THE NUMBER OF THE TARIFF HEADING APPLICABLE TO EACH ITEM .  
THE EXPORTER MUST INCLUDE WITH THE MOVEMENT CERTIFICATE A.G.3 ALL DOCUMENTS SUCH AS PLANS
column126: DRAWINGS
column127: PHOTOGRAPHS OR COMMERCIAL PROSPECTUSES
column128: ETC .
column129: WHICH MAY HELP IDENTIFICATION . IF THEY CONSIDER IT NECESSARY
column130: THE CUSTOMS AUTHORITIES OF THE EXPORTING COUNTRY SHALL ANNEX THESE DOCUMENTS TO THE MOVEMENT CERTIFICATE A.G.3 .  \nIV . EFFECT OF THE MOVEMENT CERTIFICATE A.G.3  \nA MOVEMENT CERTIFICATE A.G.3 ENABLES THE GOODS DESCRIBED THEREIN TO BENEFIT FROM THE PROGRESSIVE ELIMINATION OF CUSTOMS DUTIES
column131: QUANTITATIVE RESTRICTIONS AND ALL OTHER MEASURES HAVING EQUIVALENT EFFECT WHERE THERE IS NO DOUBT THAT THE GOODS ACTUALLY IMPORTED ARE THOSE DESCRIBED IN THAT MOVEMENT CERTIFICATE A.G.3 . HOWEVER
column132: WHEN THE MOVEMENT CERTIFICATE A.G.3 BEARS THE STATEMENT  \" COMPENSATORY LEVY - GREECE \"
column133: GOODS DESCRIBED THEREIN SHALL NOT BE ELIGIBLE FOR THIS PREFERENTIAL TREATMENT IN THE MEMBER STATES OF THE EEC .  \nTHE CUSTOMS AUTHORITIES OF THE IMPORTING MEMBER COUNTRY MAY REQUIRE SUBMISSION OF ANY SUPPORTING EVIDENCE IF THEY CONSIDER THERE IS DOUBT AS TO THE IDENTITY OF THE GOODS AND MAY EXCLUDE THE GOODS FROM THE PROGRESSIVE ELIMINATION OF CUSTOMS DUTIES
column134:
QUANTITATIVE RESTRICTIONS AND ALL MEASURES HAVING EQUIVALENT EFFECT IF SATISFACTORY EVIDENCE CANNOT BE PRODUCED .  
V . TIME LIMIT FOR SUBMISSION OF THE MOVEMENT CERTIFICATE A.G.3  
THE MOVEMENT CERTIFICATE A.G.3 MUST BE SUBMITTED TO THE CUSTOMS AUTHORITIES OF THE IMPORTING MEMBER COUNTRY WITHIN A PERIOD OF SIX MONTHS FROM THE DATE OF ISSUE . IT SHALL BE VALID ONLY FOR THE QUANTITIES OF GOODS PRESENTED IN THAT MEMBER COUNTRY DURING THOSE SIX MONTHS .  
(*) THE MEMBER COUNTRIES ARE :  
 ( A ) THE MEMBER STATES OF THE EEC ;  
 ( B ) THE KINGDOM OF GREECE ."'

Convention concerning the International Commission for the Rhine (Berne Convention)
LE GOUVERNEMENT DE LA RÉPUBLIQUE FÉDÉRALE D''ALLEMAGNE
column17: \nLE GOUVERNEMENT DU GRAND-DUCH\u00c9 DE LUXEMBOURG
column19: \nLE GOUVERNEMENT DE LA CONF\u00c9D\u00c9RATION SUISSE
column20: \nET LA COMMUNAUT\u00c9 \u00c9CONOMIQUE EUROP\u00c9ENNE
column22: notamment \u00e0 la navigation et comme milieu r\u00e9cepteur d''eaux us\u00e9es;\nconvaincus que l''action internationale pour la protection des eaux du Rhin contre la pollution chimique doit \u00eatre appr\u00e9ci\u00e9e en relation avec les autres efforts d\u00e9ploy\u00e9s pour la protection des eaux du Rhin
column23: en particulier les efforts tendant \u00e0 la conclusion de conventions contre la pollution par les chlorures et la pollution thermique
column24: et que cette action fait partie des mesures progressives et coh\u00e9rentes pour prot\u00e9ger les eaux douces et les eaux de mer contre la pollution;\nconsid\u00e9rant l''action entreprise par la Communaut\u00e9 \u00e9conomique europ\u00e9enne pour la protection des eaux
column25: notamment dans le cadre de la directive du Conseil
column26: du 4 mai 1976
column27: concernant la pollution caus\u00e9e par certaines substances dangereuses d\u00e9vers\u00e9es dans le milieu aquatique de la Communaut\u00e9;\nse r\u00e9f\u00e9rant aux r\u00e9sultats des conf\u00e9rences minist\u00e9rielles
column28: qui se sont tenues les 25 et 26 octobre 1972 \u00e0 La Haye
column29: les 4 et 5 d\u00e9cembre 1973 \u00e0 Bonn et le 1er avril 1976 \u00e0 Paris
column30: au sujet de la protection du Rhin contre la pollution
column31:
SONT CONVENUS DE CE QUI SUIT:
Article premier
1. Les parties contractantes
column32: pour am\u00e9liorer la qualit\u00e9 des eaux du Rhin
column33: prennent
column34: conform\u00e9ment aux dispositions suivantes
column35: les mesures appropri\u00e9es pour:\na) \u00e9liminer la pollution des eaux de surface du bassin du Rhin par les substances dangereuses incluses dans les familles et groupes de substances figurant \u00e0 l''annexe I (ci-apr\u00e8s d\u00e9nomm\u00e9es \u00absubstances relevant de l''annexe I\u00bb). Elles se proposent d''atteindre
column36: progressivement
column37: l''\u00e9limination des rejets de ces substances en tenant compte des r\u00e9sultats des examens effectu\u00e9s par les experts concernant chacune d''entre elles
column38: ainsi que des moyens techniques disponibles;\nb) r\u00e9duire la pollution des eaux du Rhin par les substances dangereuses incluses dans les familles et groupes de substances figurant \u00e0 l''annexe II (ci-apr\u00e8s d\u00e9nomm\u00e9es \u00absubstances relevant de l''annexe II\u00bb).\n2. Les mesures vis\u00e9es au paragrafe 1 ci-dessus sont prises en tenant compte
column39: dans une mesure raisonnable
column42: parties \u00e0 la pr\u00e9sente convention
column43: font effectuer
column44: pour leur usage
column45: conform\u00e9ment aux dispositions du paragraphe 1 de l''annexe III
column46: un inventaire national des rejets dans les eaux de surface du bassin du Rhin qui peuvent contenir des substances relevant de l''annexe I auxquelles des normes d''\u00e9mission sont applicables.\n2. Les gouvernements communiquent \u00e0 la Commission internationale pour la protection du Rhin contre la pollution (ci-apr\u00e8s d\u00e9nomm\u00e9e \u00abla Commission internationale\u00bb)
column47: conform\u00e9ment aux dispositions du paragraphe 2 de l''annexe III
column48: les \u00e9l\u00e9ments de leur inventaire mis \u00e0 jour r\u00e9guli\u00e8rement et au moins tous les trois ans.\n3. Les propositions de la Commission internationale pr\u00e9vues au paragraphe 3 de l''article 6 peuvent comprendre
column49: si n\u00e9cessaire
column50: un inventaire de diverses substances relevant de l''annexe II.\nArticle 3\n1. Tout rejet effectu\u00e9 dans les eaux de surface du bassin du Rhin
column51: susceptible de contenir l''une des substances relevant de l''annexe I
column52: est soumis \u00e0 une autorisation pr\u00e9alable d\u00e9livr\u00e9e par l''autorit\u00e9 comp\u00e9tente du gouvernement concern\u00e9.\n2. Pour les rejets de ces substances dans les eaux de surface du bassin du Rhin et
column53: lorsque cela est n\u00e9cessaire aux fins de l''application de la pr\u00e9sente convention
column54: pour les rejets de ces substances dans les \u00e9gouts
column55: l''autorisation fixe des normes d''\u00e9mission qui ne peuvent d\u00e9passer les valeurs limites fix\u00e9es conform\u00e9ment \u00e0 l''article 5.\n3. En ce qui concerne les rejets existants de ces substances
column56:
l''autorisation fixe un délai pour le respect des conditions qu''elle prévoit. Ce délai ne peut excéder les limites fixées conforméments au paragraphe 3 de l''article 5.
4. L''autorisation ne peut être accordée que pour une durée limitée. Elle peut être renouvelée compte tenu des éventuelles modifications des valeurs limites visées à l''article 5.
Article 4
1. Les normes d''emission fixées par les autorisations délivrées en application de l''article 3 déterminent:
a) la concentration maximale admissible d''une substance dans les rejets. En cas de dilution
column57: la valeur limite pr\u00e9vue au paragraphe 2 sous a) de l''article 5 est \u00e0 diviser par le facteur de dilution;\nb) la quantit\u00e9 maximale admissible d''une substance dans les rejets pendant une ou plusieurs p\u00e9riodes d\u00e9termin\u00e9es. Si n\u00e9cessaire
column58: cette quantit\u00e9 maximale peut
column59: en outre
column60: \u00eatre exprim\u00e9e en unit\u00e9 de poids du polluant par unit\u00e9 d''\u00e9l\u00e9ment caract\u00e9ristique de l''activit\u00e9 polluante (par exemple
column61: unit\u00e9 de poids par mati\u00e8re premi\u00e8re ou par unit\u00e9 de produit).\n2. Si l''auteur du rejet d\u00e9clare qu''il n''est pas en mesure de respecter les normes d''\u00e9mission impos\u00e9es
column62: ou si l''autorit\u00e9 comp\u00e9tente du gouvernement concern\u00e9 constate cette impossibilit\u00e9
column63: l''autorisation est refus\u00e9e.\n3. Si les normes d''\u00e9mission ne sont pas respect\u00e9es
column64: l''autorit\u00e9 comp\u00e9tente du gouvernement concern\u00e9 prend toutes les m\u00e9sures utiles pour faire en sorte que les conditions de l''autorisation soient remplies et
column65: si n\u00e9cessaires
column66: que le rejet soit interdit.\nArticle 5\n1. La Commission Internationale propose les valeurs limites pr\u00e9vues au paragraphe 2 de l''article 3 et
column67: si n\u00e9cessaire
column68: leur application aux rejets dans les \u00e9gouts. Ces valeurs limites sont fix\u00e9es conform\u00e9ment \u00e0 la proc\u00e9dure pr\u00e9vue \u00e0 l''article 14. Apr\u00e8s leur adoption
column69:
elles sont incluses dans l''annexe IV.
2. Ces valeurs limites sont définies:
a) par la concentration maximale admissible d''une substance dans les rejets
et
column70: si cela est appropri\u00e9
column71: \nb) par la quantit\u00e9 maximale admissible d''une telle substance
column72: exprim\u00e9e en unit\u00e9 de poids du polluant par unit\u00e9 d''\u00e9l\u00e9ment caract\u00e9ristique de l''activit\u00e9 polluante (par exemple
column73: unit\u00e9 de poids par mati\u00e8re premi\u00e8re ou par unit\u00e9 de produit).\nSi cela est appropri\u00e9
column74: les valeurs lilites applicables aux effluents industriels sont fix\u00e9es par secteur et par type de produit.\nLes valeurs limites applicables aux substances relevant de l''annexe I sont d\u00e9termin\u00e9es principalement sur la base:\n- de la toxicit\u00e9
column75: \n- de la persistance
column76: \n- de la bioaccumulation
column77: \nen tenant compte des meilleurs moyens techniques disponibles.\n3. La Commission internationale propose aux parties contractantes les limites des d\u00e9lais vis\u00e9es au paragraphe 3 de l''article 3 en fonction des caract\u00e9ristiques propres aux secteurs industriels concern\u00e9s et
column78: le cas \u00e9ch\u00e9ant
column79: aux types de produit. Ces limites sont fix\u00e9es conform\u00e9ment \u00e0 la proc\u00e9dure pr\u00e9vue \u00e0 l''article 14.\n4. La Commission internationale utilise les r\u00e9sultats obtenus aux points de mesure internationaux pour \u00e9valuer dans quelle mesure la teneur des eaux du Rhin en substances relevant de l''annexe I varie apr\u00e8s application des dispositions pr\u00e9c\u00e9dentes.\n5. La Commission internationale peut
column80: si n\u00e9cessaire
column81: du point de vue de la qualit\u00e9 des eaux du Rhin
column82: proposer d''autres mesures destin\u00e9es \u00e0 r\u00e9duire la pollution des eaux du Rhin
column83: en tenant compte notamment de la toxicit\u00e9
column84: de la persistance et de la bioaccumulation de la substance consid\u00e9r\u00e9e. Ces propositions sont adopt\u00e9es conform\u00e9ment \u00e0 la proc\u00e9dure pr\u00e9vue \u00e0 l''article 14.\nArticle 6\n1. Tout rejet de l''une des substances relevant de l''annexe II
column85: susceptible d''affecter la qualit\u00e9 des eaux du Rhin
column86: doit faire l''objet d''une r\u00e9glementation par les autorit\u00e9s nationales aux fins d''une limitation s\u00e9v\u00e8re.\n2. Les gouvernements
column87: parties \u00e0 la pr\u00e9sente convention
column88: s''efforcent d''\u00e9tablir
column89: dans un d\u00e9lai de deux ans \u00e0 compter de l''entr\u00e9e en vigueur de la pr\u00e9sente convention
column90: des programmes nationaux de r\u00e9duction de la pollution des eaux du Rhin par les substances relevant de l''annexe II pour l''ex\u00e9cution desquels ils appliquent en particulier les moyens pr\u00e9vus aux paragraphes 1
column93: 6 et 7 du pr\u00e9sent article.\n3. Les parties contractantes se concertent au sein de la Commission internationale pr\u00e9alablement \u00e0 l''\u00e9tablissement de ces programmes nationaux. Dans ce but
column94:
la Commission internationale procède régulièrement à une comparaison des projets de programmes nationaux en vue d''assurer la cohérence des objectifs et des moyens de ces projets et présente des propositions en vue d''atteindre notamment des objectifs communs de réduction de la pollution des eaux du Rhin. Ces dernières propositions sont adoptées en application de la procédure prévue à l''article 14 de la présente convention. La comparaison des projets de programmes nationaux ne peut conduire à retarder la mise en oeuvre au niveau national ou régional des mesures destinées à réduire la pollution des eaux du Rhin.
4. Tout rejet susceptible de contenir l''une des substances relevant de l''annexe II est soumis à une autorisation préalable délivrée par l''autorité compétente du gouvernement concerné et fixant les normes d''émission. Celles-ci sont déterminées en fonction des objectifs de qualité prévus au paragraphe 5.
5. Les programmes visés au paragraphe 2 ci-dessus comprennent des objectis de qualité pour les eaux du Rhin.
6. Les programmes peuvent également contenir des dispositions spécifiques relatives à la composition et à l''emploi de substances ou groupes de substances ainsi que de produit
column95:
et tiennent compte des derniers progrès techniques économiquement réalisables.
7. Les programmes fixent les délais de leur mise en oeuvre.
8. Les programmes et les résultats de leur application sont communiqués à la Commission internationale sous forme résumée.
Article 7
1. Les parties contractantes prennent toutes les mesures législatives et réglementaires garantissant que la mise en dépôt des substances relevant des annexes I et II soit effectuée de telle manière qu''il n''y ait pas de menace de pollution pour les eaux du Rhin.
2. La Commission internationale propose
column96: si n\u00e9cessaire
column97:
aux parties contractantes des mesures appropriées relatives à la protection des eaux souterraines en vue de prévenir la pollution des eaux du Rhin par les substances relevant des annexes I et II.
Article 8
1. Les parties contractantes veillent à ce que les rejets soient contrôlés en application de la présente convention.
2. Elles informent annuellement la Commission internationale des expériences acquises.
Article 9
L''application des mesures prises en vertu de la présente convention ne peut en aucun cas avoir pour effet de permettre d''accroître directement ou indirectement la pollution des eaux du Rhin.
Article 10
1. En vue de contrôler la teneur des eaux du Rhin en substances relevant des annexes I et II
column98: chaque gouvernement concern\u00e9 prend \u00e0 sa charge aux stations de mesure convenues sur le Rhin l''installation et le fonctionnement d''appareils et de syst\u00e8mes de mesure
column99: servant \u00e0 d\u00e9terminer la concentration desdites substances.\n2. Chaque gouvernement concern\u00e9 informe r\u00e9guli\u00e8rement
column100: au moins une fois par an
column101:
la Commission internationale des résultats de ces contrôles.
3. La Commission internationale rédige un rapport annuel résumant les résultats des contrôles et permettant de suivre l''évolution de la qualité des eaux du Rhin.
Article 11
Lorsqu''un gouvernement
column102: partie \u00e0 la pr\u00e9sente convention
column103: constate dans les eaux du Rhin un accroissement soudain et notable des substances relevant des annexes I et II ou a connaissance d''un accident dont les cons\u00e9quences sont susceptibles de menacer gravement la qualit\u00e9 de ces eaux
column104:
il en informe sans retard la Commission internationale et les parties contractantes susceptibles d''en être affectées selon une procédure à élaborer par la Commission internationale.
Article 12
1. Les parties contractantes informent régulièrement la Commission internationale de leurs expériences acquises lors de l''application de la présente convention.
2. La Commission internationale formule
column105: le cas \u00e9ch\u00e9ant
column106: des recommandations
column107:
afin d''améliorer progressivement l''application de cette convention.
Article 13
La Commission internationale élabore des recommandations en vue d''atteindre des résultats comparables par l''emploi de méthodes appropriées de mesures et d''analyses.
Article 14
1. Les annexes I à IV qui font partie intégrante de la présente convention peuvent être modifiées et complétées en vue de les adapter au développement scientifique et technique ou d''améliorer l''efficacité de la lutte contre la pollution chimique des eaux du Rhin.
2. À cette fin
column108:
la Commission internationale recommande les modifications ou compléments qui lui paraissent utiles.
3. Les textes modifiés ou complétés entreront en vigueur après adoption unanime par les parties contractantes.
Article 15
Tout différend entre des parties contractantes relatif à l''interprétation ou à l''application de la présente convention et qui n''aura pu être réglé par voie de négociation est
column109: sauf si les parties au diff\u00e9rend en disposent autrement

Article 2
L''accord est modifié comme suit:

b) Le paragraphe 1 de l''article 4 est remplacé par le paragraphe suivant:
«1. Les modalités de l''exercice de la présidence de la Commission par les délégations sont déterminées par la Commission et sont insérées dans son règlement interieur; la délégation qui assume la présidence désigne un de ses membres comme président de la Commission».

«2. Dans un domaine relevant de ses compétences
column211:

Le paragraphe 2 de l''article 6 devient le paragraphe 3 de l''article 6.

OVEREENKOMST inzake de bescherming van de Rijn tegen chemische verontreiniging
DE REGERING VAN DE BONDSREPUBLIEK DUITSLAND
column230: \nDE REGERING VAN HET KONINKRIJK DER NEDERLANDEN
column233: \nVerwijzend naar de Overeenkomst van 29 april 1963 en de Aanvullende Overeenkomst van 3 december 1976 nopens de Internationale Commissie ter bescherming van de Rijn tegen verontreiniging
column234: \nOverwegende dat de chemische verontreiniging van het water van de Rijn de flora en de fauna hiervan bedreigt en tevens ongewenste uitwerkingen heeft op het zeewater
column235: \nZich bewust van de gevaren die hieruit kunnen voortvloeien voor bepaalde gebruiksdoeleinden van het water van de Rijn
column236: \nVerlangend de kwaliteit van het water van de Rijn te verbeteren met het oog op deze gebruiksdoeleinden
column237: \nOverwegende dat de Rijn tevens voor andere doeleinden wordt gebruikt
column238: met name voor de scheepvaart en voor het ontvangen van afvalwater
column239: \nErvan overtuigd dat de internationale actie ter bescherming van het water van de Rijn tegen chemische verontreiniging moet worden beoordeeld in samenhang met de andere inspanningen ter bescherming van het water van de Rijn
column240: in het bijzonder die inspanningen welke zijn gericht op het sluiten van overeenkomsten ter bestrijding van verontreiniging door chloriden en van thermische verontreiniging
column241: en dat deze actie deel uitmaakt van de steeds voortgaande en samenhangende maatregelen om zoet water en zeewater te beschermen tegen verontreiniging
column242: \nOverwegende de actie ondernomen door de Europese Economische Gemeenschap ter bescherming van het water
column243: met name in het kader van de richtlijn van de Raad van 4 mei 1976 betreffende de verontreiniging veroorzaakt door bepaalde gevaarlijke stoffen die in het aquatisch milieu van de Gemeenschap worden geloosd
column244: \nVerwijzend naar de resultaten van de ministersconferenties die op 25 en 26 oktober 1972 te Den Haag
column245: op 4 en 5 december 1973 te Bonn en op 1 april 1976 te Parijs zijn gehouden over de bescherming van de Rijn tegen verontreiniging
column246:
ZIJN OVEREENGEKOMEN ALS VOLGT:
Artikel 1
1. Ten einde de kwaliteit van het water van de Rijn te verbeteren
column249: alle passende maatregelen om:\na) de verontreiniging van de oppervlaktewateren van het stroomgebied van de Rijn door de gevaarlijke stoffen die zijn begrepen onder de families en groepen van stoffen die worden genoemd in bijlage I (hierna te noemen de \"onder bijlage I vallende stoffen\") te be\u00ebindigen. Zij willen geleidelijk komen tot be\u00ebindiging van de lozingen van die stoffen
column250: daarbij rekening houdend met de resultaten van de onderzoekingen die door deskundigen zijn verricht voor elk van die stoffen
column251:
alsook met de beschikbare technische middelen;
b) de verontreiniging van het water van de Rijn door de gevaarlijke stoffen die zijn begrepen onder de families en groepen van stoffen die worden genoemd in bijlage II (hierna te noemen de "onder bijlage I vallende stoffen") te verminderen.
2. Bij het nemen van de in het eerste lid van dit artikel bedoelde maatregelen wordt er in redelijke mate rekening mee gehouden dat het water van de Rijn wordt gebruikt voor de volgende doeleinden:
a) de bereiding van drinkwater voor menselijke consumptie
column252: \nb) consumptie door huisdieren en in het wild levende dieren
column253: \nc) het behoud en het onderhouden van de natuurlijke flora en fauna
column254: alsmede het behoud van het zelfreinigend vermogen van het water
column257: rekening houdend met de hygi\u00ebnische en esthetische vereisten
column258: \nf) de directe of indirecte toevoer van zoet water naar het land voor agrarische doeleinden
column259: \ng) de produktie van water voor industriel gebruik
column260:
en de noodzaak tot het behoud van een aanvaardbare kwaliteit van het zeewater.
3. Het bepaalde in deze Overeenkomst vormt slechts een eerste stap naar verwezenlijking van de in het eerste lid van dit artikel vervatte doelstelling.
4. Bijlage A van de Overeenkomst geeft een omschrijving van wat de Overeenkomstsluitende Partijen bij de toepassing daarvan onder "Rijn" verstaan.
Artikel 2
1. De Regeringen die partij zijn bij deze Overeenkomst laten
column261: overeenkomstig het bepaalde in bijlage III
column263: voor eigen gebruik een nationale lijst opstellen van de lozingen in de oppervlaktewateren van het stroomgebied van de Rijn
column265: welke vallen onder bijlage I en waarop emissienormen van toepassing zijn.\n2. De Regeringen delen aan de Internationale Commissie ter bescherming van de Rijn tegen verontreiniging (hierna te noemen \"de Internationale Commissie\") overeenkomstig het bepaalde in bijlage III
column267: de gegevens mede van deze regelmatig en ten minste eenmaal per drie jaar bijgewerkte lijst.\n3. De voorstellen van de Internationale Commissie bedoeld in artikel 6
column269: kunne zo nodig de opstelling omvatten van een lijst van verschillende onder bijlage II vallende stoffen.\nArtikel 3\n1. Voor elke lozing in de oppervlaktewateren van het stroomgebied van de Rijn
column270: die een van de onder bijlage I vallende stoffen kan bevatten
column272: die wordt verleend door de bevoegde autoriteit van de desbetreffende Regering.\n2. Voor lozingen van deze stoffen in de opervlaktewateren van het stroomgebied van de Rijn en
column273: wanneer zulks voor de toepassing van deze Overeenkomst noodzakelijk is
column274: voor lozingen van deze stoffen in riolen
column275: worden in de vergunning emissienormen vastgesteld
column276: die de overeenkomstig artikel 5 vastgestelde grenswaarden niet mogen overschrijden.\n3. Wat betreft de bestaande lozingen van deze stoffen

vastgestelde grenzen niet overschrijden.

Artikel 4
1. In de emissienormen
column280: vastgesteld in de vergunningen verleend uit hoofde van artikel 3
column281: worden bepaald:\na) de in de lozingen toelaatbare maximumconcentratie van een stof. In geval van verdunning moet de in artikel 5
column284: bedoelde grenswaarde worden gedeeld door de verdunningsfactor;\nb) de in de lozingen toelaatbare maximumhoeveelheid van een stof tijdens \u00e9\u00e9n of meer vastgestelde perioden. Zo nodig kan deze hoeveelheid bovendien worden uitgedrukt in een gewichtseenheid van de verontreinigende stof per eenheid van het element dat kenmerkend is voor de verontreinigende werking (bijvoorbeeld per gewichtseenheid grondstof of per eenheid produkt).\n2. column448: French and German texts are authentic)\nCONVENTION for the protection of the Rhine against chemical pollution \nTHE GOVERNMENT OF THE FEDERAL REPUBLIC OF GERMANY
column450: \nTHE GOVERNMENT OF THE GRAND DUCHY OF LUXEMBOURG
column451: \nTHE GOVERNMENT OF THE KINGDOM OF THE NETHERLANDS
column454: \nHaving regard to the Agreement of 29 April 1963 and the Additional Agreement of 3 December 1976 concerning the International Commission for the Protection of the Rhine against Pollution
column455: \nWhereas chemical pollution of the Rhine threatens its flora and fauna
column457: particularly efforts to conclude agreements against pollution by chlorides and thermal pollution
column458: and that such action is one of the continuous and coherent measures to protect fresh water and sea water from pollution ; \nWhereas the European Economic Community has taken measures to protect the aquatic environment
column459: particularly within the framework of the Council Directive of 4 May 1976 on pollution caused by certain dangerous substances discharged into the aquatic environment of the Community ;\nHaving regard to the results of the Ministerial Conferences of 25 and 26 October 1972 in the Hague
column460: 4 and 5 December 1973 in Bonn and 1 April 1976 in Paris on the Protection of the Rhine against Pollution
column461:
HAVE AGREED AS FOLLOWS: 
Article 1 
1. The Contracting Parties shall
column462: in accordance with the following provisions
column464: with a view to improving the quality of the waters of the Rhine
column465: to: \n(a) eliminate pollution of the surface waters of the Rhine basin by dangerous substances in the families and groups of substances appearing in Annex I (hereinafter referred to as'' Annex I substances''). The purpose of the measures is to effect the gradual elimination of discharges of these substances
column467: bearing in mind hygienic and aesthetic requirements ; \n(f) the direct or indirect supply of fresh water to agricultural lands ; \n(g) the production of water for industrial purposes
column468:
and the need to preserve an acceptable quality of sea water. 
3. The provisions of this Convention shall constitute only an initial step towards the achievement of the objectives set out in paragraph 1. 
4. Annex A to this Convention shall determine what the Contracting Parties mean by the word'' Rhine'' for the purposes of applying the said Convention. 
Article 2 
1. The Governments which are Parties to this Convention shall
column470: establish for their own use a national inventory of discharges into the surface waters of the Rhine basin which may contain substances listed in Annex I
column471: which are subject to emission standards. \n2. Pursuant to Annex III (2)
column472: the Governments shall communicate to the International Commission for the Protection of the Rhine against Pollution (hereinafter referred to as the'' International Commission'') the contents of their inventories
column473: which shall be regularly updated at intervals not exceeding three years.\n3. The proposals of the International Commission provided for in Article 6 (3) may
column475:
include an inventory of various substances falling under Annex II. 
Article 3 
1. Any discharge into the surface waters of the Rhine basin likely to contain a substance referred to in Annex I shall be subject to prior authorization from the responsible authorities of the Government concerned. 
2. For discharges of these substances into the surface waters of the Rhine basin and
column476: when necessary for the purpose of applying this Convention
column477: for discharges of these substances into sewers
column478: the authorization shall fix emission standards which may not exceed the limit values laid down in accordance with Article 5. \n3. In the case of existing discharges of these substances
column479:
the authorization shall fix a time limit within which the conditions laid down in the authorization must be met. This time limit must not exceed the period laid down in accordance with Article 5(3). 
4. The authorization may only be granted for a limited period of time. It may be renewed in the light of any alterations in the limit values referred to in Article 5. 
Article 4 
1. The emission standards laid down in the authorizations issued pursuant to Article 3 shall establish: 
(a) the maximum permissible concentration of a substance in discharges. In cases where there is dilution
column480: the limit value provided for in Article 5 (2) (a) shall be divided by the dilution factor ; \n(b) the maximum permissible quantity of a substance in discharges during one or more specific periods. If necessary this quantity may also be expressed as a unit of weight of the pollutant per unit of the characteristic element of the polluting activity (e.g. unit of weight per unit of raw material or product unit). \n2. If the discharger states that he is unable to conform to the emission standards or if the responsible authorities of the Government concerned establish this
column481: authorization shall be refused. \n3. If the emission standards are not observed
column482: the responsible authorities of the Government concerned shall take all necessary measures to ensure that the conditions for the authorization are met and
column484: that the discharge is prohibited. \nArticle 5 \n1. The International Commission shall propose the limit values provided for in Article 3 (2) and if necessary their application to discharges into sewers. These limit values shall be laid down in conformity with the procedure provided for in Article 14. Upon adoption
column485: they shall be included in Annex IV. \n2. These limit values are fixed in terms of: \n(a) the maximum permissible concentration of a substance in discharges and
column487: the maximum permissible quantity of such a substance expressed as a unit of weight of the pollutant per unit of the characteristic element of the polluting activity (e.g. unit of weight per unit of raw material or product unit). \nWhere appropriate
column488: the limit values applicable to industrial effluent shall be laid down individually by sector and by type of product. \nThe limit values applicable to Annex I substances shall be laid down mainly on the basis of: \n- toxicity
column491: taking into account the best available technical means. \n3. The International Commission shall propose to the Contracting Parties the time limits referred to in Article 3 (3)
column492: making due allowance for the specific characteristics of the industrial sectors involved and
column494: the types of product. These time limits shall be determined in accordance with the procedure laid down in Article 14. \n4. The International Commission shall use the results obtained at international measuring points to determine the extent to which the level of Annex I substances in the Rhine varies following the application of the above provisions. \n5. As regards the quality of Rhine water
column495: the International Commission may if necessary propose other measures for reducing the pollution of the Rhine taking into account
column498:
persistence and bioaccumulation of the substance under consideration. These proposals shall be adopted in accordance with the procedure laid down in Article 14. 
Article 6 
1. The discharge of any Annex II substance likely to affect the quality of Rhine water must be regulated by the national authorities with a view to limiting it strictly. 
2. The Governments which are Parties to this Convention shall strive to establish
column499: within a period of two years from the entry into force of this Convention
column500: national programmes for the reduction of the pollution of the Rhine by Annex II substances for the implementation of which they shall apply
column502: the means provided for in paragraphs 1
column505: 6 and 7 of this Article. \n3. Before drawing up their national programmes
column506: the Contracting Parties shall confer within the International Commission. To this end
column507: the International Commission shall regularly compare the draft national programmes in order to ensure that their aims and means coincide ; it shall submit proposals for achieving
column509: common goals in reducing pollution of the Rhine. These proposals shall be adopted by applying the procedure laid down in Article 14 of this Convention. \nComparison of draft national programmes should not entail delays in the implementation
column510: at either national or regional level
column511: of measures for reducing the pollution of the Rhine. \n4. Any discharge which may contain an Annex II substance shall require prior authorization
column514:
from the responsible authorities of the Government concerned. These standards shall be fixed in accordance with the quality objectives provided for in paragraph 5. 
5. The programmes referred to in paragraph 2 above shall include quality objectives for Rhine water. 
6. The programmes may also contain specific provision concerning the composition and use of substances or groups of substances and products ; they shall take into account the latest economically feasible technical advances. 
7. The programmes shall lay down deadlines for their implementation. 
8. Summaries of the programmes and the results of their implementation shall be communicated to the International Commission. 
Article 7 
1. The Contracting Parties shall take all legislative and administrative measures to ensure that the storage and deposit of Annex I and II substances is so carried out as to entail no danger of pollution to the Rhine. 
2. If necessary
column515:
the International Commission shall propose to the Contracting Parties appropriate measures for protecting underground water in order to prevent pollution of the Rhine by Annex I and II substances. 
Article 8 
1. The Contracting Parties shall ensure that discharges are monitored in accordance with this Convention. 
2. They shall inform the International Commission annually of the experience gained. 
Article 9 
Implementation of the measures taken pursuant to this Convention shall in no case result in a direct or indirect increase in the pollution of the Rhine. 
Article 10 
1. With a view to monitoring levels in the Rhine of Annex I and II substances
column516: each Government concerned shall take responsibility at the agreed measuring station on the Rhine for installing and operating measuring systems and apparatus for determining the concentrations of such substances. \n2. Every Government involved shall regularly inform the International Commission of the results of its monitoring
column517:
at least once a year. 
3. The International Commission shall draft an annual report summarizing the monitoring results and enabling the progress of the quality of Rhine water to be observed. 
Article 11 
If a Government which is a Party to this Convention detects a sudden considerable increase in Annex I or II substances
column518: or learns of an accident which could seriously threaten the quality of Rhine water
column519:
it shall inform the International Commission and the Contracting Parties which could be affected without delay and in accordance with a procedure to be worked out by the International Commission. 
Article 12 
1. The Contracting Parties shall regularly inform the International Commission of the experience gained in the course of implementing this Convention. 
2. The International Commission shall also make recommendations
column521:
designed gradually to improve the implementation of this Convention. 
Article 13 
The International Commission shall work out draft recommendations for achieving comparable results by the use of appropriate measuring and analysis methods. 
Article 14 
1. Annexes I to IV inclusive
column522: which shall form an integral part of this Convention
column523: may be amended or added to for the purposes of adapting them to technical or scientific advances or of more effectively combating the chemical pollution of the Rhine. \n2. To this end
column524:
the International Commission shall recommend the amendments or additions which it considers appropriate. 
3. The amended or supplemented texts shall enter into force following unanimous acceptance by the Contracting Parties. 
Article 15 
Any dispute between the Contracting Parties concerning the interpretation or implementation of this Convention which cannot be settled by negotiation shall be submitted to arbitration unless the parties to the dispute decide otherwise and at the request of one of them
column525: in accordance with the provisions of Annex B which shall form an integral part of this Convention. \nArticle 16 \nFor the purposes of applying this Convention
column526:
the European Economic Community and its Member States shall act in their respective areas of competence. 
Article 17 
1. Each Signatory Party shall notify the Government of the Swiss Confederation of the completion of their procedures for bringing this Convention into force. 
2. Subject to notification by each Contracting Party that the required procedures for the entry into force of the Additional Agreement to the Agreement concerning the International Commission for the Protection of the Rhine against Pollution have been completed
column527: this Convention shall enter into force on the first day of the second month following receipt of the last notification provided for in the preceeding paragraph. \nArticle 18 \nThree years after its entry into force
column528: this Convention may be denounced at any time by any of the Contracting Parties by means of a declaration transmitted to the Government of the Swiss Confederation. The denunciation shall become effective for the denouncing Party six months after the receipt by the Government of the Swiss Confederation of the declaration. \nArticle 19 \nThe Government of the Swiss Confederation will inform the Contracting Parties of the date of receipt of any notification or declaration received in accordance with Articles 14
column529: 17 and 18. \nArticle 20 \n1. If the Agreement of 29 April 1963 concerning the International Commission for the Protection of the Rhine against Pollution is denounced by one of its Contracting Parties
column530: the Contracting Parties shall immediately consult with regard to the appropriate measures to be taken to ensure the continued performance of the duties which are encumbent on the International Commission pursuant to this Convention. \n2. If agreement is not reached within six months of the opening of these consultations
column531: any Contracting Party may at any time denounce this Convention in accordance with Article 18 without waiting for the expiry of the three-year time limit. \nArticle 21 \nThis Convention
column532: drawn up in a single original in the Dutch
column534: all three texts being equally authentic
column535: will be deposited in the archives of the Government of the Swiss Confederation
column536: which will transmit a certified copy to each Contracting Party. \nDone at Bonn
column537:
3 December 1976. 
For the Government of the Federal Republic of Germany: 
For the Government of the French Republic: 
For the Government of the Grand Duchy of Luxembourg: 
For the Government of the Kingdom of the Netherlands: 
For the Government of the Swiss Confederation: 
For the European Economic Community: 
ANNEX A 
For the purposes of implementing this Convention
column538: the Rhine shall be taken as beginning at its outflow from the Untersee and including the arms
column540: through which its waters flow freely into the North Sea
column541: inclusive of the Ijssel up to Kampen. \nDuring the drawing-up of the national programmes provided for in Article 6 of the Convention - where quality objectives are concerned - and during the coordination of these programmes within the International Commission
column542:
a distinction shall be made in each separate case between the fresh water and the salt water of the river. 
ANNEX B 
ARBITRATION 
1. Unless the parties to a dispute decide otherwise
column543: the arbitration procedure shall be conducted in accordance with the provisions of this Annex. \n2. The arbitral tribunal shall consist of three members ; each of the parties to the dispute shall appoint an arbitrator ; the two arbitrators so appointed shall by common consent designate a third who shall chair the tribunal. \nIf the chairman has not been appointed within two months of the designation of the second arbitrator
column544: the President of the European Court of Human Rights shall
column546: designate him at the request of the first party to act. \n3. If
column547: within two months of receipt of the request provided for in Article 15 of the Convention
column548: one of the parties to the dispute has not designated an arbitrator
column549: the other party may submit the matter to the President of the European Court of Human Rights who shall designate the chairman of the arbitral tribunal within a further two months. Once appointed
column550: the chairman of the arbitral tribunal shall request the party which has not appointed an arbitrator to do so within two months. Upon expiry of this time limit
column551: he shall submit the matter to the President of the European Court of Human Rights who shall make this appointment within a further two months. \n4. If
column552: in one of the cases referred to above
column553: the President of the European Court of Human Rights is prevented from acting
column554: or if he is a national of one of the parties to the dispute
column555: the Vice-President of the Court or the most senior member of the Court who is not prevented from acting and who is not a national of one of the parties to the dispute shall appoint the chairman of the arbitral tribunal or an arbitrator. \n5. These provisions shall apply
column557: to the filling of posts which have become vacant. \n6. The arbitral tribunal shall decide on the basis of the rules of international law and in particular on the basis of the provisions of this Convention. \n7. As regards both procedural and substantive matters
column558: the arbitral tribunal shall decide by a majority of its members'' votes ; the absence or abstention of one of the members of the tribunal appointed by the parties shall not prevent the tribunal from reaching a decision. In the case of parity of votes
column559: the chairman shall have a casting vote. The decisions of the tribunal shall be binding on the parties. Each party shall bear the costs of the arbitrator appointed by it and shall share the other costs equally. For other matters
column560: the arbitral tribunal shall establish its own rules of procedure. \n8. In the case of a dispute between two Contracting Parties
column561: only one of which is a Member State of the European Economic Community
column562: which is itself a Contracting Party
column563: the other party shall simultaneously transmit its request to that Member State and the Community
column564: which shall jointly notify the party within two months following receipt of the request whether the Member State
column565: the Community or the Member State and the Community together are parties to the dispute. If such notification is not given within the appointed time
column566:
both the Member State and the Community shall be regarded as constituting one and the same party to the dispute for the purposes of applying this Annex. The same shall obtain when the Member State and the Community are jointly a party to the dispute. 
ANNEX I 
Families and groups of substances 
Annex I includes certain individual substances from the following families or groups of substances
column567: selected mainly on the basis of their toxicity
column569: with the exception of those which are biologically harmless or which are rapidly converted into substances which are biologically harmless. \n1. Organohalogen compounds and substances which may form such compounds in the aquatic environment
column572: \n4. Substances in respect of which it has been proved tht they possess carcinogenic properties in or via the aquatic environment (1). \n(1) Where certain substances in Annex II are carcinogenic
column573: they are included in category 4 of this Annex. \n5. Mercury and its compounds
column575:
7. Persistent mineral oils and hydrocarbons of petroleum origin. 
ANNEX II 
Families and groups of substances 
Annex II contains: 
- substances belonging to the families and groups in Annex I for which the limit values referred to in Article 5 of the Convention have not been determined
column576: \n- certain individual substances and categories of substances belonging to the families and groups of substances listed below
column577: and which have a deleterious effect on the aquatic environment
column580:
be confined to a given area and which depend on the characteristics and location of the water into which they are discharged. 
Families and groups of substances referred to in the second indent: 
1. The following metalloids and metals und their compounds: 
1. Zinc 
2. Copper 
3. Nickel 
4. Chromium 
5. Lead 
6. Selenium 
7. Arsenic 
8. Antimony 
9. Molybenum 
10. Titanium 
11. Tin 
12. Barium 
13. Beryllium 
14. Boron 
15. Uranium 
16. Vanadium 
17. Cobalt 
18. Thalium 
19. Tellurium 
20. Silver 
2. Biocides and their derivatives not appearing in Annex I. 
3. Substances which have a deleterious effect on the taste and/or smell of the products for human consumption derived from the aquatic environment
column581: and compounds liable to give rise to such substances in water. \n4. Toxic or persistent organic compounds of silicon and substances which may give rise to such compounds in water
column582:
excluding those which are biologically harmless or are rapidly converted in water into harmless substances. 
5. Inorganic compounds of phosphorus and elemental phosphorus. 
6. Non-persistent mineral oils and hydrocarbons of petroleum origin. 
7. Cyanides
column583: Fluorides. \n8. Substances which have an adverse effect on the oxygen balance
column585:
Nitrites. 
ANNEX III 
1. The national inventory provided for in Article 2 (1) of this Convention shall show dischargers
column587: and discharged substances classified according to type and quality. \n2. The contents of the inventory referred to in Article 2 (2) of the Convention shall include the total quantities of each of the various substances set out in Annexe I
column588:
discharges into the waters of the Rhine basin between the measuring points proposed by the International Commission and accepted by all the Contracting Parties. 
ANNEX IV 
Limit values (Article 5) 
Substance or group of substances 
>TABLE>
ADDITIONAL AGREEMENT to the Agreement
column590: concerning the International Commission for the Protection of the Rhine against Pollution \nTHE GOVERNMENT OF THE FEDERAL REPUBLIC OF GERMANY
column592: \nTHE GOVERNMENT OF THE GRAND DUCHY OF LUXEMBOURG
column593: \nTHE GOVERNMENT OF THE KINGDOM OF THE NETHERLANDS
column598: concerning the International Commission for the Protection of the Rhine against Pollution and the Protocol of Signature annexed thereto
column599: \nHaving regard to the Convention for the protection of the Rhine against chemical pollution
column602: the European Economic Community must become a Contracting Party to the Agreement signed in Berne on 29 April 1963
column603:
HAVE AGREED AS FOLLOWS: 
Article 1 
The European Economic Community shall become a Contracting Party to the Agreement concerning the International Commission for the Protection of the Rhine against Pollution and the Protocol of Signature attached thereto (hereinafter referred to as ''the Agreement'')
column605:
from the date of the entry into force of this Additional Agreement. 
Article 2
The following amendments shall be made to the Agreement: 
(a) The term ''Signatory Governments'' shall be replaced by ''Contracting Parties''. 
(b) Article 4 (1) shall be replaced by the following: 
1. Details regarding the exercise of the chairmanship of the Commission by the delegations shall be worked out by the Commission and included in its rules of procedure ; the delegation assuming the chairmanship shall designate one of its members as chairman of the Commission.'' 
(c) The following paragraph shall be inserted after Article 6 (1): 
'' 2. In those areas coming within its jurisdiction
column606:
the European Economic Community shall have the number of votes corresponding to the number of its Member States which are Contracting Parties to this Agreement. The European Economic Community shall not vote in cases where its Member States vote and vice versa.'' 
Article 6 (2) shall become Article 6 (3). 
Article 6 (3) shall become Article 6 (4) ; the following words shall be added thereto: 
'' However
column607:
this provision shall not apply to the delegation of the European Economic Community.'' 
(d) Article 12 (2) shall be replaced by the following: 
'' 2. The remaining costs of the Commission'' s activities shall be shared out among the Contracting Parties as follows: 
Federal Republic of Germany // 24.5 % 
French Republic // 24.5 % 
Grand Duchy of Luxembourg // 1.5 % 
Kingdom of the Netherlands // 24.5 % 
European Economic Community // 13 % 
Swiss Confederation // 12 % 
Total // 100 % 
In certain cases
column608:
the Commission may adopt a different distribution.'' 
Article 3 
1. The delegation which holds the chair of the Commission at the time of the entry into force of the Additional Agreement shall continue to preside until its three-year period of office expires. 
2. The details of the subsequent exercise of the chairmanship of the Commission by the delegations shall be worked out by the Commission in the light of its new composition and before the expiry of the period of office referred to in paragraph 1. 
Article 4 
1. Each Signatory Party will notify the Government of the Swiss Confederation of the completion of the procedures necessary for the entry into force of this Additional Agreement. 
2. The Government of the Swiss Confederation will inform the Contracting Parties of the date of receipt of such notifications. This Additional Agreement shall enter into force at the same time as the Convention for the protection of the Rhine against chemical pollution. 
Article 5 
This Additional Agreement
column609: drawn up in a single original in the Dutch
column611: all three texts being equally authentic
column612: will be deposited in the archives of the Government of the Swiss Confederation
column613: which will transmit a certified copy to each Contracting Party. \nDone at Bonn
column614:
3 December 1976.

title: 'Exchange of letters between the Euratom Commission and the International Bureau of Weights and Measures
legal_basis: European cooperation;scientific cooperation;technical cooperation;weights and measures
column15:

21965A1118(01)




Exchange of letters between the Euratom Commission and the International Bureau of Weights and Measures
column16:
signed at Brussels on 18 November 1965  






Official Journal 045
column17:
15/03/1966 P. 0614 - 0615
 Danish special edition: Series II Volume V P. 0008 
 English special edition: Series II Volume V P. 0008 
 Spanish special edition: Chapter 12 Volume 1 P. 0101 
 Portuguese special edition Chapter 12 Volume 1 P. 0101 
 












Exchange of Letters between the Commission and the International Bureau of Weights and Measures  (66/2/Euratom)
  THE EUROPEAN ATOMIC ENERGY COMMUNITY 
 THE COMMISSION 
 The Director General for External Relations 
 Brussels
column19: \n I note with satisfaction that the discussions between our representatives on arrangements for cooperation between our two organizations have recognized the value of the cooperation which already exists in scientific and technical matters between the International Bureau of Weights and Measures and the Euratom Commission. \n As a result of these discussions our representatives have expressed the wish that this friendly relationship
column20: based on regard for our statutory tasks
column21: should be continued and strengthened by the exchange of information made freely available by both parties
column22: by joint consultation
column23: by the attendance of observers from either side at working sessions on matters of common interest and by such other appropriate means as may be agreed. \n The purpose of this letter is to confirm that the Euratom Commission is ready
column24: for its part
column25: to give effect to that wish. \n I should be happy if you were able
column26: on behalf of the IBWM
column27: to reply with a similar confirmation ; this letter and your reply thereto would thus constitute the reciprocal undertakings of our two organizations as to future cooperation
column28: which would take effect from the date of your reply. \n Please accept
column29: Sir
column30:
the assurance of my highest consideration. 
 F. CANCELLARIO d''ALENA 
 Mr. J. Terrien Director of the International Bureau of Weights and Measures Pavillon de Breteuil Sèvres (Seine-et-Oise).  
 INTERNATIONAL BUREAU OF WEIGHTS AND MEASURES 
 Pavillon de Breteuil Sèvres (Seine-et-Oise) 
 18 November 1965. 
 Sir
column31: \n I have the honour to acknowledge receipt of your letter of today''s date
column32: the text of which follows: \n \"I note with satisfaction that the discussions between our representatives on arrangements for cooperation between our two organizations have recognized the value of the cooperation which already exists in scientific and technical matters between the International Bureau of Weights and Measures and the Euratom Commission. \n As a result of these discussions our representatives have expressed the wish that this friendly relationship
column33: based on regard for our statutory tasks
column34: should be continued and strengthened by the exchange of information made freely available by both parties
column35: by joint consultation
column36: by the attendance of observers from either side at working sessions on matters of common interest and by such other appropriate means as may be agreed. \n The purpose of this letter is to confirm that the Euratom Commission is ready
column37: for its part
column38: to give effect to that wish. \n I should be happy if you were able
column39: on behalf on the IBWM
column40: to reply with a similar confirmation ; this letter and your reply thereto would thus constitute the reciprocal undertakings of our two organizations as to future cooperation
column41: which would take effect from the date of your reply. \n Please accept
column42: Sir
column43: the assurance of my highest consideration.\" \n I have the honour to inform you that
column44: in my capacity as Director of the IBWM
column45: I am authorized by the International Committee of Weights and Measures to accept the proposals set out in your letter which
column46: in accordance with your proposal
column47: will enter into force from the date of this letter. \n Please accept
column48: Sir
column49:
the assurance of my highest consideration. 
 J. TERRIEN 
 Director 
 Mr F. Cancellario d''Alena Director-General for External Relations Euratom Commission 51 Rue Belliard Brussels."'

column17:
19/12/1968 P. 0002 - 0003
 Finnish special edition: Chapter 11 Volume 1 P. 0021 
 Swedish special edition: Chapter 11 Volume 1 P. 0021 
 Spanish special edition: Chapter 11 Volume 1 P. 0040 
 Portuguese special edition Chapter 11 Volume 1 P. 0040 
 UNTS 1968 VOL 620 P. 294
 UN-08/02/1968
 










ANNEX A
Geneva (1967) protocol to the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade
The contracting parties to the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade and The European Economic Community which participated in the 1964–67 Trade Conference (hereinafter re-ferred to as "participants")
column18: \nHaving carried out negotiations pursuant to paragraph 6 of Article XXIV
column19: Article XXVIII bis
column20: Article XXXIII and other relevant provisions of the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade (hereinafter referred to as \"the General Agreement\")
column21: \nHave through their representatives
column22: agreed as follows:\nI \u2014 Provisions Relating to Schedules\n1. The schedule annexed to this Protocol relating to a participant shall become a Schedule to the General Agreement
column23: relating to that participant on the day on which this Protocol enters into force for it pursuant to paragraph 6.\n2. Each participant shall ensure that
column24: in so far as any rate specified in the column of its schedule setting out the concession rate (hereinafter referred to as the \"final rate\") does not become effective on 1 January 1968
column25: each final rate shall become effective not later than 1 January 1972. Within the period of 1 January 1968 to 1 January 1972 a participant shall make rate reductions in amounts not less than and on dates not later than those laid down in one of the following sub-paragraphs
column26: except as may be otherwise clearly provided for in its schedule:\n(a) A participant which begins rate reductions on 1 January 1968 shall make effective one-fifth of the total reduction to the final rate on that date and four-fifths of the total reduction in four equal instalments on 1 January of 1969
column28: 1971 and 1972.\n(b) A participant which begins rate reductions on 1 July 1968
column29: or on a date between I January and 1 July 1968
column30: shall make effective two-fifths of the total reduction to the final rate on that date and three-fifths of the total reduction in three equal instalments on 1 January of 1970
column31: 1971 and 1972.\n3. Any participant
column32: after the shedule relating to it annexed to this Protocol has become a Schedule to the General Agreement pursuant to the provisions of paragraph 1 of this Protocol
column33: shall be free at any time to withhold or to withdraw in whole or in part the concession in such schedule with respect to any product in which a participant or a government having negotiated for accession
column34: during the 1964\u201367 Trade Conference (hereinafter referred to as an \"acceding government\")
column35: but the schedule of which annexed to this Protocol or to the Protocol for the accession of the acceding government has not yet become a Schedule to the General Agreement
column36: has a principal supplying interest
column37:
provided that;
(a) Written notice of any such withholding of a concession shall be given to the Contracting Parties within 30 days after the date of such withholding.
(b) Written notice of intention to make any such withdrawal of a concession shall be given to the Contracting Parties at least 30 days before the date of such intended withdrawal.
(c) Consultations shall be held upon request
column38: with any participant or any acceding government
column39: the relevant schedule relating to which has become a Schedule to the General Agreement and which has a substantial interest in the product involved.\n(d) Any concession so withheld or withdrawn shall be applied on and after the day on which the schedule of the participant or the acceding government which has the principal supplying interest becomes a Schedule to the General Agreement.\n4. (a) In each case in which paragraph 1 (b) and (c) of Article II of the General Agreement refers to the date of that Agreement
column40: the applicable date in respect of each product which is the subject of a concession provided for in a schedule annexed to this Protocol shall be the date of this Protocol
column41: but without prejudice to any obligations in effect on that date.\n(b) For the purpose of the reference in paragraph 6(a) of Article II of the General Agreement to the date of that Agreement
column42: the applicable date in respect of a schedule annexed to this Protocol shall be the date of this Protocol.\nII \u2014 Final Provisions\n5. (a) This Protocol shall be open for acceptance by participants
column43: by signature or otherwise
column44: until 30 June 1968.\n(b) The period during which this Protocol may be accepted by a participant may be extended
column45: but not beyond 31 December 1968
column46: by a decision of the Council of Representatives. Such decision shall lay down the rules and conditions for the implementation of the schedule annexed to this Protocol relating to that participant.\n6. This Protocol shall enter into force on 1 January 1968 for those participants which have accepted it before 1 December 1967
column47: and for participants accepting after that date it shall enter into force on the dates of acceptance
column48: provided that not later than 1 December 1967 the participants which have accepted or are then prepared to accept this Protocol shall consider whether they constitute a sufficient number of participants to justify the beginning of rate reductions according to paragraph 2
column49: and if they consider that they do hot constitute a sufficient number they shall so notify the Director-General who shall request all participants to review the situation with a view to securing the greatest possible number of acceptances at the earliest practicable date.\n7. This Protocol shall be deposited with the Director-General to the Contracting Parties who shall promptly furnish a certified copy thereof and a notification of each acceptance thereof
column50: pursuant to paragraph 5 above
column51: to each contracting party to the General Agreement and to the European Economic Community.\n8. This Protocol shall be registered in accordance with the provisions of Article 102 of the Charter of the United Nations.\nDone at Geneva this thirtieth day of June one thousand nine hundred and sixty-seven
column52: in a single copy
column53: in the English and French languages
column54: except as otherwise specified with respect to the schedules annexed hereto
column55:
both texts being authentic.
ANNEX
The Schedules of concessions relating to the European Economic Community and to the European Coal and Steel Community are given in Volume IV of the GATT publication "Legal Instruments embodying the results of the 1964–67 Trade Conference".
--------------------------------------------------"'

ANNEX B
Agreement relating principally to chemicals
column20: supplementary to the Geneva (1967) Protocol to the general Agreement on Tariffs and Trade\nThe Governments of the Kingdom of Belgium (hereinafter referred to as Belgium)
column21: the French Republic (hereinafter referred to as France)
column22: the Italian Republic (hereinafter referred to as Italy)
column23: the Swiss Confederation (hereinafter referred to as Switzerland)
column24: the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland (hereinafter referred to as the United Kingdom)
column25: the United States of America (hereinafter referred to as the United States)
column26: and the European Economic Community.\nBeing desirous of exchanging further tariff and other concessions under the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade (hereinafter referred to as the General Agreement) additional to those under the Geneva (1967) Protocol to the General Agreement (hereinafter referred to as the Protocol)
column27: principally with respect to chemicals
column28: \nHave
column29: through their representatives
column30:
agreed as follows:
PART I
GENERAL
Article 1
Conditions of Entry into Force
(a) Elimination of American Selling Price system
In order that the United States may obtain the benefits of the tariff concessions on chemicals and other articles and the concessions on non-tariff barriers
column31: provided for in Parts III
column32: IV and V of this Agreement
column33: additional to the concessions it will obtain under the Protocol
column34: the President of the United States undertakes to use his best efforts to obtain promptly such legislation as is necessary to enable the United States to eliminate the American Selling Price system of valuation
column35: as provided in Part II of this Agreement
column36: and to give effect to the other provisions of that Part.\n(b) Entry into force\nThis Agreement shall enter into force for all the parties hereto on the first day of the first calendar quarter which is at least 30 days after the day on which the United States has notified the Director-General of the General Agreement
column37: in writing
column38: that such legislation has been enacted: Provided that this Agreement shall enter into force no earlier than the day on which Schedule XX to the Protocol becomes a Schedule to the General Agreement
column39: nor any later than 1 January 1969
column40:
unless otherwise agreed by all the parties hereto.
PART II
SUB-PART A — CHEMICALS
Article 2
Elimination of American Selling Price system
(a) Explanation [1]
This Article provides for the elimination of the American Selling Price system of valuation (see Sections 402 (e) and 402a (g) of the Tariff Act of 1930 (19 U.S.C. (1964)
column41: 140 la (e) and 1402 (g)) as the basis for determining dutiable value in the case of certain chemicals
column42: provided for in Schedule XX (United States)
column43: Part I
column44: annexed to the Protocol (hereinafter referred to as Schedule XX)
column45: Section 4
column46: Chapter 1. This is accomplished by the deletion of Notes 4 and 5 from Chapter 1
column47: which provide for use of the American Selling Price system for such articles.\nIn addition
column48: a new Note 4 is inserted providing for use of normal methods of valuation therefor (Section 402 (a) through (d) of the Tariff Act of 1930 (19 U.S.C. (1964) 140 la (a) through (d)).\n(b) Amendments\nUpon the entry into force of this Agreement
column49: Schedule XX
column50: Section 4
column51: Chapter 1
column52: shall be amended by striking out Notes 4 and 5 thereto
column53:
and by inserting in lieu thereof:
"4. The ad valorem rates provided for in this Chapter shall be based upon the methods of valuation provided for in Section 402(a) through (d) of the Tariff Act of 1930 (19 U.S.C. (1964) 140 la (a) through (d))."
Article 3
Substitution of Converted Concessions
(a) Explanation
This Article removes from Schedule XX the original concessions on chemicals provided for in Units B and C. of Chapter 1 of Section 4
column54: which are based on the American Selling Price system and replaces them with the substitute converted concessions
column55: set forth in Appendix A
column56: with concession rates based on normal methods of valuation. In addition
column57: this Article removes Note 6 from Chapter 1
column58: Unit C
column59: which provides that specific duties on certain dyes shall be based on standards of strength
column60: since the substitute converted concessions on these dyes involve only ad valorem rates of duty.\n(b) Amendments\nUpon the entry into force of this Agreement
