    PROTOCOL  concerning the definition of the concept of "originating" products and methods of administrative cooperation
  TITLE I Definition of the concept of "originating" products 
 Article 1
 For the purpose of implementing the Agreement establishing an Association between the European Economic Community and the Republic of Cyprus
column499: the following products shall be considered as:    1. products originating in the Community
column500: provided that they have been transported to Cyprus directly
column501: within the meaning of Article 5:      (a) products wholly obtained in the Member States; \n          (b) products obtained in the Member States
column502: in the manufacture of which products other than those referred to in (a) above are used
column503: provided that the said products have undergone sufficient working or processing within the meaning of Article 3. This condition shall not apply
column506: within the meaning of this Protocol
column507:
originate in Cyprus; 
 
 
      2. products originating in Cyprus
column508: provided that they have been transported to the importing Member State directly
column509: within the meaning of Article 5:    (a) products wholly obtained in Cyprus; \n      (b) products obtained in Cyprus
column510: in the manufacture of which products other than those referred to in (a) above are used
column511: provided that the said products have undergone sufficient working or processing within the meaning of Article 3. This condition shall not apply
column514: within the meaning of this Protocol
column515:
originate in the Community. 
 
 
 The products listed in List C shall be temporarily excluded from the scope of this Protocol. 
 
 Article 2
 The following shall be considered as wholly obtained either in the Member States or in Cyprus
column519: the following shall be considered as sufficient working or processing:    (a) working or processing as a result of which the goods obtained receive a classification under a tariff heading other than that covering each of the products worked or processed
column522: working or processing appearing in List A
column523:
where the special provisions of that list apply; 
      (b) working or processing appearing in List B. 
 
 
 "Tariff headings" shall mean the headings in the Brussels Nomenclature for the Classification of Goods in Customs Tariffs. 
 
 Article 4
 Where the Lists A and B referred to in Article 3 provide that the goods obtained in a Member State or in Cyprus shall be considered as originating there  only if the value of the products worked or processed does not exceed a given percentage of the value of the goods obtained
column525:
less internal taxes refunded or refundable on exportation. 
 
 
 
 Article 5
 The following shall be considered as transported directly from the exporting Member State to Cyprus or from Cyprus to the importing Member State:    (a) goods transported without passing through territory other than that of Contracting Parties; 
      (b) goods transported through territories other than those of Contracting Parties
column527:
if the passage in such territories or the transhipment is covered by a single transport document drawn up in a Member State or in the Republic of Cyprus. 
 
 
 Transhipments carried out in the ports of territories other than those of Contracting Parties shall not be considered as interrupting direct transport if such transhipments are caused by force majeure or are the result of events at sea. 
 
 TITLE II Methods of administrative cooperation 
 Article 6
 "Originating" products within the meaning of this Protocol shall
column528: in the importing Member State or in Cyprus
column529: benefit from the provisions of the Agreement
column530: upon submission of an A.CY.1 movement certificate issued by the customs authorities of the Republic of Cyprus or the customs authorities of the exporting Member State. \n However
column531: products sent by post (including parcels) shall
column532: provided that the consignments contain only \"originating\" products and that the value does not exceed one thousand units of account per consignment
column533: benefit from the provisions of the Agreement in the Member State or in Cyprus
column534: on the presentation of form A.CY.2
column535:
subject to each parcel bearing the label contained in Part 2 of this form. 
 
 Article 7
 Movement certificate A.CY.1 shall be issued only on application being made in writing by the exporter
column536:
on the form prescribed for this purpose. 
 
 Article 8
 The A.CY.1 movement certificate shall be issued by the customs authorities of the exporting State when the goods to which it relates are exported. It shall be made available to the exporters as soon as actual exportation has been effected or ensured. 
 In exceptional circumstances
column537: an A.CY.1 movement certificate may also be issued after the exportation of the goods to which it refers
column538: if it was not submitted at the time of such exportation because of errors or involuntary omissions or special circumstances. In this case
column539:
the certificate shall bear a special reference to the conditions in which it was issued. 
An A.CY.1 movement certificate may be issued only where it can serve as documentary evidence for the purpose of implementing the preferential treatment provided for in the Agreement. 
 
 Article 9
 Movement certificates A.CY.1 must be submitted
column540: within four months from the date of issue by the customs authorities of the exporting Member State
column541:
to the customs authorities of the importing Member State where the goods are delivered.  
 
 Article 10
 Movement certificates A.CY.1 must be made out on a form of which a specimen appears in Annex V. They shall be drawn up in one of the languages in which the Agreement is drawn up
column542: in accordance with the provisions of the national law of the exporting State. They shall be typewritten or hand-written ; in the latter case
column543: they shall be completed in ink and in capital letters. \n Each certificate shall measure 210 X 297 mm. The paper used must be white sized writing paper not containing mechanical pulp and weighing not less than 64 g/m2 or between 25 and 30 g/m2 if airmail paper is used. It shall have a green machine-turned background making any falsification by chemical or mechanical means apparent to the eye. \n On the front of each certificate
column544: a diagonal pattern of three blue stripes
column546: shall run from the bottom left hand corner to the top right hand corner. \n Each certificate shall contain a serial number by which it can be identified. \n The Member States and the Republic of Cyprus may reserve the right to print the certificates themselves or may have them printed by approved printers. In the latter case
column547:
each form must carry reference to such approval. Each form must bear the name and address of the printer or a sign by which the printer can be identified. 
 
 Article 11
 In the importing State
column548: A.CY.1 movement certificates shall be submitted to the customs authorities
column549:
in accordance with the provisions made in the laws and regulations of that State. The said authorities may require a translation of a certificate. They may also require the import declaration to be accompanied by a statement from the importer to the effect that the goods meet the conditions required for the implementation of the Agreement. 
 
 Article 12
 Form A.CY.2
column550: of which a specimen appears in Annex VI
column551: shall be completed by the exporter. It shall be drawn up in one of the languages in which the Agreement is drawn up and in accordance with the provisions of the national law of the exporting State. It shall be typewritten or hand written ; in the latter case it shall be completed in ink and in capital letters. \n Form A.CY.2 is composed of two parts
column552: each part being 210 mm X 148 mm. The paper used shall be white sized writing paper not containing mechanical pulp and weighing not less than 64 g/m2. On the front of Part 1 and the label contained in Part 2
column553: a diagonal pattern of three blue stripes
column555: shall run from the bottom left-hand corner to the top right-hand corner. \n Form A.CY.2 may be perforated mechanically so that the two parts may be separated and the portion of the form to be affixed on the consignment can be detached. The back of this portion may be adhesive. \n The Member States and the Republic of Cyprus may reserve the right to print the forms themselves or may have them printed by approved printers. In the latter case
column556:
each form must carry a reference to such approval. Each form must bear the name and address of the printer or a sign by which the printer can be identified. Each part shall also bear a serial number by which it can be identified. 
 
 Article 13
 For each postal consignment
column557: an A.CY.2 form shall be completed. After completing and signing the two parts of the form
column558:
the exporter shall insert his declaration (Part 1) in the consignment and stick the label from Part 2 on the outer packing of the consignment. 
 These provisions do not dispense exporters from complying with any formalities required by customs or postal regulations. 
 
 Article 14
 Unless they suspect some irregularity
column559: the customs authorities of the Member State or of the Republic of Cyprus shall admit as benefiting from the provisions of the Agreement any goods contained in a consignment bearing an A.CY.2 label. \n For the purpose of a random check or in a case of doubt as to regularity
column560: the customs authorities of a Member State or of the Republic of Cyprus may ask for a verification by the customs authorities of the Republic of Cyprus or the Member State
column563: Part 1 of the A.CY.2 form contained in the consignment
column565: while waiting for the result of such examination
column566: the application of the Agreement. In such cases
column567: the goods may be released to the importer
column568:
subject to such safeguards as may be considered necessary.  
 
 Article 15
 1. Member States and the Republic of Cyprus shall admit as "originating" products benefiting from the provisions of the Agreement
column569: without requiring the production of an A.CY.1 movement certificate or the completion of an A.CY.2 form
column570: goods sent as small packages to private persons or forming part of passengers'' personal luggage
column571: in so far as such goods are not imported by way of trade and have been declared as meeting the conditions required for the application of this Agreement
column572: and where there is no doubt as to the veracity of such declaration. \n 2. Importations which are occasional and consist solely of goods for the personal use of the addressee or passenger or his family
column573: it being evident from the nature and quality of the goods that no commercial purpose is in view
column574: shall not be considered as importations by way of trade. Furthermore
column576: since they were consigned for exhibition
column577:
been used for any purpose other than demonstration at the exhibition. 
 
 
 2. A movement certificate A.CY.1 must be produced to the customs authorities of the importing State in the normal manner. The name and address of the exhibition must be indicated thereon. Where necessary
column578: additional documentary evidence of the nature of the goods and the conditions under which they have been exhibited may be required from the country where the exhibition was held. \n 3. Paragraph 1 shall apply to any trade
column581: fair or similar public show or display which is not organized for private purposes in shops or business premises with a view to the sale of foreign goods
column582:
and during which the goods remain under customs control. 
 
 Article 17
 In order to ensure the proper application of this Title
column583: the Member States and the Republic of Cyprus shall assist each other
column585: for the purpose of checking the authenticity and correctness of A.CY.1 movement certificates and of exporters'' declarations made on A.CY.2 forms. \n The Association Council shall draw up any recommendations necessary for the application of this Protocol
column587:
so that the methods of administrative cooperation may be applied in due course in the Member States and in the Republic of Cyprus. 
 
 TITLE III Final Provisions 
 Article 18
 The Member States and the Republic of Cyprus shall take all the measures necessary for the A.CY.1 movement certificates to be produced
column589:
as from the date of entry into force of the Agreement. 
 
 Article 19
 The Republic of Cyprus
column590: the Member States and the Community shall
column591: each to the extent to which they are concerned
column592:
take the necessary steps to implement this Protocol. 
 
 Article 20
 The explanatory notes
column595:
the model of the A.CY.1 movement certificate and that of the  A.CY.2 form annexed to this Protocol shall form an integral part of the latter. 
 
 Article 21
 Goods which conform to the provisions of Title I and which
column596: on the date of entry into force of the Agreement
column597: are either being transported or are being held in a Member State or Cyprus under temporary warehouse procedure
column598: in bonded warehouses or in free zones
column599: including free ports and free bonded warehouses
column600: may be allowed to benefit from the provisions of the Agreement
column601: subject to the submission - within four months from that date - to the customs authorities of the importing state of an A.CY.1 movement certificate
column602: issued retrospectively by the authorities of the exporting State
column603:
and of any documents that provide supporting evidence of direct transport.  
 
  ANNEX I EXPLANATORY NOTES 
 Note 1 - Article 1 
 The terms "in the Member States" or "in Cyprus" shall also cover territorial waters. 
 Ships operating on the high seas
column604: including \"factory ships\" on which the fish caught is worked or processed
column605: shall be considered as part of the Member State to which they belong or of Cyprus provided that they satisfy the conditions laid down in Explanatory Note 4. \n Note 2 - Article 1 \n In order to determine whether goods originate in a Member State or in Cyprus
column606: it shall not be necessary to establish whether the power and fuel
column607: plant and equipment and machine tools used to obtain such goods originate or not in third countries. \n Note 3 - Article 1 \n Packing shall be considered as forming a whole with the goods contained therein. This provision
column610: or by a company or firm with its head office in one of these States
column612: chairman of the board of directors or of the supervisory board
column613: and the majority of the members of such boards are nationals of a Member State or the Republic of Cyprus
column616: in the case of partnerships or limited companies
column618: the price to be taken into account shall be that paid to the last manufacturer. \n Note 6 - Article 8 \n Where an A.CY.1 movement certificate relates to goods originally imported from a Member State or Cyprus and re-exported in the same state
column619: the new certificates issued by the re-exporting State must show in which country the original movement certificate was issued. \n Note 7 - Article 13 \n After completing the A.CY.2 form
column620: the exporter shall insert the words \"A.CY.2\"
column621: followed by the serial number of the form used
column622: either on the C 1 green label or on the C 2/C P 3 or C 2 M/C P 3 M customs declaration. The invoice concerning the goods contained in the consignment shall also contain the words \"A.CY.2\" and the serial number of the form used.  \n \n ANNEX II LIST A  List of working or processing operations which result in a change of tariff heading without conferring the status of \"originating products\" on the products undergoing such operations
column623:
or conferring this status only subject to certain conditions

    FINAL ACT 
 The Plenipotentiaries of 
 THE COUNCIL OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
column625: \n and \n THE GOVERNMENT OF THE REPUBLIC OF CYPRUS
column628: on this nineteenth day of December
column629: in the year one thousand nine hundred and seventy-two
column630: \n for the purpose of signing the Agreement establishing an Association between the European Economic Community and the Republic of Cyprus
column632: at the time of signing this Agreement
column633: - adopted the following Joint Declarations by the Contracting Parties:    1. Joint Declaration by the Contracting Parties concerning cooperation and contacts between the European Parliament and the House of Representatives of the Republic of Cyprus
column634: \n      2. Joint Declaration by the Contracting Parties concerning amendments to the customs tariffs and to the import regulations
column635: \n      3. Joint Declaration by the Contracting Parties concerning Article 2 of the Agreement
column636:
4. Joint Declaration by the Contracting Parties concerning Article 2 of Annex I; 
 
 
 - and have taken note of the following Declarations:    1. Declaration by the European Economic Community concerning agricultural products
column637:
2. Declaration by the Republic of Cyprus concerning Article 6 of Annex II. 
 
 
 The aforementioned Declarations are annexed to this Final Act. 
 The Plenipotentiaries have agreed that these Declarations shall
column640: under the same conditions as the Agreement
column641: to the procedures required to ensure their validity.  \n Zu Urkund dessen haben die unterzeichneten Bevollm\u00e4chtigten ihre Unterschriften unter diese Schlu\u00dfakte gesetzt. \n En foi de quoi

column644: the undersigned Plenipotentiaries have affixed their signatures below the Final Act. \n Geschehen zu Br\u00fcssel am neunzehnten Dezember neunzehnhundertzweiundsiebzig. \n Fait \u00e0 Bruxelles
column645: le dix-neuf d\u00e9cembre mil neuf cent soixante-douze. \n Fatto a Bruxelles
column646: add\u00ec diciannove dicembre millenovecentosettantadue. \n Gedaan te Brussel

column648: \n Pour le Conseil des Communaut\u00e9s europ\u00e9ennes

column654: wenn sie der anderen Vertragspartei notifiziert hat
column655: da\u00df die durch den Vertrag zur Gr\u00fcndung der Europ\u00e4ischen Wirtschaftsgemeinschaft vorgeschriebenen Verfahren
column656: namentlich die Anh\u00f6rung des Europ\u00e4ischen Parlaments
column657: stattgefunden haben. \n Sous r\u00e9serve que la Communaut\u00e9 \u00e9conomique europ\u00e9enne ne sera d\u00e9finitivement engag\u00e9e qu''apr\u00e8s notification \u00e0 l''autre partie contractante de l''accomplissement des proc\u00e9dures requises par le trait\u00e9 instituant la Communaut\u00e9 \u00e9conomique europ\u00e9enne et notamment la consultation de l''Assembl\u00e9e. \n Con riserva che la Comunit\u00e0 economica europea sar\u00e0 definitivamente vincolata soltanto dopo la notifica all''altra parte contraente dell''espletamento delle procedure richieste dal trattato che istituisce la Comunit\u00e0 economica europea e

column660: met name van de raadpleging van het Europese Parlement. \n Provided that the Community shall be finally bound only after the other Contracting Party has been notified that the procedures required by the Treaty establishing the European Economic Community
column664: have been completed.  \n Im Namen der Regierung der Republik Zypern

 ANNEX
 Joint Declaration by the Contracting Parties concerning cooperation and contacts between the European Parliament and the House of Representatives of the Republic of Cyprus 
 The Contracting Parties agree to take all appropriate measures in order to facilitate cooperation and contacts between the European Parliament and the House of Representatives of the Republic of Cyprus. 
  Joint Declaration by the Contracting Parties concerning amendments to the customs tariffs and to the import regulations 
 The Contracting Parties agree to notify each other with the least possible delay of any amendments made to their respective customs tariffs
column670: or to the regulations governing their import trade. \n   Joint Declaration by the Contracting Parties concerning Article 2 of the Agreement\n    1. The Republic of Cyprus envisages the progressive establishment
column671: during the course of the second stage of the Agreement
column672: of a customs union with the European Economic Community. To this end
column673: the Republic of Cyprus envisages applying with due regard to its economic situation
column674: to the products mentioned in List A of Annex II to the Agreement
column675: as from the commencement of the second stage an initial reduction vis-\u00e0-vis the Community of at least 35 % of customs duties and taxes having an equivalent effect. \n      2. The European Economic Community envisages granting the Republic of Cyprus
column676: from the commencement of the second stage
column677: exemption from customs duties and taxes having equivalent effect in respect of products referred to in Article 1 of Annex I of the Agreement. \n      3. The procedures for the introduction by the Republic of Cyprus of the common customs tariff
column678: the elimination of the customs duties and quantitative restrictions applied vis-\u00e0-vis the Community
column679: complementary provisions for the proper implementation of the customs union
column680: and the special arrangements for the importation into the Community of products falling under Annex II of the Treaty establishing the European Economic Community or subject to a specific regulation within the framework of the Common Agricultural Policy
column681: which latter arrangements shall take due account of this policy of the Community
column682:
shall be determined during the course of negotiations for transition to the second stage.  
 
 
   Joint Declaration by the Contracting Parties concerning Article 2 of Annex I 
 The Contracting Parties
column683: taking into consideration the undertaking by the Republic of Cyprus to apply the Common Customs Tariff during the second stage of the Agreement
column685: for the purpose of the implementation of the Protocol concerning the definition of \"originating\" products and on methods of administrative cooperation
column686: the special provisions mentioned in List A to that Protocol shall not be applicable
column689: made under the conditions laid down in Article 2 of Annex I
column690: of products falling under tariff heading Nos 56.04 (man-made fibres discontinuous or waste
column692: combed or otherwise prepared for spinning) and 61.01 (men''s and boys'' outer garments). \n  Declaration by the European Economic Community concerning agricultural products \n The Community is prepared to re-examine with the Republic of Cyprus
column693: the agricultural content of the Agreement in the light of the result of work in progress with a view to a global approach on the Community''s relations with the Mediterranean countries. In the course of this work the interests of Cyprus shall also be taken into consideration. \n    Declaration by the Republic of Cyprus concerning Article 6 of Annex II \n The Government of the Republic of Cyprus declares that it is prepared to take the necessary steps to procure that
column694: during the first stage of the Agreement
column695: imports which are still subject to quantitative restrictions shall be freed from such restrictions as early as possible and to the extent compatible with the proper development of the economy of Cyprus. \n It also declares that it is prepared to ensure that
column696: when products still subject to quantitative restrictions are imported
column697: normal conditions of competition are respected."'

PROTOCOL  laying down certain provisions relating to the Agreement establishing an Association between the European Economic Community and the Republic of Cyprus consequent on the Accession of new Member States to the European Economic Community
  THE COUNCIL OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
column17: \n THE GOVERNMENT OF THE REPUBLIC OF CYPRUS
column19: \n HAVE DECIDED to determine by mutual agreement certain transitional measures and adaptations to the Agreement establishing an Association between the European Economic Community and the Republic of Cyprus signed at Brussels the nineteenth day of December one thousand nine hundred and seventy-two
column20: which are necessary consequent on the Accession of the Kingdom of Denmark
column21: Ireland and the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland to the European Economic Community
column22: and to this end have designated as their Plenipotentiaries: \n THE COUNCIL OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES: \n Mr W.K.N. SCHMELZER
column23: \n President of the Council of the European Communities
column24: \n Minister for Foreign Affairs of the Netherlands; \n Mr Sicco L. MANSHOLT
column26: \n Minister for Foreign Affairs; \n Mr Titos PHANOS
column27: \n Ambassador
column28: \n Head of the Cypriot Mission to the European Communities; \n WHO
column29: having exchanged their Full Powers
column30: found in good and due form
column31:
HAVE AGREED AS FOLLOWS: 
 
   TITLE I Measures of adaptation 
 Article 1
 The text of the Agreement and the declarations annexed to the Final Act drawn up in Danish and annexed to this Protocol are authentic in the same way as the original texts. 
 
 Article 2
 The annual tariff quotas for the Republic of Cyprus in application of Article 2 of Annex I to the Agreement and of the Joint Declaration thereon by the contracting parties shall be increased as follows: >PIC FILE= "T0004256">  
 
 TITLE II Transitional measures 
 Article 3
 The Kingdom of Denmark shall apply in respect of the Republic of Cyprus the reductions in customs duties and charges having equivalent effect provided for in Articles 1
column36: 6 and 7 of Annex I to the Agreement and at rates shown therein. \n However
column37:
the duties thus reduced may in no case be lower than those applied by the Kingdom of Denmark in respect of the Community as originally constituted. 
 
 Article 4
 1. Ireland and the United Kingdom shall apply to imports originating in Cyprus the customs duties and rules of origin applied in respect of the Republic of Cyprus at the time of entry into force of the Protocol. 
 This provision shall apply until 30 June 1977. 
 2. Products originating in Cyprus in respect of which the rates of customs duties and charges having equivalent effect
column38: reduced in accordance with Articles 1
column43: 6 and 7 of Annex I to the Agreement and calculated in accordance with Article 5
column44: are lower than the customs duties and charges having equivalent effect applied by Ireland and the United Kingdom in respect of the Republic of Cyprus at the time of entry into force of the Protocol may be imported into Ireland and the United Kingdom at the reduced rates of customs duties and charges having equivalent effect set out in the Agreement and under the rules of origin appropriate thereto. \n However
column45: the duties thus reduced may in no case be lower than those applied by Ireland and the United Kingdom in respect of the Community as originally constituted. \n 3. Should the progressive alignment of the Irish and United Kingdom tariffs on the Common Customs Tariff result in the application by Ireland and the United Kingdom as regards Cyprus of customs duties lower than those applied in respect of that State at the time the Protocol enters into force
column46:
the first-mentioned customs duties shall be applied. 
 
 Article 5
 1. The rates on the basis of which the new Member States apply to the Republic of Cyprus the reductions provided for in Articles 3 and 4 (2) shall be those which they apply at the time in respect of third countries. 
 2. By way of derogation from the provisions of Articles 3 and 4 (2)
column47: should the application of these provisions temporarily result in tariff movements away from alignment on the final duty
column48: the new Member States may maintain their duties until the level of these duties has been reached on the occasion of a subsequent alignment
column49:
or they may apply the duty resulting from a subsequent alignment as soon as this alignment reaches or passes the said level. 
 
 Article 6
 Subject to the effect to be given by the Community to Article 39 (5) of the Act concerning the Conditions  of Accession and the Adjustments to the Treaties
column50: annexed to the Treaty of Accession
column51: as regards the specific duties or the specific part of the mixed duties of the customs tariffs of Ireland and the United Kingdom
column52:
the provisions of Articles 4 and 5 shall be applied by rounding to the fourth place of decimals. 
 
 Article 7
 Where
column53: for the products listed in Annex I to the Agreement
column54: the new Member States apply duties comprising protective and fiscal elements
column55: only the protective elements of those duties
column56: within the meaning of Article 38 of the Act concerning the Conditions of Accession and the Adjustments to the Treaties
column57: shall be aligned on the preferential duties set out in that Annex and reduced as provided in Articles 3
column58:
4 and 5. 
 
 Article 8
 1. The minimum price provided for in Article 5 of Annex I to the Agreement shall be calculated in the new Member States by reference to the incidence of the duties which these Member States apply at the time to third countries. 
 2. The levies
column59: variable components and fixed components
column60:
referred to in Annex I to the Agreement shall be calculated in these States by reference to the rates they apply to third countries at the time. 
 
 Article 9
 The arrangements which the Kingdom of Denmark applies in respect of the Republic of Cyprus
column61: in application of Article 9 of Annex I to the Agreement
column62:
may under no circumstances be more favourable than those which it applies in respect of the Community as originally constituted. 
 
 Article 10
 1. Ireland and the United Kingdom shall apply to imports originating in Cyprus the quantitative restrictions in force in respect of Cyprus at the time of entry into force of this Protocol. 
 This provision shall apply until 30 June 1977. 
 2. The arrangements which Ireland and the United Kingdom apply in respect of the Republic of Cyprus may not be less favourable than those provided for in Article 9 of Annex I to the Agreement. 
 3. However
column63: the quantitative restrictions in force in Ireland which are referred to in Protocols Nos 6 and 7 of the Act concerning the Conditions of Accession and the Adjustments to the Treaties shall be abolished as regards the Republic of Cyprus in accordance with procedures to be determined
column64:
account being taken of the provisions of the abovementioned Protocols. 
 
 Article 11
 Until 31 December 1974
column65: imports into the United Kingdom of the products listed in Annex A and originating in Cyprus may be limited to the following annual quotas:    - 1973 : 100 metric tons
column66:
- 1974 : 125 metric tons. 
 
 
 
 Article 12
 The rules applicable under the common agricultural policy to imports of "Cyprus sherry" into the Community are set out in the exchange of letters at Annex B. 
 
 Article 13
 During the period from 1 January 1974 to 30 June 1977
column67: the Republic of Cyprus shall be entitled to annual tariff quotas
column68: free of customs duties
column69:
in respect of imports into the United Kingdom of the following products originating in Cyprus: >PIC FILE= "T0004257">  
 The annual tariff quota takes into account the traditional United Kingdom imports from Cyprus. 
 
 Article 14
 The Republic of Cyprus shall apply in respect of the Kingdom of Denmark the reductions in customs duties and charges having equivalent effect provided for in Articles 1
column71:
3 and 4 of Annex II to the Agreement at the rates and in accordance with the timetable set out therein. 
 
 Article 15
 1. The Republic of Cyprus shall continue to apply to imports originating in Ireland and the United  Kingdom the tariff and rules of origin applied prior to the Agreement
column72: without prejudice to the protective clauses of that Agreement. \n This provision shall apply until 30 June 1977. \n 2. Products originating in Ireland and the United Kingdom in respect of which the rates of customs duties and charges having equivalent effect
column73: reduced in accordance with Article 1 of Annex II to the Agreement
column74:
are lower than the customs duties and charges having equivalent effect applied by Cyprus at the time of entry into force of this Protocol may be imported into the Republic of Cyprus at the reduced rates of customs duties and charges having equivalent effect in accordance with the timetable set out in the Agreement and under the rules of origin appropriate thereto. 
 
 Article 16
 1. Until 1 January 1976 as regards the application of Article 1 (1) of the Protocol on the definition of the concept of "originating products" and on methods of administrative cooperation
column75: the condition as regards sufficient working or processing
column76: within the meaning of Article 3 thereof
column77: shall be waived only in respect of products originating
column78: within the meaning of that Protocol
column79: in Cyprus or in the Member States to which Cyprus applies a treatment not less favourable than that applied to products wholly obtained or produced in the exporting Member States where the products were obtained or produced. \n During the same period
column80: as regards the application of Article 1 (2) (b) of the abovementioned Protocol
column81: this condition shall be waived only in respect of products originating
column82: within the meaning of that Protocol
column83:
in the Member State of destination or in other Member States to which the Member State of destination applies a treatment not less favourable than that applied to products wholly obtained or produced in Cyprus. 
 2. The amendments to the provisions of the Protocol on the definition of the concept of "originating products" and on methods of administrative cooperation are listed in Annex C. 
 
 TITLE III Final provisions 
 Article 17
 This Protocol including Annexes A
column84:
B and C thereto form an integral part of the Agreement establishing an Association between the European Economic Community and the Republic of Cyprus. 
 
 Article 18
 This Protocol  shall enter into force on the first day of the month following the date on which the contracting parties notify each other of the completion of the procedures necessary to that end. 
 
 Article 19
 This Protocol is drawn up in two copies in the Danish
column85: Dutch
column86: English
column87: French
column88: German and Italian languages
column89:
each of these texts being authentic. 
 
 
   Til bekræftelse heraf har undertegnede befuldmægtigede underskrevet denne Protokol. 
 Zu Urkund dessen haben die unterzeichneten Bevollmächtigten ihre Unterschriften unter dieses Protokoll gesetzt. 
 En foi de quoi
column90: les pl\u00e9nipotentiaires soussign\u00e9s ont appos\u00e9 leurs signatures au bas du pr\u00e9sent protocole. \n In fede di che
column91: i plenipotenziari sottoscritti hanno apposto le loro firme in calce al presente protocollo. \n Ten blijke waarvan de ondergetekende gevolmachtigden hun handtekening onder dit Protocol hebben gesteld. \n In witness whereof
column92: the undersigned Plenipotentiaries have affixed their signatures below this Protocol. \n Udf\u00e6rdiget i Bruxelles
column93: den nittende december nitten hundrede og tooghalvfjerds. \n Geschehen zu Br\u00fcssel am neunzehnten Dezember neunzehnhundertzweiundsiebzig. \n Fait \u00e0 Bruxelles
column94: le dix-neuf d\u00e9cembre mil neuf cent soixante-douze. \n Fatto a Bruxelles
column95: add\u00ec diciannove dicembre millenovecentosettantadue. \n Gedaan te Brussel
column96:
de negentiende december negentienhonderdtweeënzeventig. 
 Done at Brussels on this nineteenth day of December in the year one thousand nine hundred and seventy-two.

 Brussels
column97: 19 December 1972 \n Your Excellency
column98: \n Concerning the implementation of the provisions of Article 12 of the Protocol
column99: I have the honour to place the following on record:    1. The Government of Cyprus undertakes to adopt before 1 September 1973 vine-products regulations corresponding to those of the Community which will enable it to examine the classification of the wine known as \"Cyprus sherry\". The Government of Cyprus undertakes also to make the said regulations applicable from 1 January 1975. \n      2. The Community
column100: for its part
column101: undertakes to examine
column102: on the basis of the agreed provisions mentioned above and within the same time limits
column103: the question of the classification of the wine known as \"Cyprus sherry\". \n   It also undertakes that the following measures will be taken for the marketing of this wine in Ireland and the United Kingdom:    - suspension
column104: while the abovementioned provisions are being implemented
column105: ie until 1 January 1975
column106: of the countervailing charges to which imports of this wine are subject
column107: in respect of an annual of 200 000 hectolitres
column108:
- appropriate extension of this suspension measure to the marketing of wines of the 1974 harvest. 
 
 
 I shall be obliged if you will confirm your agreement with the contents of this letter. 
 Please accept
column109: Your Excellency
column110:
the assurance of my highest consideration. 
 H. SIGRIST 
 Director-General 
 His Excellency Mr PHANOS 
 Head of the Mission of the Republic of Cyprus to the European Communities  Brussels

column119: while the abovementioned provisions are being implemented
column120: ie until 1 January 1975

column122: in respect of an annual quota of 200 000 hectolitres
column123:
- appropriate extension of this suspension measure to the marketing of wines of the 1974 harvest.

 ANNEX C concerning Article 16 (2)
   1. The following text is added under section I "Goods for which a movement certificate A.CY.1 may be endorsed" appearing on the back of the certificate
column128:
and under section I "Goods for which a form A.CY.2 may be made out" appearing on the back of Panel 2 of the form: 
 "These provisions shall be valid subject to the transitional measures and adaptations in the Protocol laying down certain provisions relating to the Agreement." 
      2. Movement certificates A.CY.1 and forms A.CY.2 which are based on the forms annexed to the Protocol on the definition of the concept of "originating products" and on methods of administrative cooperation may be endorsed by the customs authorities of the exporting State and used under the conditions laid down by that Protocol.  
 
 
    FINAL ACT
 The Plenipotentiaries of 
 THE COUNCIL OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
column129: \n of the one part
column130: and \n THE GOVERNMENT OF THE REPUBLIC OF CYPRUS
column131: \n of the other part
column132: \n meeting at Brussels on the nineteenth day of December one thousand nine hundred and seventy-two \n for the signature of the Protocol laying down certain provisions relating to the Agreement establishing an Association between the European Economic Community and the Republic of Cyprus consequent on the Accession of new Member States to the European Economic Community
column133: \n have
column134: in signing this Protocol
column135:
- adopted the following joint Declarations by the Contracting Parties:    1. Joint Declaration concerning Article 2 of the Protocol 
      2. Joint Declaration concerning Article 4 of the Protocol 
 
  - and taken note of the following Declaration: 
 Declaration by the European Economic Community on the regional application of certain provisions of the Agreement. 
 
 The Plenipotentiaries have agreed that these Declarations shall be subjected in the same manner as for the Protocol to any procedures that may be necessary to ensure their validity.

  Joint Declaration concerning Article 2 of the Protocol

column189: as regards the subheadings of the United Kingdom Customs Tariff which are to be deleted on 1 January 1974 as a result of the application of the nomenclature of the Common Customs Tariff and on which the duties are lower than the duties applied by the United Kingdom Tariff on the corresponding headings of the abovementioned nomenclature

 The European Economic Community declares that the application of the measures open to it under Article 10 of the Agreement might be limited

title: Exchange of letters pursuant to Article 2 of Protocol No 8 of the Agreement between the European Economic Community and the Portuguese Republic signed on 22 July 1972
text:
'"EUR-Lex - 21972A1220(01) - EN














Avis juridique important










|








21972A1220(01)




Exchange of letters pursuant to Article 2 of Protocol No 8 of the Agreement between the European Economic Community and the Portuguese Republic signed on 22 July 1972  






Official Journal L 301
column15:
31/12/1972 P. 0357
 Danish special edition: Series I Chapter 1972(31.12)L301 P. 0359 
 English special edition: Series I Chapter 1972(31.12)L301 P. 0359 
 












++++
EXCHANGE OF LETTERS  
PURSUANT TO ARTICLE 2 OF PROTOCOL NO 8 OF THE AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE EUROPEAN ECONOMIC COMMUNITY AND THE PORTUGUESE REPUBLIC SIGNED ON 22 JULY 1972  
LETTER NO 1  
SIR
column16: \nPURSUANT TO ARTICLE 2 OF PROTOCOL NO 8 OF THE AGREEMENT CONCLUDED BETWEEN THE EUROPEAN ECONOMIC COMMUNITY AND PORTUGAL AND FOLLOWING THE CLARIFICATIONS EXCHANGED ON THE CONDITIONS GOVERNING IMPORTS INTO THE COMMUNITY OF PREPARED OR PRESERVED SARDINES FALLING WITHIN THE COMMON CUSTOMS TARIFF SUBHEADING 16.04 D
column17: I HAVE THE HONOUR TO INFORM YOU THAT PORTUGAL UNDERTAKES TO ENSURE THAT THE PRICES CHARGED FOR IMPORTS INTO THE COMMUNITY ARE NOT LESS THAN THE PRICES SET OUT IN THE ANNEX AND ALSO TO PREVENT ANY DEFLECTION OF TRADE .  \nTO THIS END THE PORTUGUESE GOVERNMENT DECLARES THAT ALL EXPORTS TO THE COMMUNITY OF PREPARED OR PRESERVED SARDINES FALLING WITHIN THE COMMON CUSTOMS TARIFF SUBHEADING 16.04 D AND WHICH ORIGINATE IN AND COME FROM PORTUGAL ARE EFFECTED EXCLUSIVELY BY EXPORTERS WHOSE OPERATIONS ARE CONTROLLED BY \" L''INSTITUTO PORTUGUES DAS CONSERVAS DE PEIXE \" ( PORTUGUESE INSTITUTE FOR PRESERVED FISH ) .  \nFURTHERMORE
column18: THE ASSURANCES WITH REGARD TO PRICES WILL BE IMPLEMENTED IN THE MANNER AGREED BETWEEN \" L''INSTITUTO PORTUGUES DAS CONSERVAS DE PEIXE \" AND THE DIRECTORATE-GENERAL FOR AGRICULTURE OF THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES .  \nPLEASE ACCEPT
column19: SIR
column20:
THE ASSURANCE OF MY HIGHEST CONSIDERATION .  
... ( SIGNED ) AMBASSADOR  
ANNEX  
SIZE*NET WEIGHT*SEMI-GROSS WEIGHT*CAPACITY*COEFFICIENTS*MINIMUM PRICES CUSTOMS DUTIES INCLUDED U.A . PER CARTON OF 100 TINS*  
COMMERCIAL DESIGNATION*TOTAL HEIGHT MM*OUNCES*G*G*CUBIC CM**COMMUNITY*UNITED KINGDOM*  
*******IN OLIVE OIL*IN ANOTHER SAUCE*IN OLIVE OIL*IN ANOTHER SAUCE*  
RECTANGULAR BOTTOM***********  
1/10 CLUB*20*2*56*95*53*0
column150: 24*  \nLETTER NO 2  \nYOUR EXCELLENCY
column151: \nI BEG TO ACKNOWLEDGE RECEIPT OF YOUR LETTER OF TODAY WORDED AS FOLLOWS :  \n \" PURSUANT TO ARTICLE 2 OF PROTOCOL NO 8 OF THE AGREEMENT CONCLUDED BETWEEN THE EUROPEAN ECONOMIC COMMUNITY AND PORTUGAL AND FOLLOWING THE CLARIFICATIONS EXCHANGED ON THE CONDITIONS GOVERNING IMPORTS INTO THE COMMUNITY OF PREPARED OR PRESERVED SARDINES FALLING WITHIN THE COMMON CUSTOMS TARIFF SUBHEADING 16.04 D
column152: I HAVE THE HONOUR TO INFORM YOU THAT PORTUGAL UNDERTAKES TO ENSURE THAT THE PRICES CHARGED FOR IMPORTS INTO THE COMMUNITY ARE NOT LESS THAN THE PRICES SET OUT IN THE ANNEX AND ALSO TO PREVENT ANY DEFLECTION OF TRADE .  \nTO THIS END THE PORTUGUESE GOVERNMENT DECLARES THAT ALL EXPORTS TO THE COMMUNITY OF PREPARED OR PRESERVED SARDINES FALLING WITHIN THE COMMON CUSTOMS TARIFF SUBHEADING 16.04 D AND WHICH ORIGINATE IN AND COME FROM PORTUGAL ARE EFFECTED EXCLUSIVELY BY EXPORTERS WHOSE OPERATIONS ARE CONTROLLED BY \" L''INSTITUTO PORTUGUES DAS CONSERVAS DE PEIXE \" ( PORTUGUESE INSTITUTE FOR PRESERVED FISH ) .  \nFURTHERMORE
column153: THE ASSURANCES WITH REGARD TO PRICES WILL BE IMPLEMENTED IN THE MANNER AGREED BETWEEN  \" L''INSTITUTO PORTUGUES DAS CONSERVAS DE PEIXE \" AND THE DIRECTORATE-GENERAL FOR AGRICULTURE OF THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES . \"  \nI HAVE THE HONOUR TO INFORM YOU THAT THE PROVISIONS OF ARTICLE 2 OF PROTOCOL NO 8 OF THE AGREEMENT AND THE ARRANGEMENTS AGREED BY THIS EXCHANGE OF LETTERS ARE APPLICABLE FROM 1 FEBRUARY 1973 .  \nWHEN A DIFFERENCE IS NOTED BETWEEN SELLING PRICES ON THE COMMUNITY MARKET AND SELLING PRICES ON THE UNITED KINGDOM MARKET
column154:
DIFFERENT MINIMUM PRICES MAY BE LAID DOWN FOR EACH OF THESE MARKETS .  
I BEG TO REMIND YOU THAT THE PRICES SET OUT IN THE ANNEX ARE INCLUSIVE OF CUSTOMS DUTIES AND ARE VALID FOR ONE YEAR ONLY .  
I SHOULD BE GRATEFUL IF YOU WOULD KINDLY CONFIRM THE AGREEMENT OF YOUR GOVERNMENT WITH THE THREE PRECEDING PARAGRAPHS .  
PLEASE ACCEPT
column155: YOUR EXCELLENCY
column156:
