1.   Aftalen har til formål at fremme en stadig og afbalanceret styrkelse af de økonomiske og handelsmæssige forbindelser mellem parterne
column873:
under fuldt hensyn til nødvendigheden af at sikre en hurtigere udvikling af Tyrkiets økonomi og en højnelse af beskæftigelsesniveauet og livsvilkårene for det tyrkiske folk.


2.   For at virkeliggøre de i foranstående stykke nævnte målsætninger skal der ske en gradvis oprettelse af en toldunion under de betingelser og på de vilkår
column875:
4 og 5.


3.   Associeringen omfatter:














a)






en indledende fase;






















b)






en overgangsperiode;






















c)






en endelig fase.










Artikel 3


1.   I løbet af den indledende fase skal Tyrkiet med støtte fra Fællesskabet styrke sin økonomi med det formål at kunne opfylde de forpligtelser
column876:
som vil påhvile landet i overgangsperioden og den endelige fase.


Gennemførelsesbestemmelserne vedrørende denne indledende fase
column877: og is\u00e6r vedr\u00f8rende st\u00f8tten fra F\u00e6llesskabet
column878: fastl\u00e6gges i den midlertidige protokol og i Finansprotokollen
column879:
der begge er optaget som bilag til aftalen.


2.   Den indledende fase har en varighed på fem år
column880: medmindre der sker forl\u00e6ngelse i henhold til de vilk\u00e5r
column881:
der er fastsat i den midlertidige protokol.


Gennemgang til overgangsperioden sker på de betingelser og vilkår
column882:
som er opstillet i artikel 1 i den midlertidige protokol.


Artikel 4


1.   I løbet af overgangsperioden skal de kontraherende parter
column883: p\u00e5 grundlag af gensidige og afbalancerede forpligtelser
column884:
sikre:














—






den gradvise oprettelse af en toldunion mellem Tyrkiet og Fællesskabet;






















—






tilnærmelse af Tyrkiets økonomiske politik til Fællesskabets
column887: samt for at udvikle de f\u00e6lles foranstaltninger
column888:
der er nødvendige til at nå dette mål.










2.   Varigheden af denne periode må ikke overstige tolv år
column890:
som kan fastsættes ved fælles aftale. Disse undtagelser bør ikke være til hinder for gennemførelsen af en fælles toldunion inden for rimelig tid.


Artikel 5


Den endelige fase bygger på toldunionen og indebærer styrkelse af samordningen af de kontraherende parters økonomiske politik.


Artikel 6


For at sikre gennemførelsen og den gradvise udvikling af associeringsordningen mødes de kontraherende parter i et Associeringsråd
column891: som handler inden for gr\u00e6nserne af de bef\u00f8jelser
column892:
som er blevet det tillagt ved aftalen.


Artikel 7


De kontraherende parter træffer alle almindelige eller særlige foranstaltninger
column893: som er egnede til at sikre opfyldelsen af de forpligtelser
column894:
der følger af aftalen.


De afholder sig fra at træffe foranstaltninger
column895:
der vil kunne bringe virkeliggørelsen af aftalens målsætning i fare.




ANDEN DEL






IVÆRKSÆTTELSE AF OVERGANGSPERIODEN




Artikel 8


Til virkeliggørelse af de i artikel 4 fastsatte mål bestemmer Associeringsrådet
column896: inden overgangsperiodens begyndelse og i overensstemmelse med den i artikel 1 i den midlertidige protokol fastsatte fremgangsm\u00e5de
column898: formerne og tempoet for iv\u00e6rks\u00e6ttelsen af egnede foranstaltninger inden for de omr\u00e5der
column899: der er omhandlet i traktaten om oprettelse af Det europ\u00e6iske \u00f8konomiske F\u00e6llesskab
column900: og som skal tages i betragtning
column901: s\u00e6rligt de i denne del anf\u00f8rte
column903:
som måtte vise sig påkrævet.


Artikel 9


De kontraherende parter erkender
column904: at inden for denne aftales anvendelsesomr\u00e5de og med forbehold af de s\u00e6rlige bestemmelser
column905: som kan indf\u00f8res i medf\u00f8r af artikel 8
column907: der ud\u00f8ves p\u00e5 grundlag af nationalitet
column908:
forbudt i henhold til det i artikel 7 i traktaten om oprettelse af Det europæiske økonomiske Fællesskab anførte princip.


Kapitel 1




Toldunionen




Artikel 10


1.   Den i artikel 2
column909:
stk. 2 i aftalen omhandlede toldunion omfatter den samlede vareudveksling.


2.   Toldunionen omfatter:














—






forbud
column910: medlemsstaterne af F\u00e6llesskabet og Tyrkiet imellem
column912: afgifter med tilsvarende virkning som told og kvantitative restriktioner ved ind- og udf\u00f8rsel
column913: s\u00e5vel som mod alle andre foranstaltninger med tilsvarende virkning
column914: der tilsigter at sikre den nationale produktion en beskyttelse
column916: s\u00e5vel som tiln\u00e6rmelse til de \u00f8vrige ordninger
column917:
der anvendes af Fællesskabet på udenrigshandel.










Kapitel 2




Landbruget




Artikel 11


1.   Associeringsordningen omfatter landbrug og udveksling af landbrugsvarer i henhold til særlige bestemmelser
column918:
der fastsættes under hensyntagen til Fællesskabets fælles landbrugspolitik.


2.   Som landbrugsvarer forstås varer
column919: der er opf\u00f8rt p\u00e5 listen i bilag II til traktaten om oprettelse af Det europ\u00e6iske \u00f8konomiske F\u00e6llesskab
column920: som nu suppleret i medf\u00f8r af artikel 38
column921:
stk. 3 i nævnte traktat.


Kapitel 3




Andre bestemmelser af økonomisk art




Artikel 12


De kontraherende parter enes om
column923: 49 og 50 i traktaten om oprettelse af Det europ\u00e6iske \u00f8konomiske F\u00e6llesskab
column924:
gradvist indbyrdes at gennemføre arbejdskraftens frie bevægelighed.


Artikel 13


De kontraherende parter enes om
column925: p\u00e5 grundlag af artiklerne 52 til 56 og 58 i traktaten om oprettelse af Det europ\u00e6iske \u00f8konomiske F\u00e6llesskab
column927:
som begrænser etableringsfriheden.


Artikel 14


De kontraherende parter enes om
column929: 56 og 58 til 65 i traktaten om oprettelse af Det europ\u00e6iske \u00f8konomiske F\u00e6llesskab
column931:
som begrænser den frie udveksling af tjenesteydelser.


Artikel 15


Vilkårene for og den nærmere udformning af udstrækning af bestemmelserne i traktaten om oprettelse af Fællesskabet vedrørende transport
column932: samt af gennemf\u00f8relsesbestemmelserne hertil til ogs\u00e5 at omfatte Tyrkiet
column933:
fastlægges under hensyn til Tyrkiets geografiske beliggenhed.


Artikel 16


De kontraherende parter erkender
column936: de fiskale bestemmelser og i bestemmelserne om tiln\u00e6rmelse af lovgivningerne
column937: som findes i afsnit I i tredje del af traktaten om oprettelse af F\u00e6llesskabet
column941: som er n\u00f8dvendig for at sikre ligev\u00e6gt p\u00e5 landets globale betalingsbalance
column942: og for at bevare tilliden til dens valuta
column943:
samtidig med at den sikrer en varig og afbalanceret økonomisk ekspansion og et stabilt prisniveau.


Konjunkturpolitik og især finans- og pengepolitik anvendes til at nå disse mål.


Artikel 18


Hver stat
column944: der deltager i aftalen f\u00f8rer en vekselkurspolitik
column945:
som gør det muligt at sikre virkeliggørelsen af associeringsordningens mål.


Artikel 19


Medlemsstaterne af Fællesskabet og Tyrkiet tillader betalinger eller overførsler vedrørende udveksling af varer
column946: tjenesteydelser og kapital s\u00e5vel som overf\u00f8rsel af kapital og l\u00f8nninger i det lands valuta
column947: hvor kreditor eller de begunstigede er. bosiddende
column948: i det omfang den fri bev\u00e6gelighed for varer
column950:
tjenesteydelser og kapital er gennemført mellem dem i medfør af aftalen.


Artikel 20


De kontraherende parter konsulterer hinanden med henblik på at lette kapitalbevægelserne mellem medlemsstaterne i Fællesskabet og Tyrkiet til fremme af virkeliggørelsen af aftalens mål.


De bestræber sig på at undersøge alle midler til fremme af investeringer i Tyrkiet af kapital
column951: der stammer fra lande i F\u00e6llesskabet
column952:
og som vil kunne bidrage til udvikling af den tyrkiske økonomi.


Personer bosiddende i hver medlemsstat nyder alle fordele
column953: is\u00e6r i valutam\u00e6ssig og fiskal henseende
column954: med hensyn til behandling af fremmed kapital
column955:
som Tyrkiet indrømmer en anden medlemsstat eller et tredjeland.


Artikel 21


De kontraherende parter enes om at udarbejde en konsultationsprocedure
column956: som g\u00f8r det muligt at sikre samordningen af deres handelspolitik over for tredjelande og hensynet til deres indbyrdes interesser p\u00e5 dette omr\u00e5de
column957:
blandt andet i tilfælde af tredjelandes senere tiltrædelse af eller associering til Fællesskabet.




TREDJE DEL






ALMINDELIGE OG AFSLUTTENDE BESTEMMELSER




Artikel 22


1.   Til virkeliggørelse af de i aftalen fastlagte mål og i de tilfælde den opregner
column958: er Associeringsr\u00e5det beslutningsdygtigt. Hver af de to kontraherende parter er forpligtet til at tr\u00e6ffe s\u00e5danne foranstaltninger
column959:
som gennemførelsen af de trufne afgørelser nødvendiggør. Associeringsrådet kan ligeledes udforme nødvendige henstillinger.


2.   Associeringsrådet foretager periodisk en undersøgelse af resultaterne af associeringsordningen under hensyn til aftalens mål. I den forberedende fase begrænses disse undersøgelser dog til en udveksling af synspunkter.


3.   Fra begyndelsen af overgangsperioden træffer Associeringsrådet
column960: i tilf\u00e6lde af at en f\u00e6lles handling fra de kontraherende parters side viser sig n\u00f8dvendig
column962: som er egnede til ved iv\u00e6rks\u00e6ttelse af associeringsordningen at n\u00e5 et af m\u00e5lene i associeringsaftalen
column963: uden at denne udtrykkeligt har overdraget det de bef\u00f8jelser
column964:
der er påkrævet til dette formål.


Artikel 23


Associeringsrådet består dels af medlemmer af medlemsstaternes regeringer
column965: af R\u00e5det og af Kommissionen for F\u00e6llesskabet
column966:
dels af medlemmer af den tyrkiske regering.


Associeringsrådets medlemmer kan lade sig repræsentere på de betingelser
column967:
som er opstillet i forretningsordenen.


Associeringsrådet udtaler sig med enstemmighed.


Artikel 24


Formandsposten for Associeringsrådet beklædes for en periode på seks måneder af en repræsentant for Fællesskabet og af en repræsentant for Tyrkiet på skift. Varigheden af formandskabets første turnus kan forkortes ved Associeringsrådets beslutning.


Associeringsrådet fastsætter sin forretningsorden.


Det kan ved beslutning nedsætte ethvert udvalg til at bistå sig ved udførelsen af dets opgaver
column968: s\u00e6rligt et udvalg til sikring af den kontinuitet i samarbejdet
column969:
som er nødvendig for aftalens gode funktion.


Associeringsrådet fastlægger disse udvalgs opgaver og kompetenceområder.


Artikel 25


1.   Hver af de kontraherende parter kan forelægge Associeringsrådet enhver uoverensstemmelse vedrørende aftalens anvendelse eller fortolkning samt vedrørende Fællesskabet
column970:
en medlemsstat af Fællesskabet eller Tyrkiet.


2.   Associeringsrådet kan afgøre uoverensstemmelsen ved beslutning; det kan endvidere beslutte at indbringe uoverensstemmelsen for De europæiske Fællesskabers Domstol eller for enhver anden eksisterende dømmende myndighed.


3.   Hver part er forpligtet til at træffe sådanne foranstaltninger
column971:
som afgørelsens eller dommens gennemførelse nødvendiggør.


4.   Associeringsrådet fastsætter i overensstemmelse med artikel 8 i aftalen de nærmere regler for en voldgiftsprocedure eller enhver anden retslig procedure
column972: som de kontraherende parter kan p\u00e5ber\u00e5be sig i overgangsperioden og den afsluttende fase i tilf\u00e6lde af
column973:
at uoverensstemmelsen ikke har kunnet afgøres i henhold til stk. 2 i denne artikel.


Artikel 26


Bestemmelserne i denne aftale finder ikke anvendelse på varer
column974:
der er omfattet af Det europæiske Kul- og Stålfællesskab.


Artikel 27


Associeringsrådet træffer alle nødvendige foranstaltninger for at lette samarbejdet og de nødvendige forbindelser med Europa-Parlamentet
column975:
Det økonomiske og sociale Udvalg og Fællesskabets øvrige institutioner på den ene side og det tyrkiske parlament og de tilsvarende institutioner i Tyrkiet på den anden side.


Disse forbindelser begrænses dog i den indledende fase til forbindelsen mellem Europa-Parlamentet og det tyrkiske parlament.


Artikel 28


Når aftalens funktion har gjort det muligt at forudse Tyrkiets fuldstændige overtagelse af de forpligtelser
column976: der hidh\u00f8rer fra traktaten om oprettelse af F\u00e6llesskabet
column977:
undersøger de kontraherende parter muligheden for Tyrkiets optagelse i Fællesskabet.


Artikel 29


1.   Aftalen finder på den ene side anvendelse på kongeriget Belgiens
column981:
storhertugdømmet Luxembourgs og kongeriget Nederlandenes europæiske områder og på den anden side på republikken Tyrkiets område.


2.   Den finder ligeledes anvendelse på de franske oversøiske departementer
column982: for s\u00e5 vidt ang\u00e5r de omr\u00e5der i aftalen
column985:
første led i artikel 227 i traktaten om oprettelse af Fællesskabet.


Betingelserne for anvendelse på disse departementer af aftalens bestemmelser angående andre end de ovennævnte områder fastsættes senere ved aftale mellem de kontraherende parter.


Artikel 30


De protokoller
column986: som de kontraherende parter efter overenskomst har knyttet til denne aftale
column987:
udgør integrerende dele heraf.


Artikel 31


Signatarstaterne ratificerer aftalen i overensstemmelse med deres respektive forfatningsmæssige regler herom
column988: medens F\u00e6llesskabet indg\u00e5r den med bindende virkning ved en afg\u00f8relse i R\u00e5det
column989: der tr\u00e6ffes i henhold til bestemmelserne i traktaten om oprettelse af F\u00e6llesskabet
column990:
og meddeles aftalens parter.


Ratifikationsinstrumenterne og notifikationsdokumenterne vedrørende aftalens indgåelse som ovenfor anført udveksles i Bruxelles.


Artikel 32


Aftalen træder i kraft den første dag i den anden måned
column991:
der følger efter den i artikel 31 omhandlede udveksling af ratifikationsinstrumenter og notifikationsdokumenter.


Artikel 33


Aftalen udfærdiges i to eksemplarer på fransk
column995:
hver af disse tekster har samme gyldighed.




PROTOKOL Nr. 1


Midlertidig protokol


DE KONTRAHERENDE PARTER
column1000: om det under hensyntagen til Tyrkiets \u00f8konomiske situation er muligt i form af en till\u00e6gsprotokol at vedtage bestemmelserne for vilk\u00e5rene
column1001:
retningslinjerne og tempoet for gennemførelsen af den i aftalens artikel 4 omhandlede overgangsperiode.


Tillægsprotokollen undertegnes af de kontraherende parter og træder i kraft efter gennemførelsen af de forfatningsmæssige procedurer
column1002:
der kræves af hver af dem.


2.   Såfremt tillægsprotokollen ved udgangen af det femte år ikke har kunnet vedtages
column1003: indledes p\u00e5ny den i artikel 1 fastsatte procedure efter en af Associeringsr\u00e5det fastsat tidsfrist
column1004:
som ikke kan overstige tre år.


3.   Bestemmelserne i denne protokol forbliver gældende indtil tillægsprotokollens ikrafttræden og senest til udgangen af det tiende år.


Dog forlænges den midlertidige protokol for et tidsrum på højst et år i tilfælde af
column1006:
men ikke har kunnet træde i kraft ved udgangen af det tiende år.


Associeringsrådet træffer afgørelse om en videre ordning for den indledende fase
column1007: som finder anvendelse fra udgangen af det tiende \u00e5r
column1008:
i tilfælde af at tillægsprotokollen ikke har kunnet vedtages ved udgangen af det niende år.

Artikel 3


Fra tidspunktet for den endelige tilnærmelse af Fællesskabets medlemsstaters nationale toldsatser til den fælles toldtarif for de i artikel 2 omhandlede varer åbner Fællesskabet hvert år til fordel for Tyrkiet toldkontingenter for en mængde
column1028: der svarer til summen af de indtil nuv\u00e6rende tidspunkt \u00e5bnede nationale toldkontingenter. Denne fremgangsm\u00e5de anvendes med forbehold af bestemmelser
column1029:
som måtte vedtages af Associeringsrådet i medfør af artikel 4 for det følgende kalenderår.


For så vidt angår nødder finder denne fremgangsmåde dog først anvendelse
column1030:
når tilpasningen af Fællesskabets medlemsstaters nationale toldsatser til den fælles toldtarif for de tre øvrige varer er gennemført.


Artikel 4


Fra det andet år
column1032: kan Associeringsr\u00e5det vedtage at for\u00f8ge m\u00e6ngden af de i artiklerne 2 og 3 omhandlede toldkontingenter. S\u00e5fremt Associeringsr\u00e5det ikke tr\u00e6ffer anden afg\u00f8relse
column1033:
består disse forhøjelser fortsat. Ingen forhøjelse får virkning før begyndelsen af det følgende kalenderår.


Artikel 5


I tilfælde af at datoen for aftalens ikrafttræden ikke falder sammen med begyndelsen af kalenderåret
column1034: \u00e5bner F\u00e6llesskabets medlemsstater i tidsrummet fra datoen for aftalens ikrafttr\u00e6den til begyndelsen af det f\u00f8lgende kalender\u00e5r toldkontingenter
column1035:
der svarer til en tolvtedel af de i artikel 2 nævnte mængder for hver måned mellem datoen for aftalens ikrafttræden og begyndelsen af det følgende kalenderår.


Associeringsrådet kan dog ved aftalens ikrafttræden træffe afgørelse om forøgelse af omfanget af de toldkontingenter
column1036:
som fremkommer ved anvendelse af foregående afsnit for at tage hensyn til den sæsonmæssige karakter af udførslerne af de pågældende varer.


Artikel 6


Ved udgangen af det tredje år regnet fra aftalens ikrafttræden kan Associeringsrådet træffe afgørelse om foranstaltninger
column1037:
der vil kunne begunstige afsætningen af andre end de i artikel 2 omhandlede varer på Fællesskabets marked.


Artikel 7


Ved gennemførelsen af den fælles landbrugspolitik for tobak
column1038: n\u00f8dder eller t\u00f8rrede figner tr\u00e6ffer F\u00e6llesskabet de eventuelt n\u00f8dvendige foranstaltninger til opretholdelse af Tyrkiets muligheder for udf\u00f8rsler
column1040: som sikres i medf\u00f8r af denne protokol
column1041:
under hensyn til den for den fælles landbrugspolitik fastsatte ordning.


Artikel 8

PROTOKOL Nr. 2


Finansprotokol


DE KONTRAHERENDE PARTER
column1051: SOM DET LIGGER PÅ SINDE at fremme en hurtigere udvikling i den tyrkiske økonomi med henblik på at nå de i associeringsaftalen omhandlede mål
column1052:
ER BLEVET ENIGE om følgende bestemmelser:


Artikel 1

column1053: der bidrager til fremgang i den tyrkiske \u00f8konomis produktivitet
column1054: som fremmer udviklingen til opn\u00e5else af aftalens m\u00e5l
column1055: og som indg\u00e5r i den tyrkiske udviklingsplan
column1056: kan frems\u00e6ttes af staten og tyrkiske virksomheder til Den europ\u00e6iske Investeringsbank
column1057:
som oplyser dem om behandlingen af deres anmodninger.


Artikel 2


De imødekomne anmodninger finansieres ved hjælp af lån. Det samlede beløb for disse lån kan udgøre indtil 175 millioner regningsenheder og kan investeres i løbet af de fem år
column1058:
som følger aftalens ikrafttræden.


Artikel 3


Anmodninger om finansiering
column1060:
kan kun imødekommes med den tyrkiske regerings billigelse.

1.   Lånene ydes på grundlag af de økonomiske egenskaber
column1062: is\u00e6r til investeringer hvis rentabilitet er tvivlsom eller fjerntliggende
column1063: kan tildeles s\u00e6rlige betingelser i form af nedsatte rentesatser
column1065: afdragsfrie perioder og i p\u00e5kommende tilf\u00e6lde andre s\u00e6rlige regler for tilbagebetaling

column1067: der ikke er den tyrkiske stat
column1068:
er låneydelsen afhængig af den tyrkiske stats garanti.


Artikel 5


1.   Banken kan gøre låneydelsen afhængig af licitationsafholdelse eller indhentning af tilbud. Deltagelse i disse licitationer og denne indhentning af tilbud er ud fra synspunktet om lige konkurrencevilkår åben for alle fysiske eller juridiske personer
column1069:
der er statsborgere i Tyrkiet eller i Fællesskabets medlemsstater.

der er nødvendige for gennemførelse af de godkendte investeringsprojekter.


3.   Banken påser
column1071:

Artikel 6


Tyrkiet forpligter sig til at give de debitorer
column1073:

Den hjælp
column1074: der inden for rammerne af denne protokol ydes til gennemf\u00f8relse af visse projekter

column1076:
internationale finansorganisationer eller myndigheder og kredit- og udviklingsinstitutioner i Tyrkiet eller i Fællesskabets medlemsstater.

Artikel 9


Denne protokol bilægges aftalen.

I visse tilf\u00e6lde kan udtrykket \u00bbkontraherende parter\u00ab i overgangsperioden for traktaten om oprettelse af F\u00e6llesskabet betyde medlemsstaterne

HAVE AGREED upon the following provisions
column1175:
which shall be annexed to the Agreement of Association:


Article 1


This Protocol lays down the conditions
column1176:
arrangements and timetables for implementing the transitional stage referred to in Article 4 of the Agreement establishing an Association between the European Economic Community and Turkey.




TITLE I






FREE MOVEMENT OF GOODS




Article 2


1.   Chapter I
column1178:
and Chapter II of this Title shall apply:














(a)






to goods produced in the Community or in Turkey
column1179:
including those wholly or partially obtained or produced from products coming from third countries which are in free circulation in the Community or in Turkey;






















(b)






to goods coming from third countries and in free circulation in the Community or in Turkey.










2.   Products coming from third countries shall be considered to be in free circulation in the Community or in Turkey if the import formalities have been complied with and any customs duties or charges having equivalent effect which are payable have been levied in the Community or in Turkey
column1180:
and if they have not benefited from a total or partial drawback of such duties or charges.


3.   Goods imported from third countries into the Community or into Turkey and accorded special customs treatment by reason of their country of origin or of exportation
column1181: shall not be considered to be in free circulation in the territory of one Contracting Party if they are re-exported to the other Contracting Party. The Council of Association may
column1183:
make exceptions to this rule under conditions which it shall lay down.


4.   Paragraphs 1 and 2 shall apply only to goods exported from the Community on or after the date of signature of this Protocol.


Article 3


1.   Chapter I
column1185: and Chapter II of this Title shall likewise apply to goods obtained or produced in the Community or in Turkey
column1186: in the manufacture of which were used products coming from third countries and not in free circulation either in the Community or in Turkey. These provisions shall
column1188: apply to those goods only if the exporting State charges a countervailing levy
column1189: the rate of which is a percentage of the duties laid down in the Common Customs Tariff for third country products used in their manufacture. This percentage
column1190: fixed by the Council of Association for each of such periods as it may determine
column1191: shall be based on the tariff reduction granted on those goods in the importing State. The Council of Association shall also lay down the rules for the countervailing levy
column1192:
taking into account the relevant rules in force before 1 July 1968 in trade between Member States.


2.   The countervailing levy shall not
column1194: be charged on exports from the Community or from Turkey of goods obtained or produced under the conditions mentioned in this Article while the reduction of customs duties on the majority of goods imported into the territory of the other Contracting Party does not exceed 20 %
column1195:
taking into account the various timetables for tariff reductions fixed by this Protocol.


Article 4


The Council of Association shall determine the methods of administrative cooperation to be used in implementing Articles 2 and 3
column1196:
taking into account the methods laid down by the Community with regard to trade between Member States.


Article 5


1.   If either Contracting Party considers that differences arising from the application to imports of customs duties
column1197: quantitative restrictions or any measures having equivalent effect
column1198: or from any other measure of commercial policy
column1199: threaten to deflect trade or to cause economic difficulties in its territory
column1200: it may bring the matter before the Council of Association
column1203:
recommend appropriate methods for avoiding any harm liable to result therefrom.


2.   Where deflections occur or economic difficulties arise and the Party concerned considers that they call for immediate action
column1204: that Party may itself take the necessary protective measures
column1205:
and shall notify the Council of Association thereof without delay; the Council of Association may decide whether the Party concerned shall amend or abolish those measures.


3.   In the choice of such measures preference shall be given to those which least disturb the operation of the Association and
column1207:
the normal development of trade.


Article 6


During the transitional stage the Contracting Parties shall
column1208: in so far as may be- necessary for the proper functioning of the Association
column1209: take steps to approximate their law
column1210: regulation or administrative action in respect of customs matters
column1211:
taking into account the approximations already effected by the Member States of the Community.


CHAPTER I




THE CUSTOMS UNION




Section I




Elimination of customs duties between the Community and Turkey

1.   The Contracting Parties shall refrain from introducing between themselves any new customs duties on imports or exports or charges having equivalent effect

in their trade with each other at the date of entry into force of this Protocol.

column1215:

Article 8

column1216: in force between the Community and Turkey

Article 9


On the entry into force of this Protocol
column1218:

Article 10


1.   For each product
column1219:

2.   The timetable for the reductions to be effected by Turkey shall be as follows: the first reduction shall be made on the entry into force of this Protocol. The second and third shall be applied three years and five years later. The fourth and subsequent reductions shall be made each year in such a way that the final reduction is made at the end of the transitional stage.


3.   Each reduction shall be made by lowering the basic duty on each product by 10 %.

Notwithstanding Article 10 (2) and (3)
column1221: over a period of twenty-two years

column1226:

Eight further reductions

twenty-one and twenty-two years respectively after the entry into force of this Protocol.

1.   Turkey may
column1235: during the first eight years of the transitional stage
column1236: make the amendments to Annex 3 which are needed to protect the development of a processing industry which did not exist in Turkey at the time of entry into force of this Protocol

ad valorem
.

Article 13

customs duties on exports and charges having equivalent effect.


Article 16


1.   Article 7 (1) and Articles 8 to 15 shall also apply to customs duties of a fiscal nature.


2.   On the entry into force of this Protocol the Community and Turkey shall inform the Council of Association of their customs duties of a fiscal nature.


3.   Turkey shall retain the right to substitute for these customs duties of a fiscal nature an internal tax which complies with the provisions of Article 44.

column1292:
the value of imports provided for within the framework of the tariff quotas shall not exceed one third of the average value of Turkish imports of that product from third countries in the past three years for which statistics are available.










3.   Turkey shall notify the Council of Association of measures which it envisages taking in pursuance of paragraph 2.


At the end of the transitional stage the Council of Association may decide whether the provisions of paragraph 2 should be repealed or amended.


4.   In no case may the duty under a tariff quota be lower than that actually applied by Turkey to imports from the Community.


CHAPTER II




ELIMINATION OF QUANTITATIVE RESTRICTIONS BETWEEN THE CONTRACTING PARTIES




Article 21


Quantitative restrictions on imports and all measures having equivalent effect shall
column1293: without prejudice to the following provisions
column1294:
be prohibited between the Contracting Parties.


Article 22


1.   The Contracting Parties shall refrain from introducing any new quantitative restrictions on imports or measures having equivalent effect.


2.   However
column1297: at the date of the entry into force of this Protocol
column1298: apply only to 35 % of Turkish imports on private account from the Community in 1967. This percentage shall be increased to 40 %
column1303:
thirteen and eighteen years after the entry into force of this Protocol.


3.   Six months before each of the dates of the last three increases the Council of Association shall review the consequences for the economic development of Turkey of increasing the degree of liberalization and shall
column1304: if this is necessary for achievement of an accelerated development of the Turkish economy
column1305:
decide to postpone the increase for a period which it shall determine.


In the absence of a decision
column1306:
the increase shall be postponed for one year. The review procedure shall be repeated six months before expiry of that period. A further postponement of a year shall take place if the Council of Association again takes no decision.


At the end of this second period
column1307:
Turkey shall implement the increase in the degree of liberalization unless a decision to the contrary has been taken by the Council of Association.


4.   A list of products whose importation from the Community has been liberalized shall be supplied to the Community at the time of signature of this Protocol. The list shall be consolidated in respect of the Community. The lists of products liberalized at the deadlines mentioned in paragraph 2 shall also be supplied to the Community and consolidated in its respect.


5.   Turkey may reintroduce quantitative restrictions on imports of products which have been liberalized but not consolidated pursuant to this Article
column1308:
on condition that it opens quotas in favour of the Community equal to at least 75 % of the average imports from the Community during the three years preceding that reintroduction. These quotas shall be subject to the provisions of Article 25 (4).


6.   In no case may Turkey apply to the Community a treatment less favourable than that accorded to third countries.


Article 23


Without prejudice to Article 22 (5) the Contracting Parties shall
column1309: in their trade with one another
column1310:
refrain from making more restrictive the quantitative restrictions on imports and measures having equivalent effect existing at the date of entry into force of this Protocol.


Article 24


The Community shall
column1311: on the entry into force of this Protocol
column1312:
abolish all quantitative restrictions on imports from Turkey. This liberalization shall be consolidated in respect of Turkey.


Article 25


1.   Turkey shall progressively abolish quantitative restrictions on imports from the Community in accordance with the provisions of the following paragraphs.


2.   One year after the entry into force of this Protocol quotas in favour of the Community shall be opened for imports of each product which has not been liberalized in Turkey. These quotas shall be fixed so as to correspond to the average imports from the Community in the last three years for which statistics are available
column1313:
excluding imports financed:














(a)






by special aid resources connected with specific investment projects;






















(b)






without allocation of foreign currency;






















(c)






under the law on the promotion of foreign capital investment.










3.   Where
column1314: in respect of a product which has not been liberalized
column1315: imports from the Community in the first year after the entry into force of this Protocol amount to less than 7 % of total imports of that product
column1316:
a quota equal to 7 % of those imports shall be opened one year after the entry into force of this Protocol.


4.   Three years after the entry into force of this Protocol Turkey shall increase the aggregate of the quotas so opened by not less than 10 % over the amount thereof for the preceding year and by not less than 5 % by value of the quota for each product. These amounts shall be increased every two years in the same proportion in relation to the preceding period.


5.   From the thirteenth year after the entry into force of this Protocol each quota shall be increased every two years by at least 20 % in relation to the preceding period.


6.   Where
column1317: in respect of a product which has not been liberalized
column1318: there have been no imports into Turkey in the first year after the entry into force of this Protocol
column1319:
the rules for opening and increasing quotas shall be laid down by the Council of Association.


7.   If the Council of Association finds that during two successive years the imports of any product which has not been liberalized have been appreciably below the level of the quota opened
column1320:
that quota shall not be taken into account in calculating the total value of the quotas. In such case Turkey shall abolish quota restrictions on that product in respect of the Community.


8.   All quantitative restrictions on imports into Turkey shall be abolished not later than twenty-two years after the entry into force of this Protocol.


Article 26


1.   The Contracting Parties shall
column1322: abolish all measures having an effect equivalent to quantitative restrictions on imports from each other. The Council of Association shall recommend the progressive adjustments to be made during this period
column1323:
taking into account provisions adopted within the Community.


2.   In particular
column1325: in accordance with the timetables laid down in Articles 10 and 11
column1326:
progressively abolish the deposits required from importers for imports of goods from the Community.


Moreover
column1327: deposits amounting to more than 140 % of the dutiable value for customs purposes of goods imported from the Community
column1328: in the case of motor vehicle spare parts and accessories falling within heading No 87.06 of the Turkish Customs Tariff
column1329: and to more than 120 % of that value in the case of other products
column1330:
shall be reduced to these levels on the entry into force of this Protocol.


Article 27


1.   Quantitative restrictions on exports
column1331: and all measures having equivalent effect
column1332:
shall be prohibited between the Contracting Parties.


The Community and Turkey shall
column1333: by the end of the transitional stage at the latest
column1334:
abolish between themselves all quantitative restrictions on exports and any measures having equivalent effect.


2.   Notwithstanding the preceding paragraph
column1336: after consultation in the Council of Association
column1337:
retain or introduce restrictions on exports of basic products to the extent necessary to promote the development of specific sectors of their economies or to meet any shortage of those products.


In that event
column1338:
the Party concerned shall open in favour of the other Party a quota which takes into account the average exports for the last three years for which statistics are available and the normal development of trade resulting from the progressive achievement of the customs union.


Article 28


Turkey declares its readiness to abolish quantitative restrictions on imports from and exports to the Community more rapidly than is provided for in the preceding Articles
column1339:
if its general economic situation and the situation of the economic sector concerned so permit. To this end the Council of Association shall make recommendations to Turkey.


Article 29


The provisions of Articles 21 to 27 shall not preclude prohibitions or restrictions on imports
column1340: exports or goods in transit justified on grounds of public morality
column1341: public policy or public security; the protection of health and life of humans
column1342: animals or plants; the protection of national treasures possessing artistic
column1343: historic or archaeological value; or the protection of industrial and commercial property. Such prohibitions or restrictions shall not
column1345:
constitute a means of arbitrary discrimination or a disguised restriction on trade between the Contracting Parties.


Article 30


1.   The Contracting Parties shall progressively adjust any State monopolies of a commercial character so as to ensure that when the period of twenty-two years has ended no discrimination regarding the conditions under which goods are procured and marketed exists between nationals of Member States of the Community and nationals of Turkey.


The provisions of this Article shall apply to any body through which a Member State or Turkey
column1348:
determines or appreciably influences imports or exports between the Community and Turkey. These provisions shall also apply to monopolies delegated by the State to others.


2.   The Contracting Parties shall refrain from introducing any new measure which is contrary to the principles laid down in paragraph 1 or which restricts the scope of the Articles dealing with the abolition of customs duties and quantitative restrictions between the Contracting Parties.


3.   The procedure and the timetable in accordance with which the Turkish monopolies mentioned in this Article are to be adjusted and the barriers to trade between the Community and Turkey are to be lowered
column1349:
shall be laid down by the Council of Association not later than six years after the entry into force of this Protocol.


Until the Council of Association takes the decision provided for in the preceding subparagraph
column1350:
each Contracting Party shall apply to products subject to a monopoly in the territory of the other Contracting Party treatment at least as favourable as that applied to like products of the most-favoured third country.


4.   The obligations on the Contracting Parties shall be binding only in so far as they are compatible with existing international agreements.

column1352:
to specific rules as a result of the implementation of the common agricultural policy.

Article 32

column1353:
save as otherwise provided in Articles 33 to 35.


Article 33

column1354: at the end of that period
column1355:
those measures of the common agricultural policy which must be applied in Turkey if free movement of agricultural products between it and the Community is to be achieved.

column1357: in establishing and subsequently developing its agricultural policy

column1359:
and of the opinions issued and decisions taken with regard to such proposals.

column1360: and the measures in respect of agriculture which Turkey envisages taking in accordance with paragraph 1

may be the subject of consultation in the Council of Association.

column1362: having established that Turkey has adopted the measures of the common agricultural policy which are referred to in Article 33 (1)
column1363:

column1370:

TITLE II






MOVEMENT OF PERSONS AND SERVICES




CHAPTER 1




WORKERS




Article 36


Freedom of movement for workers between Member States of the Community and Turkey shall be secured by progressive stages in accordance with the principles set out in Article 12 of the Agreement of Association between the end of the twelfth and the twenty-second year after the entry into force of that Agreement.


The Council of Association shall decide on the rules necessary to that end.


Article 37


As regards conditions of work and remuneration
column1374:
the rules which each Member State applies to workers of Turkish nationality employed in the Community shall not discriminate on grounds of nationality between such workers and workers who are nationals of other Member States of the Community.


Article 38


While freedom of movement for workers between Member States of the Community and Turkey is being brought about by progressive stages
column1375: the Council of Association may review all questions arising in connection with the geographical and occupational mobility of workers of Turkish nationality
column1376: in particular the extension of work and residence permits
column1377:
in order to facilitate the employment of those workers in each Member State.


To that end
column1378:
the Council of Association may make recommendations to Member States.


Article 39


1.   Before the end of the first year after the entry
column1379:
into force of this Protocol the Council of Association shall adopt social security measures for workers of Turkish nationality moving within the Community and for their families residing in the Community.


2.   These provisions must enable workers of Turkish nationality
column1380: in accordance with arrangements to be laid down
column1381: to aggregate periods of insurance or employment completed in individual Member States in respect of old-age pensions
column1383:
and also as regards the provision of health services for workers and their families residing in the Community. These measures shall create no obligation on Member States to take into account periods completed in Turkey.


3.   The abovementioned measures must ensure that family allowances are paid if a worker''s family resides in the Community.


4.   It must be possible to transfer to Turkey old-age pensions
column1384:
death benefits and invalidity pensions obtained under the measures adopted pursuant to paragraph 2.


5.   The measures provided for in this Article shall not affect the rights and obligations arising from bilateral agreements between Turkey and Member States of the Community
column1385:
in so far as these agreements provide more favourable arrangements for Turkish nationals.


Article 40


The Council of Association may make recommendations to Member States and Turkey for encouraging the exchange of young workers; the Council of Association shall be guided in the matter by the measures adopted by Member States in implementation of Article 50 of the Treaty establishing the Community.

column1388: determine the timetable and rules for the progressive abolition by the Contracting Parties
column1390:

column1391: when determining such timetable and rules for the various classes of activity

column1393: in accordance with the rules which it shall determine
column1394: the transport provisions of- the Treaty establishing the Community with due regard to the geographical situation of Turkey. In the same way it may extend to Turkey measures taken by the Community in applying those provisions in respect of transport by rail
column1395:
road and inland waterway.

column1398:

column1403:
90 and 92 of the Treaty establishing the Community.

column1404:
aid to promote Turkish economic development shall be considered to be compatible with the proper functioning of the Association if such aid does not alter the conditions of trade to an extent inconsistent with the mutual interests of the Contracting Parties.

column1406: taking into account the economic situation of Turkey at that time

column1413:
whether directly or indirectly.

column1416:
provided that there is no infringement of the principles laid down in the preceding paragraphs.

column1417:
taking into account the experience of the Community in the field covered by this Article.

column1418: and in the case of charges other than turnover taxes

column1421: and countervailing charges in respect of imports may not be imposed

column1423:
or to the non-application of those decisions or of Articles 44 or 45.


Article 47


1.   If
column1424: during the period of twenty-two years
column1426: on application by a Contracting Party
column1427: finds that dumping is being practised in trade between the Community and Turkey
column1428:
it shall address recommendations to the person or persons with whom such practices originate for the purpose of putting an end to them.

column1429: after notifying the Council of Association
column1430:
take suitable protective measures where:














(a)






the Council of Association has taken no decision pursuant to paragraph 1 within three months from the making of the application;






















(b)






despite the issue of recommendations under paragraph 1

column1434: after informing the Council of Association
column1435: introduce interim protective measures which may include anti-dumping duties. Such measures shall not remain in force more than three months from the date of the application
column1436:
or from the date on which the injured Party takes protective measures under (b) of the preceding subparagraph.

column1437: or under the second subparagraph of that paragraph
column1440:
decide that such protective measures shall be suspended pending the issue of recommendations under paragraph 1.

column1442: be admitted into the territory of the former Contracting Party free of all customs duties
column1443:
quantitative restrictions or measures having equivalent effect.


The Council of Association may make any appropriate recommendations for the application of this paragraph; it shall be guided by Community experience in this field.


Article 48

column1444: regulations or administrative provisions in respect of fields which are not covered by this Protocol but have a direct bearing on the functioning of the Association
column1445:
and of fields covered by this Protocol but for which no specific procedure is laid down therein.

In order to facilitate attainment of the objectives set out in Article 17 of the Agreement of Association
column1446:
the Contracting Parties shall regularly consult each other in the Council of Association to coordinate their economic policies.


The Council of Association shall
column1448:
recommend appropriate measures.

column1449:
in so far as their economic situation in general and the state of their balance of payments in particular so permit.

column1455:
without the prior agreement of the Council of Association.


4.   If need be

the Contracting Parties shall consult each other on measures to be taken to enable the payments and transfers mentioned in Article 19 of the Agreement of Association and in this Article to be effected.


Article 51


In order to further the objectives set out in Article 20 of the Agreement of Association
column1458: on the entry into force of this Protocol
column1459:
endeavour to improve the treatment accorded to private capital from the Community which can contribute to the development of the Turkish economy.


Article 52


The Contracting Parties shall endeavour to avoid introducing any new foreign exchange restrictions on the movement of capital and current payments connected therewith between themselves
column1460:
and shall endeavour not to make the existing arrangements more restrictive.

CHAPTER III

Article 53


1.   The Contracting Parties shall consult each other in the Council of Association in order to achieve

in particular in the fields mentioned in Article 113 (1) of the Treaty establishing the Community.

column1470:

shall coordinate their commercial policies more closely with the aim of achieving a commercial policy based on uniform principles.

column1475:

column1476: where necessary to prevent barriers to the movement of goods within the Community
column1477:

column1480: and by private undertakings which have been granted special or exclusive rights
column1481:

Article 58


In the fields covered by this Protocol:














—






the arrangements applied by Turkey in respect of the Community shall not give rise to any discrimination between Member States
column1482:
their nationals or their companies or firms;






















—






the arrangements applied by the Community in respect of Turkey shall not give rise to any discrimination between Turkish nationals or Turkish companies or firms.










Article 59


In the fields covered by this Protocol Turkey shall not receive more favourable treatment than that which Member States grant to one another pursuant to the Treaty establishing the Community.


Article 60


1.   If serious disturbances occur in a sector of the Turkish economy or prejudice its external financial stability
column1483: or if difficulties arise which adversely affect the economic situation in a region of Turkey
column1484:
Turkey may rake the necessary protective measures.

2.   If serious disturbances occur in a sector of the economy of the Community or of one of more Member States
column1485: or prejudice the external financial stability of one or more Member States
column1486: or if difficulties arise which adversely affect the economic situation in a region of the Community
column1488: or authorize the Member State or States concerned to take
column1489:
the necessary protective measures.

3.   In the choice of measures to be taken in pursuance of paragraphs 1 and 2
column1490:
preference shall be given to those which will least disturb the functioning of the Association. These measures shall not exceed what is strictly necessary to remedy the difficulties that have arisen.


4.   Consultations may take place in the Council of Association on the measures taken in pursuance of paragraphs 1 and 2.


Article 61


Without prejudice to the special provisions of this Protocol
column1491:
the transitional stage shall be twelve years.


Article 62


This Protocol and the Annexes thereto shall form an integral part of the Agreement establishing an Association between the European Economic Community and Turkey.


Article 63

column1492:
taken in accordance with the provisions of the Treaty establishing the Community; the decision shall be notified to the Contracting Parties to the Agreement establishing an Association between the European Economic Community and Turkey.

2.   This Protocol shall enter into force on the first day of the month following the date of the exchange of the instruments of ratification and of the notification mentioned in paragraph 1.


3.   If this Protocol does not enter into force at the beginning of a calendar year
column1493: the Council of Association may shorten or lengthen the periods laid down in this Protocol
column1494: in particular those in which free movement of goods is to be achieved
column1495:
so that they may terminate at the end of a calendar year.


Article 64


This Protocol is drawn up in two copies in the Dutch
column1499:
each of these texts being equally authentic.

—






when a common definition of origin is adopted for petroleum products from third States and associated countries;






















—






when decisions are taken within the context of a common commercial policy;






















—






when a common energy policy is established.










In such a case
column1520:
the Community shall ensure that the imports referred to in paragraph 1 are accorded advantages equivalent to those provided for in that paragraph.


3.   Consultations may take place in the Council of Association on the measures taken in pursuance of paragraph 2.


4.   Where the Community does not adopt measures under paragraph 2 within three years
column1521:
the Council of Association may review the size of the quota laid down in paragraph 1.


5.   Apart from paragraphs 1 and 2 above
column1522:
the Additional Protocol shall not affect rules applied to the importation of petroleum products.

ANNEX No 4


on the use by Turkey of special aid resources


THE CONTRACTING PARTIES
column2617: desiring not to impede the use by Turkey of special aid resources
column2618:
HAVE AGREED AS FOLLOWS:














1.






If the provisions of the Agreement of Association or of the Additional Protocol impede the use by Turkey of special aid resources made available to its economy
column2620: after notification to the Council of Association
column2621:
be entitled:














(a)






to open tariff quotas in accordance with Article 20 (4) of the Additional Protocol for the importation of goods which are purchased with the resources in question;






















(b)






to import free of duty goods which constitute gifts under Title III of Public Law 480 of the United States or under a food aid programme;






















(c)






to restrict invitations to tender to suppliers of products originating in countries which grant special aid where the use of such resources entails the importation of products originating in those countries
column2622:
and where a tendering procedure is prescribed by the legislation of Turkey or of the countries in question.






























2.






Products imported into Turkey under this Annex may not be re-exported to the Community either unaltered or after working or processing.






















3.






The provisions of this Annex must not hamper the proper functioning of the Association.






















4.






At the end of the transitional stage the Council of Association may decide whether this Annex is to remain in force.


In the meantime
column2623: if any change is made to the nature of the resources referred to in paragraph 1 of this Annex or to the procedure to be followed for their use
column2624: or if any difficulties arise affecting their use
column2625:
the Council of Association shall review the situation with a view to taking the appropriate measures.














ANNEX No 5


on German internal trade and connected problems


THE CONTRACTING PARTIES
column2626: taking into consideration the conditions at present existing by reasons of the division of Germany
column2627:
HAVE AGREED AS FOLLOWS:














1.






Since trade between German territories subject to the Basic Law for the Federal Republic of Germany and German territories in which the Basic Law does not apply is a part of German internal trade
column2628:
the application of the Agreement of Association or of the Additional Protocol in Germany requires no change in the treatment currently accorded to this trade.






















2.






Each Contracting Party shall inform the other Contracting Party of any agreements relating to trade with the German territories in which the Basic Law for the Federal Republic of Germany does not apply
column2629:
and of any implementing provisions. Each Contracting Party shall ensure that implementation of such agreements does not conflict with the principles of the Association and shall in particular take appropriate measures to avoid harming the economy of the other Contracting Party.






















3.






Each Contracting Party may take appropriate measures to prevent any difficulties arising for it from trade between the other Contracting Party and the German territories in which the Basic Law for the Federal Republic of Germany does not apply.

FINANCIAL PROTOCOL


HIS MAJESTY THE KING OF THE BELGIANS
column2819: THE PRESIDENT OF THE FEDERAL REPUBLIC OF GERMANY
column2822: HIS ROYAL HIGHNESS THE GRAND DUKE OF LUXEMBOURG
column2823: HER MAJESTY THE QUEEN OF THE NETHERLANDS
column2828: ANXIOUS to promote an accelerated development of the Turkish economy in order to facilitate the pursuit of the objectives of the Agreement establishing an Association between the European Economic Community and Turkey
column2829:
HIS MAJESTY THE KING OF THE BELGIANS:


Mr Pierre HARMEL
column2836:
President in Office of the Council of the European Communities;


Mr Franco Maria MALFATTI
column2838:
Minister for Foreign Affairs;


HAVE AGREED AS FOLLOWS:


Article 1


Within the framework of the Association between the European Economic Community and Turkey
column2839: the Community shall supplement Turkey''s own endeavours by participating
column2840: in the manner laid down in this Protocol
column2841:
in measures to promote the development of that country.


Article 2


1.   Requests for financing may be submitted to the European Investment Bank by the Turkish State
column2842:
by an authority and by public or private undertakings which have their seat or a place of business in Turkey; the Bank shall notify them of the action taken on their application.


2.   Investment projects shall be eligible for financing where they:














(a)






help to increase the productivity of the Turkish economy and
column2844: aim to provide Turkey with a better economic infrastructure
column2848:
investment projects which are to be carried out on Turkish territory may be financed irrespective of the sectors of the economy to which they relate.










4.   Special consideration shall be given to projects which could serve to improve the Turkish balance of payments.


Article 3


1.   Requests which have been approved shall be financed by loans from the European Investment Bank acting on authority from the Member States of the Community.


2.   These loans may be granted up to an aggregate amount of 195 million units of account
column2849:
which may be committed in a period expiring on 23 May 1976. Any balance outstanding at the end of that period shall be used in accordance with the provisions of this Protocol until it is exhausted.


3.   The funds committed each year as a result of the granting of loans shall be distributed as evenly as possible over the whole period in which this Protocol is in force. However
column2852:
be committed in the first part of this period.


4.   To the amount specified in paragraph 2 there shall be added the undisbursed portion of loans committed pursuant to the first Financial Protocol but cancelled before the whole or a part of the relevant payments had been made.


Article 4


1.   Requests for financing which are not submitted by the Turkish Government cannot be approved without the agreement of that Government.


2.   Where a loan is granted to an undertaking or to an authority other than the Turkish State
column2853:
that loan shall be subject to a guarantee from the Turkish State.


3.   Undertakings whose risk capital comes wholly or partly from countries of the Community shall have access to the finance provided for in this Protocol on the same conditions as undertakings with Turkish capital.


Article 5


1.   Loans shall be granted on the basis of the economic features of the projects which they are to finance.


2.   Loans
column2854: especially those for capital investment projects
column2855: the return on which is indirect or long-term
column2856: may be granted for a maximum of thirty years
column2857:
and may be redemption-free for up to eight years. The rate of interest on such loans must be not less than 2.5 % per annum.


3.   Loans for the financing of projects showing a normal return
column2858: which must account for not less than 30 % of the amount of the loans granted to Turkey annually
column2859:
may be made on the following terms:














(a)






a loan period and a redemption-free period determined by the Bank
column2860: subject to the limits laid down in paragraph 2
column2861:
with a view to facilitating the servicing of loans by Turkey;






















(b)






a rate of interest of not less than 4.5 % per annum.










4.   The loans referred to in the preceding paragraph may be granted through the intermediary of appropriate Turkish agencies.


The choice of projects to be financed through these agencies and the terms on which loans by the Bank may be granted by the agency or agencies concerned to recipient undertakings
column2862:
shall be subject to prior approval by the Bank.


5.   Repayments by recipient undertakings which are not immediately needed by the intermediary agencies for the redemption of loans from the Bank
column2863:
shall be paid into a special account; the use of such amounts shall be subject to approval by the Bank.


Article 6


1.   All natural and legal persons who are nationals of Turkey or of Member States of the Community may participate on equal terms in tendering procedures
column2865:
transactions and contracts relating to projects for which loans have been granted.


2.   The loans may by used to cover expenditure on imports or domestic expenditure
column2866: where such expenditure is necessary for carrying out approved capital investment projects
column2868:
on the services of consulting engineers and on technical assistance.


3.   The Bank shall ensure that funds are used as judiciously as possible and in accordance with the objectives of the Agreement of Association.


Article 7


Turkey shall
column2869: for the whole period of a loan
column2870: make available to the recipients of the loan the currency necessary for the payment of interest and commission
column2871:
and for the repayment of capital.


Article 8


Contributions under this Protocol for the execution of certain projects may take the form of participation in financing operations in which
column2874:
international finance organisations or credit and development authorities and institutions in Turkey or of Member States of the Community may be concerned.


Article 9


1.   While this Protocol is in force the Community shall examine the possibility of supplementing the amount of the loans specified in Article 3 by loans granted by the European Investment Bank from its own resources and on market terms and whose aggregate amount may total 25 million units of account.


2.   These loans would be used to finance projects showing a normal return which are to be carried out in Turkey by private undertakings.


3.   The Statute of the European Investment Bank and Articles 4
column2875:
7 and 8 of this Protocol shall apply to these loans.


Article 10


The Contracting Parties shall
column2876: one year before expiry of this Protocol
column2877:
consider which of its provisions relating to financial assistance might be adopted for a further period.


Article 11


This Protocol shall be annexed to the Agreement establishing an Association between the European Economic Community and Turkey.


Article 12


1.   This Protocol shall be ratified by the Signatory States in accordance with their respective constitutional requirements and
column2879:
shall become binding by a Council Decision taken in accordance with the Treaty establishing the Community and notified to the Contracting Parties to the Agreement establishing an Association between the European Economic Community and Turkey.


The above instruments of ratification and the act of notification of conclusion shall be exchanged at Brussels.


2.   This Protocol shall enter into force on the first day of the month following the date of exchange of the instruments of ratification and act of notification of conclusion
column2880:
referred to in paragraph 1.


Article 13


This Protocol is drawn up in two copies in the Dutch
column2884:
each of these texts being equally authentic.




In witness whereof
column2885:
the undersigned Plenipotentiaries have signed this Financial Protocol.


Done at Brussels this twenty-third day of November in the year one thousand nine hundred and seventy.

column2908: SOM HAR SAT SIG FOR — i form af en tillægsprotokol — at fastsætte bestemmelserne vedrørende vilkårene
