DE KONTRAHERENDE PARTERS FÆLLES ERKLÆRINGER MED HENSYN TIL TILLÆGSPROTOKOLLEN
1. Fælles erklæring om beregning af told og afgifter
De kontraherende parter er enige om
column4954: at told og afgifter med tilsvernde virkning
column4955: som told som beregnes i overensstemmeldse med bestmmelserne i till\u00e6gsprotokollen
column4956: afrundes til f\u00f8rste decimal.\n2. F\u00e6lles erkl\u00e6ring om artikel 12
column4957: stk. 2\nDe kontraherende parter er enige om
column4959: der p\u00e5 tidspunktet for meddelelsen til Associeringsr\u00e5det i henhold til artikel 12
column4960: stk. 2 i till\u00e6gsprotokollen allerede befinder sig p\u00e5 toldoplag eller er under transport med henblik p\u00e5 udf\u00f8rsel
column4961: eller som er genstand for en fast salgskontrakt
column4963: der var g\u00e6ldende f\u00f8r indf\u00f8relsen af de foranstalninger
column4964: som Tyrkiet tr\u00e6ffer i henhold til samme artikel.\n3. F\u00e6lles erkl\u00e6ring om artikel 17
column4970: omtalte told if\u00f8lge den f\u00e6lles toldtarif er den told if\u00f8lge den f\u00e6lles toldarif
column4971: der faktisk anvendes p\u00e5 det tidspunkt
column4972: hvor den tyrkiske toldtarif tilpasses den f\u00e6lles toldtarif.\n4. F\u00e6lles erkl\u00e6ring om artikel 25
column4974: at ved beregningen af den samlede v\u00e6rdi af alle de kontingenter
column4975: der regelm\u00e6ssigt skal for\u00f8ges med 10% i henhold til artikel 25
column4978: b\u00f8r der ikke tages hensyn til v\u00e6rdien af de indf\u00f8rsler
column4979: som Tyrkiet har liberaliseret i l\u00f8bet af de i samme stk. anf\u00f8rte tidsrum.\n5. F\u00e6lles erkl\u00e6ring om artikel 27
column4983: i till\u00e6gsprotokollen ogs\u00e5 finder anvendelse p\u00e5 ikke-jernholdige metaller.\n6. F\u00e6lles erkl\u00e6ring om artikel 34\nDe kontraherende parter er enige om
column4985: som Associeringsr\u00e5det skal foretage i henhold til artikel 34 i till\u00e6gsprotokollen
column4986: kan p\u00e5begyndes et \u00e5r f\u00f8r udl\u00f8bet af perioden p\u00e5 toogtyve \u00e5r.\n7. F\u00e6lles erkl\u00e6ring om tolden i den f\u00e6lles toldtarif
column4987: anf\u00f8rt i bilag 2 og 6\nDen i bilag 2 og 6 omtalte told if\u00f8lge den f\u00e6lles toldtarif er den told if\u00f8lge den f\u00e6lles toldtarif
column4988:
der faktisk er gældende på ethvert tidspunkt over for de kontraherende parter i GATT.
FORTOLKENDE ERKLÆRINGER
Fortolkende erklÆring til artikel 25 i tillægsprotokollen
Det er vedtaget
column4990: der gennemf\u00f8res:\na) ved s\u00e6rlige bistandsmidler knyttet til bestemte investeringsprojekter
column4992: \nc) inden for rammerne af loven om fremme af investeringer af udenlandsk kapital
column4994: der er \u00e5bnet for F\u00e6llesskabet i henhold til artikel 25 i till\u00e6gsprotokollen
column4995: s\u00e6rlig stk. 4 og 5.\nFortolkende erkl\u00e6ring om regningsenhedens v\u00e6rdi omtalt i artikel 3 i finansprotokollen\nDe kontraherende parter erkl\u00e6rer
column4997: der er anvendt til at udtrykke det i artikel 3 i finansprotokollen n\u00e6vnte bel\u00f8b
column4999: 88867088 gram fint guld.\n2. Valutapariteten for en medlemsstat i F\u00e6llesskabet i forhold til den i stk. 1 definerede regningsenhed er forholdet mellem v\u00e6gten af fint guld indeholdt i denne regningsenhed og v\u00e6gten af fint gult svarende til den paritet
column5000: der for denne valuta er anmeldt til Den internationale Valutafond. I mangel af en anmeldt paritet
column5001: eller s\u00e5fremt der til l\u00f8bende betalinger anvendes kurser
column5002: der adskiller sig fra pariteten med en margin
column5005: skal v\u00e6gten af fint gult svarende til valutaens paritet beregnes p\u00e5 basis af den kurs
column5006: der anvendes af medlemsstaten til de l\u00f8bende betalinger p\u00e5 beregningsdagen for en valuta
column5007: som direkte eller indirekte er fastsl\u00e5et og konvertibel med guld p\u00e5 basis af den for denne konvertible valuta over for Valutafonden anmeldte paritet.\n3. Regningsenheden som defineret i stk. 1 forbliver u\u00e6ndret i hele finansprotokollens gennemf\u00f8relsesrid. Hvis der imidlertid f\u00f8r dennes udl\u00f8b tr\u00e6ffes beslutning om en ensartet \u00e6ndring af alle velutaers paritet over for guld af Den internationale Valutafond i medf\u00f8r af artikel 4
column5010: vil v\u00e6gten af fint guld for regningsenheden \u00e6ndre sig omvendt proportionalt med denne \u00e6ndring.\nHvis en eller flere medlemsstater i F\u00e6llesskabet ikke bringer den af Den internationale Valutafond i f\u00f8rste afsnit omtalte beslutning i anvendelse
column5011: vil regningsenhedens v\u00e6gt af fint guld \u00e6ndre sig omvendt proportionalt med den af Den internationale Valutafond besluttede \u00e6ndring. Imidlertid vil R\u00e5det for Det europ\u00e6iske F\u00e6llesskab unders\u00f8ge den opst\u00e5ede situation og p\u00e5 forslag fra Kommissionen og efter udtalelse fra Det monet\u00e6re Udvalg tr\u00e6ffe de n\u00f8dvendige foranstalninger med kvalificeret flertal.\nERKL\u00c6RINGER FRA REGERINGEN FOR FORBUNDSREPUBLIKKEN TUSKLAND VEDR\u00d8RENDE AFTALEN OM VARER
column5012: SOM HENH\u00d8RER UNDER DET EUROP\u00c6ISKE KUL- OG ST\u00c5F\u00c6LLESSKAB\n1. Erkl\u00e6ring om begrebet \u00bbtyske statsborgere\u00ab\nSom statsborgere i forbundsrepublikken Tyskland forst\u00e5s alle tyskere
column5013: s\u00e5ledes som dette begreb er defineret i dens grundlov.\n2. Erkl\u00e6ring vedr\u00f8rende anvendelsen af aftalen om varer
column5014: som henh\u00f8rer under Det europ\u00e6iske Kul- og St\u00e5lf\u00e6llesskab\nAftalen om varer
column5015: som henh\u00f8rer under Det europ\u00e6iske Kul- og St\u00e5lf\u00e6llesskab
column5016: finder tilsvarende anvendelse p\u00e5 Land Berlin
column5017: forudsat at regeringen for forbundsrepublikken Tyskland ikke inden tre m\u00e5neder har fremsat en modstridende erkl\u00e6ring."'

Agreement in the form of two Exchanges of Letters between the European Economic Community and Spain

 AGREEMENT   
 in the form of two exchanges of letters between the   European Economic Community and Spain   
 Geneva
column17: \n Upon the conclusion of the consultations which were held at   the resquest of the Spanish Delegation with a view to   modifying the threshold prices fixed by the Agreement of   5 June 1970 between Spain and the European Economic Community   for imports into Spain of certain cheeses
column18: I note that the   Spanish Delegation of the delegation of the Commission of the   European Communities have agreed the following :   \n - the threshold prices applied by Spain to imports of   cheese
column19: inclusive of the regulatory duty
column20: \n - the free-at-Spanish frontier prices to be observed before   customs clearance
column21: corresponding to the above threshold   prices

title: Agreement between the Member States of the European Coal and Steel Community and the Republic of Iceland - Final Act - Declarations
eurovoc_descriptors: charge having equivalent effect;customs duties;ECSC;Iceland;international agreement;quantitative restriction
text:
'"EUR-Lex - 21973A0722(01) - EN














Avis juridique important










|








21973A0722(01)




Agreement between the Member States of the European Coal and Steel Community and the Republic of Iceland - Final Act - Declarations  






Official Journal L 350
column15:
19/12/1973 P. 0002 - 0012
 Greek special edition: Chapter 11 Volume 6 P. 0037 
 Spanish special edition: Chapter 11 Volume 5 P. 0025 
 Portuguese special edition Chapter 11 Volume 5 P. 0025 
 












AGREEMENT  between the Member States of the European Coal and Steel Community and the Republic of Iceland
  THE KINGDOM OF BELGIUM
column17: \n THE FEDERAL REPUBLIC OF GERMANY
column19: \n IRELAND
column20: \n THE ITALIAN REPUBLIC
column21: \n THE GRAND DUCHY OF LUXEMBOURG
column22: \n THE KINGDOM OF THE NETHERLANDS
column23: \n THE KINGDOM OF NORWAY
column24: and \n THE UNITED KINGDOM OF GREAT BRITAIN AND NORTHERN IRELAND
column25: \n being Member States of the European Coal and Steel Community
column26: \n of the one part
column27: and \n THE REPUBLIC OF ICELAND
column28: \n of the other part
column29: \n WHEREAS the European Economic Community and the Republic of Iceland are concluding an Agreement concerning the sectors covered by that Community
column30: \n PURSUING the same objectives and desiring to find appropriate solutions for the sector covered by the European Coal and Steel Community
column31: \n HAVE DECIDED
column32: in pursuit of these objectives and considering that no provision of this Agreement may be interpreted as exempting the Contracting Parties from the obligations which are incumbent upon them under other international agreements
column33:
TO CONCLUDE THIS AGREEMENT:
 
   Article 1
 Imports into Iceland of products covered by the European Coal and Steel Community specified in the Annex and originating in the Member States of that Community shall be free of customs duties and charges having an effect equivalent to such duties and of quantitative restrictions and measures having equivalent effect under like conditions to those contained in Articles 19
column35:
21 and 22 and in Protocol No 3 to the Agreement between the European Economic Community and the Republic of Iceland signed this same day. 
 
 Article 2
 In the event of difficulties or serious threat of difficulties as regards its balance of payments
column36:
Iceland may take the necessary safeguard measures. 
 
 Article 3
 1. The provisions concerning customs duties on imports shall apply to customs duties of a fiscal nature. 
 Iceland may replace a customs duty of a fiscal nature or the fiscal element of a customs duty by an internal tax.  
 2. Iceland may retain customs duties of a fiscal nature on imports of products specified in Annex II to the Agreement between the European Economic Community and the Republic of Iceland signed this same day
column37:
under the conditions laid down in Article 5 (2) of that Agreement. 
 
 Article 4
 Consultations shall be held between the Contracting Parties whenever one of them considers that implementation of the above provisions necessitates such consultations. 
 
 Article 5
 Should production of a product covered by the European Coal and Steel Community be developed on Icelandic territory
column38: the Contracting Parties shall
column39: at the request of one of them
column40:
examine the new situation with a view to revision of the Agreement. 
 
 Article 6
 Either Contracting Party may denounce the Agreement by notifying the other Contracting Party. The Agreement shall cease to be in force twelve months after the date of such notification. 
 
 Article 7
 This Agreement is drawn up in duplicate
column41: in the Danish
column42: Dutch
column43: English
column44: French
column45: German
column46: Icelandic
column47: Italian and Norwegian languages
column48:
each of these texts being equally authentic. 
 This Agreement will be approved by the Contracting Parties according to their own procedures. 
 It shall enter into force on 1 January 1973 provided that the Contracting Parties have notified each other before that date that the procedures necessary to this end have been completed. 
 In the event of application of Article 2 (3) of the Decision of the Council of the European Communities of 22 January 1972 concerning the accession of the Kingdom of Denmark
column49: Ireland
column50: the Kingdom of Norway and the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland to the European Coal and Steel Community
column51: this Agreement may take effect only for the States that have deposited the instruments specified in that paragraph. \n After 1 January 1973
column52:
this Agreement shall enter into force on the first day of the second month following the notification referred to in paragraph 3. The final date for such notification shall be 30 November 1973. 
 The provisions applicable on 1 April 1973 shall be applied upon the entry into force of this Agreement if it enters into force after that date.
 
 
   Udfærdiget i Bruxelles

 The representatives of 
 THE KINGDOM OF BELGIUM

       DECLARATIONS
  Joint declaration by the Contracting Parties on a possible revision of the Agreement 
  The Contracting Parties declare that if the examination provided for in Article 5 of the Agreement leads them to revise the Agreement
column81: they will draw on the provisions as a whole of the Agreement between the European Economic Community and the Republic of Iceland
column82: particularly those designed to ensure that it functions properly. \n As regards the products of Chapter 73 of the Brussels Nomenclature covered by the European Coal and Steel Community
column83: a special safeguard clause will be provided for to enable the Member States of that Community to deal with any distortions or difficulties which might result from the absence in Iceland of the same regulation of prices as is imposed on Community undertakings. \n Should Iceland impose on its producers rules similar to those contained in Article 60 of the Treaty establishing the European Coal and Steel Community
column84: account being taken of those in Article 70 of that Treaty
column85: in respect of their transactions on the Icelandic and Community markets
column86: the Community will extend the application of the said rules to sales effected by its own producers on Icelandic territory. The special clause in favour of the Community could then be reciprocal. In this case
column87: the Agreement would be open to accession on the part of the European Coal and Steel Community. \n       Declaration by the Government of the Federal Republic of Germany concerning the application of the Agreement to Berlin \n The Agreement is also applicable to Land Berlin
column88:
in so far as the Government of the Federal Republic of Germany does not make a declaration to the contrary within three months of the entry into force of the Agreement

title: Agreement between the Member States of the European Coal and Steel Community and the Swiss Confederation - Final Act - Declaration
eurovoc_descriptors: charge having equivalent effect;customs duties;ECSC;international agreement;quantitative restriction;Switzerland
text:
'"EUR-Lex - 21973A0722(02) - EN














Avis juridique important










|








21973A0722(02)




Agreement between the Member States of the European Coal and Steel Community and the Swiss Confederation - Final Act - Declaration  






Official Journal L 350
column15:
19/12/1973 P. 0013 - 0028
 Spanish special edition: Chapter 11 Volume 5 P. 0036 
 Portuguese special edition Chapter 11 Volume 5 P. 0036 
 












AGREEMENT  between the Member States of the European Coal and Steel Community and the Swiss Confederation
  THE KINGDOM OF BELGIUM 
 THE KINGDOM OF DENMARK
column17: \n THE FRENCH REPUBLIC
column19: \n THE ITALIAN REPUBLIC
column20: \n THE GRAND DUCHY OF LUXEMBOURG
column21: \n THE KINGDOM OF THE NETHERLANDS
column22: \n THE KINGDOM OF NORWAY
column23: and \n THE UNITED KINGDOM OF GREAT BRITAIN AND NORTHERN IRELAND
column24: \n being members of the European Coal and Steel Community
column25: and \n THE EUROPEAN COAL AND STEEL COMMUNITY
column26: \n of the one part
column27: and \n THE SWISS CONFEDERATION \n of the other part
column28: \n WHEREAS the European Economic Community and the Swiss Confederation are concluding an Agreement concerning the sectors covered by that Community
column29: \n PURSUING the same objectives and desiring to find like solutions for the sector covered by the European Coal and Steel Community
column30: \n HAVE DECIDED
column31: in pursuit of these objectives and considering that no provision of this Agreement may be interpreted as exempting the Contracting Parties from the obligations which are incumbent upon them under other international agreements
column32:
TO CONCLUDE THIS AGREEMENT:
 
      Article 1
 This Agreement shall apply to products covered by the European Coal and Steel Community which are specified in the Annex and originate in that Community or the Swiss Confederation. 
 Article 2
 1. No new customs duty on imports shall be introduced in trade between the Community and Switzerland. 
 2. Customs duties on imports shall be progressively abolished in accordance with the following timetable:    (a) on 1 April 1973 each duty shall be reduced to 80 % of the basic duty; 
      (b) four further reductions of 20 % each shall be made on: 
 1 January 1974 
 1 January 1975 
 1 January 1976 
 1 July 1977.  
 
 
 
 Article 3
 1. The provisions concerning the progressive abolition of customs duties on imports shall also apply to customs duties of a fiscal nature. 
 The Contracting Parties may replace a customs duty of a fiscal nature or the fiscal element of a customs duty by an internal tax. 
 2. Denmark
column33: Ireland
column34: Norway and the United Kingdom may retain until 1 January 1976 a customs duty of a fiscal nature or the fiscal element of a customs duty in the event of implementation of Article 38 of the \"Act concerning the Conditions of Accession and the Adjustments to the Treaties\" drawn up and adopted within the Conference between the European Communities and the Kingdom of Denmark
column35: Ireland
column36:
the Kingdom of Norway and the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland. 
 
 Article 4
 1. The basic duty to which the successive reductions provided for in Article 2 are to be applied shall
column37: for each product
column38: be the duty actually applied on 1 January 1972. \n 2. The reduced duties calculated in accordance with Article 2 shall be applied rounded to the first decimal place. \n Subject to the application by the Community of Article 39 (5) of the \"Act concerning the Conditions of Accession and the Adjustments to the Treaties\" drawn up and adopted within the Conference between the European Communities and the Kingdom of Denmark
column39: Ireland
column40: the Kingdom of Norway and the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland
column41: as regards the specific duties or the specific part of the mixed duties in the Irish Customs Tariff
column42: Article 2 shall be applied
column43:
with rounding to the fourth decimal place. 
 
 Article 5
 1. No new charge having an effect equivalent to a customs duty on imports shall be introduced in trade between the Community and Switzerland. 
 2. Charges having an effect equivalent to customs duties on imports introduced on or after 1 January 1972 in trade between the Community and Switzerland shall be abolished upon the entry into force of the Agreement. 
 Any charge having an effect equivalent to a customs duty on imports
column44: the rate of which on 31 December 1972 is higher than that actually applied on 1 January 1972
column45:
shall be reduced to the latter rate upon the entry into force of the Agreement. 
 3. Charges having an effect equivalent to customs duties on imports shall be progressively abolished in accordance with the following timetable:    (a) by 1 January 1974 at the latest each charge shall be reduced to 60 % of the rate applied on 1 January 1972; 
      (b) three further reductions of 20 % each shall be made on: 
 1 January 1975 
 1 January 1976 
 1 July 1977. 
 
 
 
 Article 6
 No customs duty on exports or charge having equivalent effect shall be introduced in trade between the Community and Switzerland. 
 Customs duties on exports and charges having equivalent effect shall be abolished not later than 1 January 1974. 
 
 Article 7
 The provisions determining the rules of origin for the application of the Agreement between the European Economic Community and the Swiss Confederation signed this same day shall also be applicable to this Agreement. 
 
 Article 8
 A Contracting Party which is considering the reduction of the effective level of its duties or charges having equivalent effect applicable to third countries benefiting from most-favoured-nation treatment
column46: or which is considering the suspension of their application
column47: shall
column48: as far as may be practicable
column49:
notify the Joint Committee not less than thirty days before such reduction or suspension comes into effect. It shall take note of any representations by the other Contracting Party regarding any distortions which might result therefrom. 
 
 Article 9
 1. No new quantitative restriction on imports or measure having equivalent effect shall be introduced in trade between the Community and Switzerland. 
 2. Quantitative restrictions on imports shall be abolished on 1 January 1973 and any measures having an effect equivalent to quantitative restrictions on imports shall be abolished not later than 1 January 1975.  
 
 Article 10
 From 1 July 1977 products originating in Switzerland may not enjoy more favourable treatment when imported into the Community than that applied by the Member States of the Community between themselves. 
 
 Article 11
 The Agreement shall not modify the provisions of the Treaty establishing the European Coal and Steel Community or the powers and jurisdiction deriving therefrom. 
 
 Article 12
 The Agreement shall not preclude the maintenance or establishment of customs unions
column50: free trade areas or arrangements for frontier trade
column51: except in so far as they alter the trade arrangements provided for in the Agreement
column52:
in particular the provisions concerning rules of origin. 
 
 Article 13
 The Contracting Parties shall refrain from any measure or practice of an internal fiscal nature establishing
column53: whether directly or indirectly
column54:
discrimination between the products of one Contracting Party and like products originating in the territory of the other Contracting Party. 
 Products exported to the territory of one of the Contracting Parties may not benefit from repayment of internal taxation in excess of the amount of direct or indirect taxation imposed on them. 
 
 Article 14
 Payments relating to trade in goods and the transfer of such payments to the Member State of the Community in which the creditor is resident or to Switzerland shall be free from any restrictions. 
 The Contracting Parties shall refrain from any exchange or administrative restriction on the grant
column55:
repayment or acceptance of short- and medium-term credits covering commercial transactions in which a resident participates. 
 
 Article 15
 The Agreement shall not preclude prohibitions or restrictions on imports
column56: exports or goods in transit justified on grounds of public morality
column57: law and order or public security
column58: the protection of life and health of humans
column59: animals or plants
column60: the protection of national treasures of artistic
column61: historic or archaeological value
column62: or the protection of industrial and commercial property. Such prohibitions or restrictions must not
column63: however
column64:
constitute a means of arbitrary discrimination or a disguised restriction on trade between the Contracting Parties. 
 
 Article 16
 Nothing in the Agreement shall prevent a Contracting Party from taking any measures:    (a) which it considers necessary to prevent the disclosure of information contrary to its essential security interests; 
      (b) which relate to trade in arms
column65: munitions or war materials or to research
column66: development or production indispensable for defence purposes
column67:
provided that such measures do not impair the conditions of competition in respect of products not intended for specifically military purposes; 
      (c) which it considers essential to its own security in time of war or serious international tension. 
 
 
 
 Article 17
 1. The Contracting Parties shall refrain from any measure likely to jeopardize the fulfilment of the objectives of the Agreement. 
 2. They shall take any general or specific measures required to fulfil their obligations under the Agreement. 
 If either Contracting Party considers that the other Contracting Party has failed to fulfil an obligation under the Agreement
column68:
it may take appropriate measures under the conditions and in accordance with the procedures laid down in Article 23. 
 
 Article 18
 1. The following are incompatible with the proper functioning of the Agreement in so far as they may affect trade between the Community and Switzerland:    (i) all agreements between undertakings
column69: decisions by associations of undertakings and concerted practices between undertakings which have as their object or effect the prevention
column71:
it may take the appropriate measures under the conditions and in accordance with the procedures laid down in Article 23. 
 
 Article 19
 If the offers made by Swiss undertakings are likely to be detrimental to the functioning of the Common Market and if any such detriment is attributable to a difference in the conditions of competition as regards prices
column72:
Member States may take appropriate measures under the conditions and in accordance with the procedures laid down in Article 23. 
 
 Article 20
 Where an increase in imports of a given product is or is likely to be seriously detrimental to any production activity carried on in the territory of one of the Contracting Parties and where this increase is due to:    (i) the partial or total reduction in the importing Contracting Party
column73: as provided for in the Agreement
column75: it may take appropriate measures against this practice in accordance with the provisions of the Agreement on Implementation of Article VI of the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade
column76:
under the conditions and in accordance with the procedures laid down in Article 23. 
 
 Article 22
 If serious disturbances arise in any sector of the economy or if difficulties arise which could bring about serious deterioration in the economic situation of a region
column77:
the Contracting Party concerned may take appropriate measures under the conditions and in accordance with the procedures laid down in Article 23. 
 
 Article 23
 1. In the event of a Contracting Party subjecting imports of products liable to give rise to the difficulties referred to in Articles 20 and 22 to an administrative procedure
column78: the purpose of which is to provide rapid information on the trend of trade flows
column79: it shall inform the other Contracting Party. \n 2. In the cases specified in Articles 17 to 22
column80: before taking the measures provided for therein or
column81: in cases to which paragraph 3(e) applies
column82: as soon as possible
column83: the Contracting Party in question shall supply the Joint Committee with all relevant information required for a thorough examination of the situation with a view to seeking a solution acceptable to the Contracting Parties. \n In the selection of measures
column84: priority must be given to those which least disturb the functioning of the Agreement. \n The safeguard measures shall be notified immediately to the Joint Committee and shall be the subject of periodical consultations within the Committee
column85: particularly with a view to their abolition as soon as circumstances permit. \n 3. For the implementation of paragraph 2
column86: the following provisions shall apply:    (a) As regards Article 18
column87: either Contracting Party may refer the matter to the Joint Committee if it considers that a given practice is incompatible with the proper functioning of the Agreement within the meaning of Article 18 (1). \n The Contracting Parties shall provide the Joint Committee with all relevant information and shall give it the assistance it requires in order to examine the case and
column88: where appropriate
column89: to eliminate the practice objected to.  \n If the Contracting Party in question fails to put an end to the practice objected to within the period fixed by the Joint Committee
column90: or in the absence of agreement in the Joint Committee within three months of the matter being referred to it
column91: the Contracting Party concerned may adopt any safeguard measures it considers necessary to deal with the serious difficulties resulting from the practices in question ; in particular it may withdraw tariff concessions. \n      (b) As regards Article 19
column92: the Contracting Parties shall provide the Joint Committee with all relevant information and shall give it the assistance it requires in order to examine the case and
column93: where necessary
column94: to consider appropriate measures. \n If Switzerland fails to put an end to the practice objected to within the period fixed by the Joint Committee
column95: or in the absence of agreement in the Joint Committee
column96: the Member States may adopt the safeguard measures they consider necessary to avoid
column97: or put an end to
column98: any detriment to the functioning of the common market ; in particular they may withdraw tariff concessions. \n      (c) As regards Article 20
column99: the difficulties arising from the situation referred to in that Article shall be referred for examination to the Joint Committee
column100: which may take any decision needed to put an end to such difficulties. \n If the Joint Committee or the exporting Contracting Party has not taken a decision putting an end to the difficulties within thirty days of the matter being referred
column101: the importing Contracting Party is authorized to levy a compensatory charge on the product imported. \n The compensatory charge shall be calculated according to the incidence on the value of the goods in question of the tariff disparities in respect of the raw materials or intermediate products incorporated therein. \n      (d) As regards Article 21
column102: consultation in the Joint Committee shall take place before the Contracting Party concerned takes the appropriate measures. \n      (e) Where exceptional circumstances requiring immediate action make prior examination impossible
column103: the Contracting Party concerned may
column104: in the situations specified in Articles 20
column105: 21 and 22 and also in the case of export aids having a direct and immediate incidence on trade
column106:
apply forthwith the precautionary measures strictly necessary to deal with the situation. 
 
 
 
 Article 24
 Where one or more Member States of the Community or Switzerland is in difficulties or is seriously threatened with difficulties as regards its balance of payments
column107:
the Contracting Party concerned may take the necessary safeguard measures. It shall inform the other Contracting Party forthwith. 
 
 Article 25
 1. A Joint Committee is hereby established
column108: which shall be responsible for the administration of the Agreement and shall ensure its proper implementation. For this purpose
column109: it shall make recommendations and take decisions in the cases provided for in the Agreement. These decisions shall be put into effect by the Contracting Parties in accordance with their own rules. \n 2. For the purpose of the proper implementation of the Agreement
column110: the Contracting Parties shall exchange information and
column111: at the request of either Party
column112:
shall hold consultations within the Joint Committee. 
 3. The Joint Committee shall adopt its own rules of procedure. 
 
 Article 26
 1. The Joint Committee shall consist of representatives of the Contracting Parties. 
 2. The Joint Committee shall act by mutual agreement. 
 
 Article 27
 1. Each Contracting Party shall preside in turn over the Joint Committee
column113: in accordance with the arrangements to be laid down in its rules of procedure. \n 2. The Chairman shall convene meetings of the Joint Committee at least once a year in order to review the general functioning of the Agreement. \n The Joint Committee shall
column114: in addition
column115: meet whenever special circumstances so require
column116: at the request of either Contracting Party
column117:
in accordance with the conditions to be laid down in its rules of procedure. 
 3. The Joint Committee may decide to set up any working party that can assist it in carrying out its duties.  
 
 Article 28
 The Annex to the Agreement shall form an integral part thereof. 
 
 Article 29
 Either Contracting Party may denounce the Agreement by notifying the other Contracting Party. The Agreement shall cease to be in force twelve months after the date of such notification. 
 
 Article 30
 The Agreement shall apply
column118: on the one hand
column119: to the territories to which the Treaty establishing the European Coal and Steel Community applies upon the terms laid down in that Treaty and
column120: on the other
column121:
to the territory of the Swiss Confederation. 
 
 Article 31
 This Agreement is drawn up in duplicate in the Danish
column122: Dutch
column123: English
column124: French
column125: German
column126: Italian and Norwegian languages
column127: each of these texts being equally authentic. \n This Agreement will be approved by the Contracting Parties in accordance with their own procedures. \n It shall enter into force on 1 January 1973
column128: provided that the Contracting Parties have notified each other before that date that the procedures necessary to this end have been completed. \n In the event of application of Article 2 (3) of the Decision of the Council of the European Communities of 22 January 1972 concerning the accession of the Kingdom of Denmark
column129: Ireland
column130: the Kingdom of Norway and the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland to the European Coal and Steel Community
column131: this Agreement may take effect only for the States that have deposited the instruments specified in that paragraph. \n After 1 January 1973
column132:
this Agreement shall enter into force on the first day of the second month following the notification referred to in paragraph 3. The final date for such notification shall be 30 November 1973. 
 The provisions applicable on 1 April 1973 shall be applied upon the entry into force of this Agreement if it enters into force after that date.
 
 
    Udfærdiget i Bruxelles

title: 'Additional Agreement concerning the validity
of_effect: of the Agreement between the Member States of the European Coal and Steel Community and the Swiss Confederation of 22 July 1972'
column16:
'"EUR-Lex - 21973A0722(03) - EN














Avis juridique important










|








21973A0722(03)




Additional Agreement concerning the validity
column17: for the Principality of Liechtenstein
column18:
of the Agreement between the Member States of the European Coal and Steel Community and the Swiss Confederation of 22 July 1972  






Official Journal L 350
column19:
19/12/1973 P. 0029 - 0032
 Greek special edition: Chapter 11 Volume 6 P. 0053 
 Spanish special edition: Chapter 11 Volume 5 P. 0052 
 Portuguese special edition Chapter 11 Volume 5 P. 0052 
 












ADDITIONAL AGREEMENT  concerning the validity
column20: for the Principality of Liechtenstein
column21: of the Agreement between the Members States of the European Coal and Steel Community and the Swiss Confederation of 22 July 1972\n  THE KINGDOM OF BELGIUM
column22: \n THE KINGDOM OF DENMARK
column23: \n THE FEDERAL REPUBLIC OF GERMANY
column24: \n THE FRENCH REPUBLIC
column25: \n IRELAND
column26: \n THE ITALIAN REPUBLIC
column27: \n THE GRAND DUCHY OF LUXEMBOURG
column28: \n THE KINGDOM OF THE NETHERLANDS
column29: \n THE KINGDOM OF NORWAY
column30: and \n THE UNITED KINGDOM OF GREAT BRITAIN AND NORTHERN IRELAND
column31: \n being members of the European Coal and Steel Community
column32: \n THE SWISS CONFEDERATION
column33: and \n THE PRINCIPALITY OF LIECHTENSTEIN
column34: \n WHEREAS by the Treaty of 29 March 1923 the Principality of Liechtenstein and Switzerland constitute a customs union and whereas that Treaty does not confer validity for the Principality of Liechtenstein on all the provisions of the Agreement between the Member States of the European Coal and Steel Community and the Swiss Confederation signed on 22 July 1972; \n WHEREAS the Principality of Liechtenstein has expressed the desire that all the provisions of that Agreement should apply to it
column35:
HAVE AGREED AS FOLLOWS:
 
   Article 1
 The Agreement between the Member States of the European Coal and Steel Community and the Swiss Confederation signed on 22 July 1972 shall likewise apply to the Principality of Liechtenstein. 
 
 Article 2
 For the purpose of applying the Agreement referred to in Article 1 and without modifying its bilateral nature between the Member States of the Community and Switzerland
column36:
the Principality of Liechtenstein may cause its interests to be represented through a representative within the Swiss delegation to the Joint Committee.  
 
 Article 3
 This additional Agreement will be approved by Switzerland
column37:
the Principality of Liechtenstein and the Member States of the Community in accordance with their own procedures. It shall enter into force at the same time as the Agreement referred to in Article 1 and shall continue to apply for so long as the Treaty of 29 March 1923 remains in force.
 
 
   Udfærdiget i Bruxelles

title: 'Agreement between the Member States of the European Coal and Steel Community and the European Coal and Steel Community
legal_basis: Charges having an equivalent effect;common commercial policy;Common customs tariff;Customs Union;External relations;Free movement of goods
column17:
'"EUR-Lex - 21973A0722(04) - EN














Avis juridique important










|








21973A0722(04)




Agreement between the Member States of the European Coal and Steel Community and the European Coal and Steel Community
column19: and the Republic of Austria
column20:
of the other part  






Official Journal L 350
column21:
19/12/1973 P. 0033 - 0052
 Greek special edition: Chapter 11 Volume 6 P. 0057 
 Spanish special edition: Chapter 11 Volume 5 P. 0056 
 Portuguese special edition Chapter 11 Volume 5 P. 0056 
 












++++
AGREEMENT  
BETWEEN THE MEMBER STATES OF THE EUROPEAN COAL AND STEEL COMMUNITY AND THE EUROPEAN COAL AND STEEL COMMUNITY
column22: \nOF THE ONE PART
column23: \nAND THE REPUBLIC OF AUSTRIA
column24: \nOF THE OTHER PART  \nTHE KINGDOM OF BELGIUM
column25: \nTHE KINGDOM OF DENMARK
column26: \nTHE FEDERAL REPUBLIC OF GERMANY
column27: \nTHE FRENCH REPUBLIC
column28: \nIRELAND
column29: \nTHE ITALIAN REPUBLIC
column30: \nTHE GRAND DUCHY OF LUXEMBOURG
column31: \nTHE KINGDOM OF THE NETHERLANDS
column32: \nTHE KINGDOM OF NORWAY
column33: AND  \nTHE UNITED KINGDOM OF GREAT BRITAIN AND NORTHERN IRELAND
column34: \nBEING MEMBERS OF THE EUROPEAN COAL AND STEEL COMMUNITY
column35: AND  \nTHE EUROPEAN COAL AND STEEL COMMUNITY
column36: \nOF THE ONE PART
column37: AND  \nTHE REPUBLIC OF AUSTRIA
column38: \nOF THE OTHER PART
column39: \nWHEREAS THE EUROPEAN ECONOMIC COMMUNITY AND THE REPUBLIC OF AUSTRIA ARE CONCLUDING AN AGREEMENT CONCERNING THE SECTORS COVERED BY THAT COMMUNITY
column40: \nPURSUING THE SAME OBJECTIVES AND DESIRING TO FIND LIKE SOLUTIONS FOR THE SECTOR COVERED BY THE EUROPEAN COAL AND STEEL COMMUNITY
column41: \nHAVE DECIDED
column42: IN PURSUIT OF THESE OBJECTIVES AND CONSIDERING THAT NO PROVISION OF THIS AGREEMENT MAY BE INTERPRETED AS EXEMPTING THE CONTRACTING PARTIES FROM THE OBLIGATIONS WHICH ARE INCUMBENT UPON THEM UNDER OTHER INTERNATIONAL AGREEMENTS
column43:
TO CONCLUDE THIS AGREEMENT :  
ARTICLE 1  
1 . THIS AGREEMENT SHALL APPLY TO PRODUCTS COVERED BY THE EUROPEAN COAL AND STEEL COMMUNITY WHICH ARE SPECIFIED IN THE ANNEX AND ORIGINATE IN THAT COMMUNITY OR THE REPUBLIC OF AUSTRIA .  
2 . THE AGREEMENT SHALL REPLACE THE INTERIM AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE MEMBER STATES OF THE EUROPEAN COAL AND STEEL COMMUNITY AND THE REPUBLIC OF AUSTRIA SIGNED THIS SAME DAY .  
ARTICLE 2  
1 . NO NEW CUSTOMS DUTY ON IMPORTS SHALL BE INTRODUCED IN TRADE BETWEEN THE COMMUNITY AND AUSTRIA .  
2 . WITHOUT PREJUDICE TO THE TARIFF REDUCTIONS MADE UNDER ARTICLE 2 ( 2 ) OF THE INTERIM AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE MEMBER STATES OF THE EUROPEAN COAL AND STEEL COMMUNITY AND THE REPUBLIC OF AUSTRIA SIGNED THIS SAME DAY
column44:
CUSTOMS DUTIES ON IMPORTS SHALL BE PROGRESSIVELY ABOLISHED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE FOLLOWING TIMETABLE :  
 ( A ) ON 1 JANUARY 1974 EACH DUTY SHALL BE REDUCED TO 60 % OF THE BASIC DUTY ;  
 ( B ) THREE FURTHER REDUCTIONS OF 20 % EACH SHALL BE MADE ON :  
1 JANUARY 1975  
1 JANUARY 1976  
1 JULY 1977 .  
AS REGARDS TRADE BETWEEN IRELAND AND AUSTRIA
column45:
AN INITIAL REDUCTION SHALL BE MADE ON 1 APRIL 1973 TO REDUCE EACH CUSTOMS DUTY ON IMPORTS TO 80 % OF THE BASIC DUTY .  
ARTICLE 3  
1 . THE PROVISIONS CONCERNING THE PROGRESSIVE ABOLITION OF CUSTOMS DUTIES ON IMPORTS SHALL ALSO APPLY TO CUSTOMS DUTIES OF A FISCAL NATURE .  
THE CONTRACTING PARTIES MAY REPLACE A CUSTOMS DUTY OF A FISCAL NATURE OR THE FISCAL ELEMENT OF A CUSTOMS DUTY BY AN INTERNAL TAX .  
2 . DENMARK
column46: IRELAND
column47: NORWAY AND THE UNITED KINGDOM MAY RETAIN UNTIL 1 JANUARY 1976 A CUSTOMS DUTY OF A FISCAL NATURE OR THE FISCAL ELEMENT OF A CUSTOMS DUTY IN THE EVENT OF IMPLEMENTATION OF ARTICLE 38 OF THE \" ACT CONCERNING THE CONDITIONS OF ACCESSION AND THE ADJUSTMENTS TO THE TREATIES \" DRAWN UP AND ADOPTED WITHIN THE CONFERENCE BETWEEN THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES AND THE KINGDOM OF DENMARK
column48: IRELAND
column49: THE KINGDOM OF NORWAY AND THE UNITED KINGDOM OF GREAT BRITAIN AND NORTHERN IRELAND .  \nARTICLE 4  \n1 . THE BASIC DUTY TO WHICH THE SUCCESSIVE REDUCTIONS PROVIDED FOR IN ARTICLE 2 AND IN PROTOCOL NO 1 ARE TO BE APPLIED SHALL
column50: FOR EACH PRODUCT
column51: BE THE DUTY ACTUALLY APPLIED ON 1 JANUARY 1972 .  \n2 . THE REDUCED DUTIES CALCULATED IN ACCORDANCE WITH ARTICLE 2 AND PROTOCOL NO 1 SHALL BE APPLIED ROUNDED TO THE FIRST DECIMAL PLACE .  \nSUBJECT TO THE APPLICATION BY THE COMMUNITY OF ARTICLE 39 ( 5 ) OF THE \" ACT CONCERNING THE CONDITIONS OF ACCESSION AND THE ADJUSTMENTS TO THE TREATIES \" DRAWN UP AND ADOPTED WITHIN THE CONFERENCE BETWEEN THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES AND THE KINGDOM OF DENMARK
column52: IRELAND
column53: THE KINGDOM OF NORWAY AND THE UNITED KINGDOM OF GREAT BRITAIN AND NORTHERN IRELAND
column54: AS REGARDS THE SPECIFIC DUTIES OR THE SPECIFIC PART OF THE MIXED DUTIES IN THE IRISH CUSTOMS TARIFF
column55: ARTICLE 2 AND PROTOCOL NO 1 SHALL BE APPLIED
column56:
WITH ROUNDING TO THE FOURTH DECIMAL PLACE .  
ARTICLE 5  
1 . NO NEW CHARGE HAVING AN EFFECT EQUIVALENT TO A CUSTOMS DUTY ON IMPORTS SHALL BE INTRODUCED IN TRADE BETWEEN THE COMMUNITY AND AUSTRIA .  
2 . CHARGES HAVING AN EFFECT EQUIVALENT TO CUSTOMS DUTIES ON IMPORTS INTRODUCED ON OR AFTER 1 JANUARY 1972 IN TRADE BETWEEN THE COMMUNITY AND AUSTRIA SHALL BE ABOLISHED UPON THE ENTRY INTO FORCE OF THE AGREEMENT .  
ANY CHARGE HAVING AN EFFECT EQUIVALENT TO A CUSTOMS DUTY ON IMPORTS
column57: THE RATE OF WHICH ON 31 DECEMBER 1972 IS HIGHER THAN THAT ACTUALLY APPLIED ON 1 JANUARY 1972
column58: SHALL BE REDUCED TO THE LATTER RATE UPON THE ENTRY INTO FORCE OF THE AGREEMENT .  \n3 . WITHOUT PREJUDICE TO THE REDUCTIONS MADE UNDER ARTICLE 2 ( 2 ) OF THE INTERIM AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE MEMBER STATES OF THE EUROPEAN COAL AND STEEL COMMUNITY AND THE REPUBLIC OF AUSTRIA SIGNED THIS SAME DAY
column59:
CHARGES HAVING AN EFFECT EQUIVALENT TO CUSTOMS DUTIES ON IMPORTS SHALL BE PROGRESSIVELY ABOLISHED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE FOLLOWING TIMETABLE :  
 ( A ) BY 1 JANUARY 1974 AT THE LATEST EACH CHARGE SHALL BE REDUCED TO 60 % OF THE RATE APPLIED ON 1 JANUARY 1972 ;  
 ( B ) THREE FURTHER REDUCTIONS OF 20 % EACH SHALL BE MADE ON :  
1 JANUARY 1975  
1 JANUARY 1976  
1 JULY 1977 .  
AS REGARDS TRADE BETWEEN IRELAND AND AUSTRIA
column60:
AN INITIAL REDUCTION SHALL BE MADE ON 1 APRIL 1973 TO REDUCE EACH CHARGE HAVING AN EFFECT EQUIVALENT TO A CUSTOMS DUTY ON IMPORTS TO 80 % OF THE BASIC DUTY .  
ARTICLE 6  
NO CUSTOMS DUTY ON EXPORTS OR CHARGE HAVING EQUIVALENT EFFECT SHALL BE INTRODUCED IN TRADE BETWEEN THE COMMUNITY AND AUSTRIA .  
CUSTOMS DUTIES ON EXPORTS AND CHARGES HAVING EQUIVALENT EFFECT SHALL BE ABOLISHED NOT LATER THAN 1 JANUARY 1974 .  
ARTICLE 7  
PROTOCOL NO 1 LAYS DOWN THE TARIFF TREATMENT AND ARRANGEMENTS APPLICABLE TO CERTAIN PRODUCTS .  
ARTICLE 8  
THE PROVISIONS DETERMINING THE RULES OF ORIGIN FOR THE APPLICATION OF THE AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE EUROPEAN ECONOMIC COMMUNITY AND THE REPUBLIC OF AUSTRIA SIGNED THIS SAME DAY SHALL ALSO BE APPLICABLE TO THIS AGREEMENT .  
ARTICLE 9  
A CONTRACTING PARTY WHICH IS CONSIDERING THE REDUCTION OF THE EFFECTIVE LEVEL OF ITS DUTIES OR CHARGES HAVING EQUIVALENT EFFECT APPLICABLE TO THIRD COUNTRIES BENEFITING FROM MOST-FAVOURED-NATION TREATMENT
column61: OR WHICH IS CONSIDERING THE SUSPENSION OF THEIR APPLICATION
column62: SHALL
column63: AS FAR AS MAY BE PRACTICABLE
column64:
NOTIFY THE JOINT COMMITTEE NOT LESS THAN THIRTY DAYS BEFORE SUCH REDUCTION OR SUSPENSION COMES INTO EFFECT . IT SHALL TAKE NOTE OF ANY REPRESENTATIONS BY THE OTHER CONTRACTING PARTY REGARDING ANY DISTORTIONS WHICH MIGHT RESULT THEREFROM .  
ARTICLE 10  
1 . NO NEW QUANTITATIVE RESTRICTION ON IMPORTS OR MEASURE HAVING EQUIVALENT EFFECT SHALL BE INTRODUCED IN TRADE BETWEEN THE COMMUNITY AND AUSTRIA .  
2 . QUANTITATIVE RESTRICTIONS ON IMPORTS SHALL BE ABOLISHED ON 1 JANUARY 1973 AND ANY MEASURES HAVING AN EFFECT EQUIVALENT TO QUANTITATIVE RESTRICTIONS ON IMPORTS SHALL BE ABOLISHED NOT LATER THAN 1 JANUARY 1975 .  
ARTICLE 11  
FROM 1 JULY 1977 PRODUCTS ORIGINATING IN AUSTRIA MAY NOT ENJOY MORE FAVOURABLE TREATMENT WHEN IMPORTED INTO THE COMMUNITY THAN THAT APPLIED BY THE MEMBER STATES OF THE COMMUNITY BETWEEN THEMSELVES .  
ARTICLE 12  
THE AGREEMENT SHALL NOT MODIFY THE PROVISIONS OF THE TREATY ESTABLISHING THE EUROPEAN COAL AND STEEL COMMUNITY OR THE POWERS AND JURISDICTION DERIVING THEREFROM .  
ARTICLE 13  
THE AGREEMENT SHALL NOT PRECLUDE THE MAINTENANCE OR ESTABLISHMENT OF CUSTOMS UNIONS
column65: FREE TRADE AREAS OR ARRANGEMENTS FOR FRONTIER TRADE
column66: EXCEPT IN SO FAR AS THEY ALTER THE TRADE ARRANGEMENTS PROVIDED FOR IN THE AGREEMENT
column67: IN PARTICULAR THE PROVISIONS CONCERNING THE RULES OF ORIGIN .  \nARTICLE 14  \nTHE CONTRACTING PARTIES SHALL REFRAIN FROM ANY MEASURE OR PRACTICE OF AN INTERNAL FISCAL NATURE ESTABLISHING
column68: WHETHER DIRECTLY OR INDIRECTLY
column69:
DISCRIMINATION BETWEEN THE PRODUCTS OF ONE CONTRACTING PARTY AND LIKE PRODUCTS ORIGINATING IN THE TERRITORY OF THE OTHER CONTRACTING PARTY .  
PRODUCTS EXPORTED TO THE TERRITORY OF ONE OF THE CONTRACTING PARTIES MAY NOT BENEFIT FROM REPAYMENT OF INTERNAL TAXATION IN EXCESS OF THE AMOUNT OF DIRECT OR INDIRECT TAXATION IMPOSED ON THEM .  
ARTICLE 15  
PAYMENTS RELATING TO TRADE IN GOODS AND THE TRANSFER OF SUCH PAYMENTS TO THE MEMBER STATES OF THE COMMUNITY IN WHICH THE CREDITOR IS RESIDENT OR TO AUSTRIA SHALL BE FREE FROM ANY RESTRICTIONS .  
THE CONTRACTING PARTIES SHALL REFRAIN FROM ANY EXCHANGE OR ADMINISTRATIVE RESTRICTION ON THE GRANT
column70: REPAYMENT OR ACCEPTANCE OF SHORT - AND MEDIUM-TERM CREDITS COVERING COMMERCIAL TRANSACTIONS IN WHICH A RESIDENT PARTICIPATES .  \nARTICLE 16  \nTHE AGREEMENT SHALL NOT PRECLUDE PROHIBITIONS OR RESTRICTIONS ON IMPORTS
column71: EXPORTS OR GOODS IN TRANSIT JUSTIFIED ON GROUNDS OF PUBLIC MORALITY
column72: LAW AND ORDER OR PUBLIC SECURITY
column73: THE PROTECTION OF LIFE AND HEALTH OF HUMANS
column74: ANIMALS OR PLANTS
column75: THE PROTECTION OF NATIONAL TREASURES OF ARTISTIC
column76: HISTORIC OR ARCHAEOLOGICAL VALUE
column77: OR THE PROTECTION OF INDUSTRIAL AND COMMERCIAL PROPERTY . SUCH PROHIBITIONS OR RESTRICTIONS MUST NOT
column78: HOWEVER
column79:
CONSTITUTE A MEANS OF ARBITRARY DISCRIMINATION OR A DISGUISED RESTRICTION ON TRADE BETWEEN THE CONTRACTING PARTIES .  
ARTICLE 17  
NOTHING IN THE AGREEMENT SHALL PREVENT A CONTRACTING PARTY FROM TAKING ANY MEASURES :  
 ( A ) WHICH IT CONSIDERS NECESSARY TO PREVENT THE DISCLOSURE OF INFORMATION CONTRARY TO ITS ESSENTIAL SECURITY INTERESTS ;  
 ( B ) WHICH RELATE TO TRADE IN ARMS
column80: MUNITIONS OR WAR MATERIALS OR TO RESEARCH
column81: DEVELOPMENT OR PRODUCTION INDISPENSABLE FOR DEFENCE PURPOSES
column82:
PROVIDED THAT SUCH MEASURES DO NOT IMPAIR THE CONDITIONS OF COMPETITION IN RESPECT OF PRODUCTS NOT INTENDED FOR SPECIFICALLY MILITARY PURPOSES ;  
 ( C ) WHICH IT CONSIDERS ESSENTIAL TO ITS OWN SECURITY IN TIME OF WAR OR SERIOUS INTERNATIONAL TENSION .  
ARTICLE 18  
1 . THE CONTRACTING PARTIES SHALL REFRAIN FROM ANY MEASURE LIKELY TO JEOPARDIZE THE FULFILMENT OF THE OBJECTIVES OF THE AGREEMENT .  
2 . THEY SHALL TAKE ANY GENERAL OR SPECIFIC MEASURES REQUIRED TO FULFIL THEIR OBLIGATIONS UNDER THE AGREEMENT .  
IF EITHER CONTRACTING PARTY CONSIDERS THAT THE OTHER CONTRACTING PARTY HAS FAILED TO FULFIL AN OBLIGATION UNDER THE AGREEMENT
column83:
IT MAY TAKE APPROPRIATE MEASURES UNDER THE CONDITIONS AND IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE PROCEDURES LAID DOWN IN ARTICLE 24 .  
ARTICLE 19

ARTICLE 2  
IMPORTS TO WHICH THE TARIFF TREATMENT PROVIDED FOR IN ARTICLE 1 APPLIES SHALL BE SUBJECTED TO ANNUAL INDICATIVE CEILINGS ABOVE WHICH THE CUSTOMS DUTIES APPLICABLE IN RESPECT OF THIRD COUNTRIES MAY BE REINTRODUCED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE FOLLOWING PROVISIONS :  
 ( A ) TAKING INTO ACCOUNT THAT THE COMMUNITY AND ITS MEMBER STATES HAVE THE RIGHT TO SUSPEND APPLICATION OF CEILINGS FOR CERTAIN PRODUCTS
column271: THE CEILINGS FOR 1973 ARE SHOWN IN ANNEX C TO PROTOCOL NO 1 TO THE AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE EUROPEAN ECONOMIC COMMUNITY AND THE REPUBLIC OF AUSTRIA SIGNED THIS SAME DAY . FROM 1 JANUARY 1974 THE LEVEL OF THE CEILINGS SHALL BE RAISED ANNUALLY BY 5 % .  \nFOR PRODUCTS COVERED BY THIS PROTOCOL BUT NOT INCLUDED IN THAT ANNEX
column272: THE COMMUNITY AND ITS MEMBER STATES RESERVE THE RIGHT TO INTRODUCE CEILINGS OF WHICH THE LEVELS WILL BE EQUAL TO THE AVERAGE AMOUNT OF IMPORTS INTO THE COMMUNITY OVER THE LAST FOUR YEARS FOR WHICH STATISTICS ARE AVAILABLE
column273: INCREASED BY 5 % ; FOR THE FOLLOWING YEARS THE LEVELS OF THESE CEILINGS SHALL BE RAISED ANNUALLY BY 5 % .  \n ( B ) SHOULD
column275: IMPORTS OF A PRODUCT SUBJECT TO A CEILING BE LESS THAN 90 % OF THE LEVEL FIXED
column276: THE COMMUNITY AND ITS MEMBER STATES SHALL SUSPEND THE APPLICATION OF THIS CEILING .  \n ( C ) IN THE EVENT OF SHORT-TERM ECONOMIC DIFFICULTIES
column277: THE COMMUNITY AND ITS MEMBER STATES RESERVE THE RIGHT
column278: AFTER CONSULTATION WITHIN THE JOINT COMMITTEE
column279: TO MAINTAIN FOR A YEAR THE LEVEL FIXED FOR THE PRECEDING YEAR .  \n ( D ) ON 1 DECEMBER EACH YEAR THE COMMUNITY AND ITS MEMBER STATES SHALL NOTIFY THE JOINT COMMITTEE OF THE LIST OF PRODUCTS SUBJECT TO CEILINGS IN THE FOLLOWING YEAR AND OF THE LEVELS OF THE CEILINGS .  \n ( E ) NOTWITHSTANDING ARTICLE 2 OF THE AGREEMENT AND ARTICLE 1 OF THIS PROTOCOL

DECLARATIONS  
INTERPRETATIVE DECLARATION CONCERNING THE MEANING OF THE EXPRESSION " CONTRACTING PARTIES " APPEARING IN THE AGREEMENT  
THE CONTRACTING PARTIES AGREE TO INTERPRET THE AGREEMENT IN THE SENSE THAT THE EXPRESSION  " CONTRACTING PARTIES " APPEARING IN THE SAID AGREEMENT MEANS
column338: THE COMMUNITY AND THE MEMBER STATES
column339: OR SOLELY THE MEMBER STATES OR THE COMMUNITY AND
column341: AUSTRIA . THE MEANING TO BE GIVEN IN EACH CASE TO THIS EXPRESSION WILL BE DEDUCED FROM THE PROVISIONS IN QUESTION OF THE AGREEMENT AND FROM THE CORRESPONDING PROVISIONS OF THE TREATY ESTABLISHING THE EUROPEAN COAL AND STEEL COMMUNITY .  \nDECLARATION BY THE EUROPEAN COAL AND STEEL COMMUNITY CONCERNING ARTICLE 19(1 ) OF THE AGREEMENT  \nTHE EUROPEAN COAL AND STEEL COMMUNITY DECLARES THAT IN THE CONTEXT OF THE AUTONOMOUS IMPLEMENTATION OF ARTICLE 19(1 ) OF THE AGREEMENT IT WILL ASSESS ANY PRACTICES CONTRARY TO THIS ARTICLE ON THE BASIS OF CRITERIA ARISING FROM THE APPLICATION OF THE RULES OF ARTICLES 4(C )
column343: AND 66(7 ) OF THE TREATY ESTABLISHING THE EUROPEAN COAL AND STEEL COMMUNITY .  \nDECLARATION BY THE GOVERNMENT OF THE FEDERAL REPUBLIC OF GERMANY CONCERNING APPLICATION OF THE AGREEMENT TO BERLIN  \nTHE AGREEMENT IS ALSO APPLICABLE TO LAND BERLIN
column344: IN SO FAR AS THE GOVERNMENT OF THE FEDERAL REPUBLIC OF GERMANY DOES NOT MAKE A DECLARATION TO THE CONTRARY WITHIN THREE MONTHS OF THE ENTRY INTO FORCE OF THE AGREEMENT ."'
